 Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennen zu lernen! Schicke uns bitte Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellungen) per E-Mail an recruiting@advyce.com oder nutze unser Kontaktformular. Bei Rückfragen kannst Du Dich gerne jederzeit per E-Mail an unser Recruiting-Team wenden.

Job_Title: Machine Learning & Data Scientist Engineer  Im Innovation Lab
Description:
Stellenangebot: Machine Learning & Data Scientist Engineer (m/w/d) im Innovation Lab, deutschlandweit
Hey,
ich bin Felix, seit 5 Jahren bei ponturo und mittlerweile Manager. Als Leiter unseres Innovation Labs verfolge ich stets die neuesten Technologien und begleite so unsere Kund*innen auf dem Weg zu einer hochmodernen IT-Infrastruktur.
Jetzt suchen wir dich!
Bei ponturo machen mein Team und ich unsere Kund*innen fit für die Zukunft. Für namhafte Banken und Versicherungen im In- und Ausland führen wir Digitalisierungsvorhaben und Prozessoptimierungen durch. Dafür setzen wir SAP-Lösungen intelligent ein. Denn statt 08/15-Prozessen arbeiten wir immer mit Wegen, die individuellen Ansprüchen gerecht werden. Bei ponturo begegnen wir uns stets auf Augenhöhe, wachsen miteinander und werden entsprechend unserer persönlichen Stärken und Potenziale gefördert.
Wir freuen uns auf dich als Machine Learning & Data Scientist Engineer*in. Bei ponturo legen wir großen Wert auf eine Unternehmenskultur, die Spaß an der Arbeit und engen Kollegenzusammenhalt fördert. Das betrifft einerseits vor allem die Durchführung von Team-Events und andererseits einen von Respekt und Offenheit geprägten Umgang. Wir setzen hier auf kurze Entscheidungswege, zufriedene Mitarbeiter*innen und ein echtes Miteinander. Wenn du in einem von Menschlichkeit geprägten Umfeld an anspruchsvollen IT-Projekten in Verbindung mit neuesten technologischen Themenbereichen wie Machine Learning (ML), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Künstliche Intelligenz (KI), Data Science oder Blockchain arbeiten und jeden Tag wachsen möchtest, bist du hier richtig.
Dein neues Aufgabenfeld
Ganzheitlicher Ansatz:  Zusammen mit deinem Innovation Team untersuchst du neueste IT-Technologien wie ML, RPA, KI und Blockchain und entwickelst darauf aufbauend zukunftsweisende Applikationen.
Dein Wirkungsbereich:  Neben der Datenanalyse, Konzeption und Softwareentwicklung bist du für die Implementierung der erstellten IT-Lösungen bei unseren Kund*innen verantwortlich.
Freie Räume:  Dabei hast du viel Freiheit, um deine Ideen einzubringen und Digitalisierungsprojekte im Finanzsektor voranzutreiben.
Kompetenzaufbau:  Als visierte/r Softwareentwickler*in in Python, Java und / oder R schärfst du deine Kompetenzen in weiteren IT-Themenbereichen und baust deine Programmierkenntnisse im SAP-Umfeld, u.a. in ABAP auf.
Unser Match
Die solide Basis:  Ein Studium in den Bereichen Informatik, Mathematik oder Naturwissenschaften ist die Grundlage für die Kenntnisse, die du bei ponturo täglich anwendest und stetig ausbauen wirst. Du bist fit als Software Developer*in und hast Erfahrung im produktiven Einsatz von Methoden des klassischen Machine Learning, des Deep Learning, des Blockchain und / oder Künstlicher Intelligenz.
Dein Anspruch:  Für Erfolge verantwortlich zu sein, motiviert dich. Mit eigenen Ideen und großem Interesse an innovativen Technologien und Trends zeigst du gern Initiative. Du bist ein guter Team-Player und liebst es auch, eigenständig zu arbeiten.
Eine Persönlichkeitsfrage:  Deine Kommunikationsstärke in Deutsch und Englisch überzeugt, dein Organisationstalent hält dir stets den Rücken frei und mit deiner Empathie trägst du zur Gestaltung einer angenehmen Arbeitsumgebung bei.
Einsatzbereitschaft: Wir setzen auf deine Flexibilität und Reisebereitschaft. Du unterstützt uns in den Geschäftsräumen unserer Kunden, bei uns im Büro und/oder remote.
Darauf kannst du dich freuen
Faire Konditionen:  Du erhältst einen unbefristeten Vertrag, ein sehr gutes Gehalt und kannst deinen Wohnort beibehalten.
Weitreichenden Support:  Du stehst in engem Austausch mit erfahrenen Kollegen*innen, die dich bei deinen Aufgaben gerne unterstützen.
Starken Rückenwind:  Du erhältst Unterstützung bei deiner weiteren Spezialisierung sowie entsprechenden Zertifizierungen in den neuesten Technologien.
Gelebtes Miteinander:  Ein offener, vertrauens- und respektvoller Umgang miteinander, Firmenevents sowie Team- und Sportaktivitäten sorgen dafür, dass du gerne zur Arbeit kommst.
Neugierig geworden?
Wenn du in Zukunft Unternehmen bereit für die Welt von morgen machen willst, freue ich mich auf dich als neue Kollegin / neuen Kollegen. Bei Fragen wende dich gerne an Katarzyna Reufsteck unter: 069 2578267110.
Dein Kollege bei ponturo, Wilhelm-Leuschner-Straße 81, 60329 Frankfurt am Main
Art der Stelle: Festanstellung
Arbeitszeiten:

Keine Wochenenden
Montag bis Freitag

Leistungen:

Betriebliche Weiterbildung
Betriebsfeiern
Empfehlungsprogramm
Erfolgsbeteiligung
Firmenhandy
Kinderbetreuung
Kostenlose Getränke
Kostenloser Parkplatz
Sabbatical
Zusätzliche Urlaubstage

Möglichkeit zu pendeln/umzuziehen:

München: bereit sein zu pendeln oder vor Antritt der Stelle einen Umzug zu planen (Wünschenswert)

Ausbildung:

Bachelor (Erforderlich)

Sprache:

Deutsch (Erforderlich)

Dein Beitrag zur Vilua Vision:

    Unterstütze unser Team als Data Scientist (m/w/d) in München. Erforsche Viluas KI zur Gesunderhaltung und übernimm die Gestaltung abwechslungsreicher, komplexer Studien im Healthcare-Bereich und setze diese um.
   
 Außerdem leistest Du folgenden Beitrag:
   
 Durch Dein fachliches Know-How gelingt es Dir Methoden des Machine Learnings, Data Minings und der Statistik zur Entwicklung einer Gesundheits-KI zu entwickeln und integrieren
 Zudem hast Du eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise, kommst auf den Punkt und scheust keine Deadlines
 Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die fachliche Anleitung Deiner Data Engineer Kollegen in Projekten und führst diese zum Ziel
 Du nutzt unsere Forschungsprojekte proaktiv zur Beantwortung von wissenschaftlichen Fragestellungen im Healthcare-Bereich vom Konzept bis zur Publikation
 Du managst Data Science Projekte über alle Phasen und bist Ansprechpartner für interne und externe Stakeholder
 Du visualisierst die Ergebnisse und Ableitungen in Tabellen, PowerPoint, interaktivem Dashboard, Bericht oder Publikation und kannst dieses für jede Zielgruppe verständlich, nachvollziehbar und überzeugend präsentieren
 Du unterstützt im Salesprozess und der Produktentwicklung und bringst Reisebereitschaft mit
 Du arbeitest proaktiv an der Datenintegration mit und verpflichtest Dich einer hohen Datenqualität, Datensicherheit und dem Datenschutz

 Lass Dich von den Möglichkeiten von Gesundheitsdaten begeistern und werde Teil unseres Teams.
  


 Das braucht Vilua von Dir:

    Dein Studium der Informatik, Statistik oder verwandten Bereichen hast Du erfolgreich abgeschlossen und verfügst über mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Scientist. Zudem hast Du Erfahrung in SQL, No-SQL und Analysesprachen wie R, Python oder ähnlichen.
    Zudem zeigst Du:

 Beratungskompetenz, Einsatzbereitschaft und Kreativität in der Projektplanung und Umsetzung
 Fundiertes theoretisches und praktisches Wissen der Methoden im Machine Learning und Data Mining
 Lust, neue ML-Methoden zu entwickeln und in forschungsähnlichem Umfeld erproben
 Die Fähigkeit, mit unseren Kunden gute Produkte zu entwickeln, die für unsere Nutzer einen Mehrwert bieten
 Die Fähigkeit, komplexe Themen rasch in aussagekräftige Grafiken und Stories zu verwandeln
 Strukturierte Arbeitsweise und die Finalisierung von Projekten in Time, Scope und Budget
 Reisebereitschaft
 Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit

 Erfahrungen im Healtcare-Bereich sind ein großes Plus. Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Dein Profil ab.



 Das bietet dir Vilua:


 Ein spannendes und vielseitiges Arbeitsumfeld bei einem innovativen und modernen Arbeitgeber
 Ein angenehmes Betriebsklima in einem engagierten, dynamischen Team
 Eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung
 Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle mit breiter Homeoffice-Möglichkeit sowie moderne Arbeitsplätze
 Flache Hierarchien und kurze Kommunikationswege




 Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

    Dann los!
   
 Bitte stelle uns Deinen Lebenslauf unter Angabe Deines möglichen Starttermins und Deiner Gehaltsangaben über den Button 
   "Bewerben" oder 
   Jobs@vilua.de zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns darauf, von Dir zu hören und mit Dir gemeinsam unsere Vision der Gesunderhaltung zu verwirklichen!

Wilson Sporting Goods is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of sports equipment and is owned by Amer Sports. Wilson designs, manufactures and distributes sporting goods throughout the world and focuses on making technologically advanced products which help players of all level perform better. Wilson’s core categories include: Football, Basketball, Baseball, Volleyball, Soccer, Youth Sports, Uniforms/Apparel, Golf, Footwear and Racquet Sports (Tennis, Racquetball, Squash, Badminton, and Platform Tennis).
  







POSITION TITLE:


Sales & Operations Analyst (m/w/d
)





LOCATION:


Garching near Munich







The Sales & Operations Analyst works with the sales and service teams to analyze, identify and drive current and future sales. This role also works with the Wilson supply and demand team to optimize inventory for the EMEA markets.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily:
    

Order book maintenance, including daily/monthly order allocations, preparing for product launches, and moving old/excess inventory
Identify and pursue areas to increase sales, market share, and generate new business through a consultative sales approach
Work alongside supply team to develop and maintain demand plans for key accounts
Develop new business opportunities by creating strategic sales / promotional ideas
Communicate with the warehouse regarding priority purchase orders and purchase order updates
Partner with the sales and account teams to develop regional and promotional opportunities based on market share data, trends, and the market’s competitive landscape
Review sales orders and buying plans and make adjustments as needed


REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a sales or customer service environment; additional experience will be considered in lieu of a degree
Previous experience with research/analysis, buying/replenishment, marketing, or customer service in a consumer products organization
Demand planning, supply planning, logistics experience preferred


QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIES
 The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
    

Proven ability to identify and generate recommendations through strategic and actionable analysis
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of management
Ability to effectively communicate and present to all levels of the organization as well as external customers, vendors, and business partners
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, strong knowledge of Excel is essential
Good operational SAP knowledge of the SD & MM Module


WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:


    • Generous staff discounts across Amer brand portfolio
   

Company pension scheme
An interesting role in a challenging industry
Professional development opportunities
The opportunity for independent and self-reliant work
A friendly and vibrant working environment in a dynamic and international team

 Please submit your application online.
    When making the application, please state your salary expectation related to this role.

Looking for new opportunities in one of Germany's top environmental tech startups? Air pollution is one of the biggest challenges of our times. This is why Hawa Dawa ("Air Medicine") was founded in 2016, with the vision to digitise and revolutionise the air quality management market.
 We are an interdisciplinary and growing team of professionals combining expert knowledge in air quality measurement, epidemiology, data science, clean mobility, business, software and IOT hardware. The foundation of our work is the data we generate for our customers: we pride ourselves in producing reliable and solid products that are relevant for air quality measurement, smart city products, new mobility services and more.  Behind good products are great people - and we currently require additional (wo)man power to continue developing our internal sensor calibration and management software. For this position, we are looking for someone with a number of years experience developing and applying machine learning algorithms for in-production systems. You will work primarily with Python code and SQL (relational) databases. Substantively, you will work at our core and unique technical proposition - where we use software and ML to process the raw measurements of our sensors and leverage their output to a quality level, which so far only much more expensive hardware was able to reach. Focusing on writing good code will be one of your key tasks. Occasionally, you will be asked to present and explain technical concepts to others in the company as well as external stakeholders. You will be a valued member of our software team from day one, planning and implementing tasks together using an agile methodology. Your efforts will be key to ensuring our air pollution sensor network creates high quality output and functions at a global scale.  Our headquarters are located in the heart of Munich, within walking distance to the Theresienwiese and very accessible with public transportation or bike.  Hawa Dawa is a young clean-tech company with a big dream. You’ll be a part of a team founded on open-mindedness, enthusiasm and impact on the environmental health. You can find out more about us on our careers page.
 What you bring:

 University degree in a technical field,
 Previous experience developing machine learning algorithms for time series data from sensors in IOT sensor networks
 Very good programming skills in Python
 Good knowledge working with databases using SQL
 Experience with MLOps in cloud-based systems, ideally using Kubernetes on Microsoft Azure
 Knowledge of R would be advantageous
 Research experience with air pollution sensors would be valuable
 Any experience working with JavaScript/Typescript/Node.js/React is a plus, as we use these elsewhere in our stack

Tasks






Analyse complex data sets, identify volume trends and user behaviours.

 







Translate results into actionable tasks for our Real Time Management and Workforce Planning Team.









Build and maintain complex statistical models for demand prediction.









Handle performance related enquiries and provide ad-hoc data analysis on a short notice.











Qualifications





First work experience in data science or data analysis






Deep knowledge of Python, SQL and Tableau/PowerBI - Grafana is a plus






Relevant degree in data science or statistics






First work experience in forecasting









We offer





State-of-the-art technologies around AI and machine learning in a fast-growing market with us as the market leader in Germany already






A choice of career models to suit your skills and preferences






A fair salary model that is being aligned to balance inflation every year






Epic summer parties that keep the company talking with enthusiasm for weeks

Vertragsart: Vollzeit, unbefristet Standort: München, Düsseldorf, Berlin (Teltow), Nürnberg, Hamburg Eintritt: ab nächstmöglichem Zeitpunkt


Working anywhere. Nach erfolgreichem Bewerbungsprozess, hast Du die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit zu arbeiten. Du wirst entsprechend Deinem Wohnort, dem nächsten Telefónica Standort zugeordnet. Weitere Details besprechen wir mit Dir im Bewerbungsprozess. 
Wer wir sind?
Wir sind o2/Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kund:innen mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere Fest- und Mobilfunknetze bilden das Rückgrat für den digitalen Wandel von Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft. Und unsere rund 8.000 Mitarbeiter:innen hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen.


Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit 114.000 engagierten Mitarbeiter:innen weltweit.


Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen!


 Was sind Deine Herausforderungen bei uns?

Analyse und Aufbereitung der Datenmengen sowie Definition und Erstellung geeigneter Prozesse zur automatisierten Weiterverarbeitung auf Basis von Datenbanken
Erstellung von Prototypen zur Erfassung, Verarbeitung und Qualitätskontrolle von Daten und Systemen
Strukturierung der Datenbasis (CAPEX/OPEX/RoU/KPIs) des Technology-Bereichs
Visualisierung der Ergebnisse in entsprechenden Tools (Tableau, Power BI) und Präsentationen auf Management-Level
Bereitstellung finanzieller und qualitativer Entscheidungsparameter
Synchronisation der Netzwerk- und IT-Datengrundlage
Pflege und Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden OPEX-/CAPEX-Datenbanken, mit dem Ziel einer konsistenten Integration in den Planungs- und Analyseprozess
Aufbereitung der Daten als Grundlage für künftige Entscheidungen im Unternehmen
Erstellung von Präsentationen anhand der ausgewerteten Daten
Vorbereitung und Durchführung von Qualitätskontrollen
Verbesserung der Tool-Chain im Bereich Technology Financial Management unter dem Aspekt einer weitgehenden Automatisierung
häufige Projektleitung mittlerer bzw. Teilprojektleitung in größeren Projekten innerhalb übergreifender Themengebiete inklusive Erstellung ökonomischer Bewertungen als Entscheidungsvorlage für das Management
Die Tätigkeit ist weitgehend eigenständig innerhalb der Policy; nur seltene Abstimmung der Meilensteine und Ergebnisse mit dem Vorgesetzten


 
Was bringst Du mit?

Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Abschluss BWL, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Ingenieur, Elektrotechnik) oder vergleichbare Berufsausbildung
Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Gebiet Data Science oder vergleichbar idealerweise in der Telekommunikationsbranche
Detaillierte Kenntnisse im Bereich Big Data (Strukturierung, Analyse, Aufbereitung, Automatisierung sowie Prozesspflege)
Kenntnisse im Gebiet Technology (IT und/oder Netzwerk in einem Telekommunikations-, IT- oder High-Tech-Unternehmen)
Kenntnisse angrenzender Fachgebiete wie z.B. Controlling, Reporting, Accounting
Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Veränderungsprozessen
Sehr gute Verhandlungs- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Hohe Belastbarkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und Durchsetzungsvermögen in einem dynamischen Umfeld
Starke Teamorientierung, Motivationsfähigkeit und Organisationstalent
Strukturierte, eigenverantwortliche und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise mit hoher Eigeninitiative
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englisch-Kenntnisse
Unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln, innovative und kreative Herangehensweisen


 
Deine Benefits
Arbeitsplatz: Moderne und ergonomisch ausgestattete Büroräume, sowie ein Open Space und Open Desk-Modell.
Kommunikation: Ein Smartphone Deiner Wahl zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner:innen, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich.
Für Verpflegung ist gesorgt: Kostenlose Kaffeespezialitäten und Wasser stehen Dir jederzeit zur Verfügung ebenso wie eine Kantine und eine Cafeteria.
Weiterentwicklung ganz individuell: Mit persönlichem Entwicklungsplan und kontinuierlichen Trainings erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele. Zudem kannst Du mit „Beyond“ auch in andere interessante Bereiche mittels Job- oder Projektrotationen reinschnuppern.
Altersvorsorge: Verschiedene Modelle der Altersvorsorge stehen Dir zur Verfügung (z. B. Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge etc.)
Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen, Du hast die Möglichkeit z. B. an Telefónica „Volunteering Days“ oder „Volunteering Holidays“ teilzunehmen.
Gesundheit: Unter FEEL GOOD findest Du ein vielfältiges Angebot für Deine persönliche Gesundheit und die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Freizeit. Es reicht von Bewegungs- und Entspannungsangeboten über Webinare und Kooperationen bis hin zu einem umfassenden Beratungsangebot zu Kinder- und Seniorenbetreuung sowie psychosozialer Beratung.

From:

        Immediately
      


Your work environment

       MAN Truck & Bus ist einer der führenden europäischen Nutzfahrzeughersteller und Anbieter von Transportlösungen. Das Produktportfolio umfasst Transporter, Lkw, Busse, Diesel- und Gasmotoren sowie Dienstleistungen rund um Personenbeförderung und Gütertransport. MAN Truck & Bus ist ein Unternehmen der TRATON GROUP und beschäftigt weltweit mehr als 36 000 Mitarbeiter. 
        Tag für Tag möchten wir Grenzen überwinden und unsere technologisch führenden Produkte immer noch besser machen. Eine Karriere bei MAN Truck & Bus bietet unzählige Möglichkeiten, sich an diesem Wandel zu beteiligen. Respekt, Teamgeist, Entschlossenheit, Kundenorientierung und Integrität – das sind unsere Unternehmenswerte, die wir bei MAN leben. Für Ideen, die begeistern. Für Veränderungen, die bewegen.
      


Job Purpose/Role

       Als Datenanalyst im Big Data Team der MAN spezialisieren Sie sich auf das Analysieren und Auswerten von Daten sowie das Visualisieren und Interpretieren von Analyseergebnissen. Der Fokus liegt auf der Unterstützung der verschiedenen Fachbereiche bei der Produkt- und Prozessverbesserung durch Story Telling und anschauliche Datenaufbereitungen im jeweiligen Fachkontext. 
       
 Erstellung von Dashboards und Reports
       



Aufnahme der Anforderungen an Dashboards und Reports aus dem Fachbereich Engineering  
Diskussion und Entwicklung der wichtigsten Indikatoren und Metriken für die angeforderten   Dashboards und Reports  
Generieren von standardisierten und Fachbereichs-spezifischen Reports und Dashboards  
Aufbau von individuellen Datenvisualisierungen (z.B. Tableau, AWS QuickSight, Kibana)  
Sicherstellen, dass erstelle Analysen und Erkenntnisse valide und vertrauenswürdig sind   Analyse und Interpretation von Daten  
Methodische Analyse von größeren Datenmengen und verständliche Aufbereitung für Endnutzer  
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen basierend auf Analysen und Interpreation  
Eigenverantwortliche Abstimmung und Koordination von Arbeitsergebnissen   Weiterentwicklung  
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen Data Scientists  
Weiterentwicklung in Data Science Themen und Mitarbeit and Data Science Use Cases  
Tägliche Zusammenarbeit mit dem Big Data Team sowie Teil der Entwicklung und des Wachstums des Teams




Your qualifications


Sie haben Ihr Studium in der Fachrichtung (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder Betriebswirtschaft mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt erfolgreich abgeschlossen  
Sie bringen mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Datenanalyse mit und haben im Optimalfall – Erfahrung im Entwicklungs-/Engineering-Umfeld gesammelt  
Mit dem Erstellen von Abfragen mit SQL (z.B. MySQL, PostgreSQL, AWS Athena) sind Sie vertraut  
Grundlegende Kenntnisse in R oder Python bringen Sie ebenso mit wie Kenntnisse im Umgang mit gängigen BI Tools zur interaktiven Datenanalyse  
Ein Verständnis für Data & Analytics sowie ein sicherer Umgang mit gängigen Kollaborationstools (z.B. Jira, Confluence) wird vorausgesetzt  
Sie haben ein Gefühl für Reporting-KPIs und identifizieren Muster aus komplexen Sachverhalten und können diese in verständlicher Form aufbereiten

Job_Title: Senior Web Analyst @ Accenture Song (All Genders)
Description:
Du hast eine Leidenschaft für anspruchsvolle analytische Aufgaben, kannst Dich immer wieder in andere Geschäftsmodelle hineindenken und hast Lust digitale Plattformen verschiedenster Märkte und Branchen nachhaltig für den Nutzer und das Business zu verbessern? Im Team Data helfen wir unseren Kunden, interaktive Konsumenten besser zu verstehen und anzusprechen sowie strategische und operative Maßnahmen mit Daten und Analysen zu unterstützen. Unsere Projekte umfassen dabei alle Tätigkeiten von Toolauswahl und Konzeption über Deep-Dive-Analysen und Handlungsempfehlungen bis zur Begleitung von Tests und Personalisierungsmaßnahmen.

 Was dich bei uns erwartet: 

Du betreust eigenständig end-to-end Analyticsprojekte von Anforderungsworkshops über die Konzeption und Implementierung bis zu Auswertungen und Optimierungsvorschlägen
 Du stehst im direkten Kontakt mit operativen und strategischen Ansprechpartnern, berätst diese proaktiv mit eigenen Themen und entwickelst den Kunden somit langfristig

 Du bereitest Insights in Dashboards und Präsentationen auf, schaffst es, auch komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich zu transportieren und unterstützt bei der Etablierung einer data-informed culture bei unseren Kunden
 Du hast keine Angst über den Tellerrand zu schauen und berätst unsere Kunden auch bei A/B-Testing, Verzahnung mit Marketing-Tools, Nutzerführung durch Personalisierung, Integration von CRM-Daten und Verwendung von angrenzenden Methoden, wie Umfragen oder Heatmaps


 Das bieten wir:

 Spannende und innovative Projekte mit namhaften Unternehmen
 Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und Raum für Eigenverantwortung
 Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung
 Großes, vielfältiges Team zum Erfahrungsaustausch und gegenseitigen Lernen
 Angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre, kurze Entscheidungswege und ein dynamisches, innovatives Team




Dein Profil: 

Du bist im Bereich Digital Analytics zu Hause und hast hervorragende Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von Digital Analytics Tools wie z.B Adobe Analytics oder Google Analytics
 Du bringst ein starkes Verständnis von Web-Technologien und sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Tracking, insbesondere zu Tag Management Systemen mit
 Du besitzt idealerweise Grundkenntnisse in Statistik, JavaScript und Online-Marketing, Grundkenntnisse in SQL sind ein Plus

 Job summary
  “Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and, when the box arrived, you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you?
  Amazon Logistics (AMZL) is Amazon's "Last Mile" delivery service, responsible for delivering packages to customers across the world. The AMZL network is undergoing quick growth and change on a global scale. Our teams are changing the way we interact with customers every single day and solving some of the biggest logistical issues facing not just Amazon, but the entire industry. AMZL is developing an innovative world-class Last Mile operation with a portfolio of buildings, vehicles, and technology to deliver customers' packages on time and tailored to our ever-changing customer expectations. AMZL Finance teams partner closely with global cross-functional business and tech teams to support this rapidly expanding business; promoting controllership, innovation, productivity, and cost-effective operations across the network in a fast paced environment.
  Our business is delivering smiles to our customers by ensuring on-time deliveries with the highest quality in a safe environment where people like to come to work every day. You will make history as you help build one of the largest carriers on the planet while having fun.”
 
 OVERVIEW
  We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst that is excited to join a tech company that is constantly improving and reimagining the logistics industry. Our candidate should be passionate about using data to solve big, complex and ambiguous problems. The candidate should be eager to continuously learn and improve their skills. You should be attentive to which details make all the difference. Do you want to contribute shaping the new standard of shopping? If so, come and join the AMZL Finance Team.
 
 As part of the AMZL Finance team, you will join a team that is motivated about numbers, data, and how to use them to generate insights and improve our business. We support and influence the AMZL organization by providing a holistic and financial perspective, we are the trusted business advisors. We collaborate with our partners to ensure leaders to have the most up to date and reliable information, and work with them to make sure AMZL is making the best possible decisions.
 

 RESPONSIBILITIES
 

 Leverage Amazon Logistic metrics to identify cost out opportunities by linking up operations and financials. Understands the details of the cost structure to make thoughtful judgement calls in ambiguous environments where data may be difficult to procure.
 Build trusted partnership with the business to influence and support tactical and strategic business decisions promoting business improvements and cost reductions. Communicates data (both written and verbal) in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner. Your communications drive critical business actions.
 Identifies risks, evaluates impact, proposes changes, and implements improvements to remediate gaps. Identify opportunities and lead projects to streamline processes and reports
 Supervise and own the Financial and operational planning processes to produce a challenging/stretch/bold yet solid operational plan. Supervise and own all Month-end procedures including accruals and variance analysis between scenarios (actuals, Plan, Forecast...)
 Hire, develop and mentor peers and team members, while promoting knowledge-sharing

 LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES
 

 Autonomy to innovate and deliver new approaches that impact the bottom and the top line
 Grow and collaborate in a fast-pace environment where every day is day one
 Being surrounded by inspiring and diverse individuals
 Learn from people and cooperate with a wide variety of professional backgrounds
 Ability to develop new skills and opportunities through lateral, geographical or functional moves





Passion for diving into the vast and complex details of productivity and cost measurements
 Willingness to support an unpopular opinion if it is in favor of the customer
 Manage and prioritize workload and work towards multiple deadlines
 Demonstrated business acumen while influencing and managing cross-functional relationships
 Action-oriented in solving challenging business and technical issues. Detail oriented and a passion for data with the ability to accurately summarize and share the relevant details

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Job Description: 
A vacancy for a Solution Architect (d/f/m) has arisen within Airbus Defence and Space in Ottobrunn. The successful applicant will join the “Architecture Management Team”. 
 Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration. 

We are looking for a Solution Architect to design NaDINE environment for FCAS (specially focus on infrastructure and applications). As a transversal architect you have to be capable of going through and learning new technologies according to the speed of change of the Digital arena (main domains to be covered are big data, artificial intelligence, augmented reality, IoT, Collaboration, Mobility...). You will be involved in projects and initiatives running under the Airbus Digital Capabilities. 

The solution architect: 

Is the technical leader to define, design and implement a common working environment considering complexity, maturity, integrity, scalability, maintainability and user experience to effectively meet business needs across. 
Is responsible for the Architecture Dossier (ARD) for the projects that is supporting/ participating, where the customer needs and functional requirements are translated into technical specifications, defining and promoting optimal technical solutions with partner and customers. 
Collaborates with other Architects, systems analysts, and developers to deliver the highest quality solutions via cutting edge technologies. 
Defines and maintains standards, best practices, golden rules, reference patterns for solutions and produces key reference blueprints for the main platform components to guide solution decisions and recommends alternatives when needed 
Aligns architecture strategy with the organization's business goals and long-term DTO strategic, aligning with other DTO stakeholders (i.e. IT and IM security). 
Helps to solve integration problems over different networks and different security constraints using security standards. 
Acts as visionary to proactively assist in defining the direction for future IT Products & Services and validates product designs. 
Provides expertise on business processes, change management transformation, function improvement and technology enablement. 


Your Profile: 

several years of experience in modern Infrastructure Architecture/Service Architecture 
passion for new technologies and willingness to learn according to the speed of change of the digital arena 
highly creative thinker with business outcome orientation 
ability to grasp complex and diverse topics quickly 
solid communication and interpersonal skills are a must: good communication skills towards different stakeholders, good negotiation skills and the ability to communicate complex matters in an approachable way 
desire to work in an international and multicultural environment 
willingness to travel occasionally 
solid understanding of modern technology platforms would be a plus: you have created cloud-native applications, large-scale Hadoop, Kubernetes, Spark / Kafka clusters before 
knowledge of DevSecOps principles and implementation would be desirable 
solid understanding of infrastructure as a code (IaC) principles and bare metal clouds and also software defined datacenter infrastructure architecture (Compute, Network, Storage) 
knowledge of security concepts in a military environment would be a major plus, i.e. government (NATO / OCCAR restricted) environments or critical infrastructure 
languages: English at negotiation level, additional languages (i.e. French, German, Spanish) are a plus 


This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth. 

Company: Airbus Defence and Space GmbH 
 
Contract Type: Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido 
 
Experience Level: Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional 
 
Job Family: Information Mgmt and Digital Technology <JF-IM-DI> 
 
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.  Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. 
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . 

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution-oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin, Munich, and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists, data scientists and organizers. We are working on international data science projects for our clients such as Audi, Adidas, Coca-Cola, Miele, Telefonica, and BMW. For our team we are looking for a junior consultant in the field of data-driven trend and marketing research.
 That’s you
 You have a passion for research, innovation and understanding consumer behaviour? You possess an innate curiosity and a keen eye for interesting trends and future developments? And you are keen to master data, analytics and tools for smarter and more informed decision making? Then take your chance and join our team of data-driven trend & marketing consultants. Whether performing market, consumer, or technology research, identifying latest trends, or preparing your findings – you will be fully involved in the trend and marketing research process using a wide range of state-of-the-art analytical techniques and tools. As a member of our Data Intelligence team, you ask and answer shrewd questions, face critical analysis with strategic foresight, and turn data into insights. You support our clients to transform their brands and future strategies – based on smart data.


 Your tasks will include:

Being a valuable part of our team, consisting of consultants, data scientists, innovators, design thinkers and trend and marketing researchers.
Work with various digital data sources (Trend Sonar Tool, Google Search, Social Listening, etc.) to generate trend, market, and consumer insights.
Systematically, continuous, and data-driven exploration, identification and analysis of market, technology, and consumer trends
Trend and topic-specific data mining, integrating, and unifying of data from various sources for trend and market research and continuous trend monitoring
Qualitative and quantitative deep dive analysis of consumer, trend, and market data, to derive meaningful insights on market dynamics and future trends
Create insightful reports, content, and client presentations and collaborate closely with a wide range of international clients, understanding their business needs and challenges
Support in conduction ideation workshops to develop new, trend-inspired product & service ideas, based on research results

There’s a match if…
 … you hold an advanced degree in economics, behavioral or social science, psychology, statistics, or a related field, ideally with a focus on marketing
 … this is not your first assignment. You have first relevant experience (marketing, consumer & trend research, data mining or analytics, data and insights digital agency, or a consultancy)
 … you have a good understanding of business analysis techniques, a keen perception and strong sense of responsibility
 … you possess a high affinity for future trends and like being up to date with the latest technological developments
 … your analytical and creative thinking is underlined by an insatiable curiosity
 … you are fluent in English and German and you can analyze, prepare, and present complex concepts in a clear and meaningful manner
 ... Knowledge of tools in the field of social listening (e.g. Brandwatch, Talkwalker), digital trend fore-sighting, or consumer interest analytics (e.g. Google Trends/Adwords) is a plus
 That’s in it for you
 You will collaborate with an experienced and enthusiastic team with a lot of ideas, challenging international clients and highly diverse projects helping you to grow on professional and personal level.
 When you need a break, the panoramic view from our 10th floor will keep you busy playing “what’s that building over there?”. While you do that you can have yourself a coffee, or a drink. But most importantly, you will be part of a friendly work environment and a team that warmly welcomes you…until you challenge them to a kicker game. We will tailor a package that’s just right for you.
 Application We want to hire you!
 OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hardworking, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.
 To learn more about our approach to smart Data, read our blog post on From Big to smart Data – a rough guide to data-driven marketing.

Über uns
 
Mit dem Ziel, das Kerngeschäft der Automobilbranche zu überdenken, wurde die Audi Business Innovation GmbH (ABI) 2013 als 100-prozentige Tochtergesellschaft der AUDI AG ins Leben gerufen. Als digitales Produktentwicklungs- und Innovationsunternehmen bietet die Audi Business Innovation GmbH eine umfassende Produkt- und IT-Expertise für nutzerzentrierte Lösungen.
 Mit unserem unternehmerischen Handeln, unserer Produkt- und IT Expertise für verbraucherorientierte Lösungen und unserem Mindset gestalten wir die digitale Transformation mit. Unser übergreifendes Ziel ist es, Verkaufs- und Verteilungsprozesse der AUDI AG zu stärken, indem wir relevante digitale Lösungen und zuverlässige IT Plattformen bereitstellen. Wir bieten ein Konzept für digitale Services und Business Modelle, erstellen Produktentwicklungsprozesse und implementieren digitale Services entlang der Wertschöpfungskette stets mit Fokus auf Effizienz in Marketing und Sales Prozessen.
 Mit unserer Arbeit leisten wir einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Digitalisierung der Premium Customer Journey. Durch datengetriebene Produktentwicklung mit messbarem Beitrag zur Customer Experience Performance verbessern wir die User Experience laufend. Unser Mindset und unsere Einstellung ermöglichen es uns, die Ergebnisse unserer Arbeit konstant zu hinterfragen und unser Business stetig zu verbessern. Es liegt in unserer DNA, Mehrwert durch innovative Ideen und neue Konzepte zu generieren. Der Hauptsitz der Audi Business Innovation GmbH ist in München.

 Was dich auf deiner Mission erwartet
 

Identifikation notwendiger Datenquellen für eine E2E Entwicklung digitaler Produkte und deren Erfolgsmessung
 Strategieentwicklung für die übergreifende Datennutzung in der digitalen Produktentwicklung (E2E)
 Methodische und konzeptionelle Erarbeitung einer Strategie unter Beachtung der markt-/ branchenübergreifenden Benchmarks
 Erstellung eines Datenmodellierungskonzepts sowie Datenanalyse  (Kunden-, Fahrzeug-, und Userdaten) inkl. kontinuierlicher Iteration und Ableitung von Erkenntnissen für die digitale Produktentwicklung
 Customer Journey Analyse über alle Touchpoints im digitalen Produktumfeld inkl. Übertragung dieser Erkenntnisse in die Produktentwicklung
 Datengetriebene Produktentwicklung inklusive Validierung von Hypothesen, KPI-Definition und Aufsetzen von geeigneten Tracking- und Reportingkonzepten zusammen mit dem Team

Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulabschluss idealerweise in einem Bereich wie Wirtschaftsinformatik, Data Science oder Digital Business
 Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich der ganzheitlichen Datenmodellierungskonzeption sowie der Datenstrategie im Kontext digitaler Produktentwicklung
 Data-Driven Mindset und ein ausgeprägtes Grundverständnis über das Zusammenspiel von Daten und Technologien/ IT-Systemen inkl. entsprechender Abhängigkeiten (Dateninfrastruktur und -architektur)
 Analytische Fähigkeit und Abstraktionsverständnis für eine kurz-, mittel- und langfristige Etablierung einer Datenstrategie für das Unternehmen und einzelner Produkte
 Du bist ein starker Teamplayer, der sich neue Wege zum Erfolg vorstellen kann, die Initiative ergreift, die Richtung vorgibt und andere einbindet
 Die Fähigkeit, eine Schnittstellen-Rolle einzunehmen und als Bindeglied zwischen relevanten Unternehmensbereichen zu fungieren
 Integrations- und Überzeugungsfähigkeit beim Ausrollen der strategischen Schwerpunkte und Handlungsfelder mit Hilfe der Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte zu vereinfachen und effektiv zu kommunizieren
 Leidenschaft für die Suche nach kreativen Lösungen für herausfordernde Aufgabenstellungen in einem komplexen Umfeld
 Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

 Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung von Daten aus unterschiedlichsten Bereichen wie z.B. Entertainment, Gesundheitsmanagement, Mobilität/Automobil

Moderne, zentral gelegene Büros in München bei gleichzeitiger Flexibilität durch Home-Office

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence team. You will support us full-time and work from our office in Munich.

 How you'll be hosting with heart:

 You bring our pricing algorithms to the next level by combining market, competitor, and internal data.
 You analyse past performance and identify how we can predict demand and customer price sensitivity more accurately.
 You work on various other data science topics like fraud analysis, modelling business cases for new properties and many more.
 You share your ideas for new opportunities and collaborate closely with your team members from engineers to business analysts.

 What you need to shoot for the stars: 


You are enthusiastic about analytics, pricing and automations to gain insights into the latest analytics tools and technology and learn how to combine them with knowledge in data science & statistics.
 You have at least one year of work experience in data science and are looking forward to applying your experience.
 You love sharing your latest insights with your colleagues in small presentations and know how to use the right charts to explain your results.
 You are used to writing SQL queries as well as Python code, and have used some of the common data science libraries like Pandas, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit, Pymc, etc.

The impact you will make 
As Experiment Scientist, you are responsible for planning and execution of experimental campaigns and diagnostic development at a world-class, petawatt, short-pulse laser facility.  The Experiment and Laser Groups at Marvel Fusion are implementing a new research laboratory at an ultra-high-intensity, short-pulse laser facility in the Greater Munich area with the goal to demonstrate key features of our unique laser-driven fusion concept. Be part of the team that sets up the new target area from scratch, continues to perform the first measurements using our nanotargets in intense laser fields, creates novel diagnostic instruments with high fidelity, and demonstrates a path to fusion energy generation. You will bring your expertise to the creation of the design, the prototype phase and the activities during the build and verification of the various phases. You will be actively involved in all stages of the process and contribute to the implementation of the project.  Activities will be performed in the Greater Munich area, with occasional travel to research facilities world-wide.  More specifically, you will:

 Independently conduct key experiment campaigns regarding ultra-short laser pulse interaction with advanced targets which may include
   
 Manage planning, development and execution of experimental campaigns ·
 Be writing proposals and delivering presentations
 Perform data analysis and data reduction, and their comparison to numerical simulation results
 Undertake development, manufacturing, calibration and integration of new diagnostics for ultrashort laser-plasma interaction based on secondary sources of photons and particles

 Be part of a team and work collaboratively with scientists, engineers, and management to create a work plan, set project goals, and manage them to completion
 Be exchanging scientific results with peers and compare and evaluate the results with alternative methods
 Write reports and present findings to management and key stakeholders
 Be are a key element of defining and pursuing the forefront scientific mission of the company, following a strict code of ethics, and protecting any confidential information at all time


 What you bring 


Proven hands-on experience and expertise in experimental studies of ultra-high intensity laser plasma interaction, high energy density laboratory physics or laser-driven particle acceleration is required
 You have completed a Ph.D. in Physics or a related field, or equivalent breadth and depth of experience
 You have good knowledge and high proficiency in data analysis using both 2D (image-based) and 1D (e.g., oscilloscope traces) raw data
 You have excellent written and oral communication skills in English to effectively interact with all members of Marvel Fusion and its collaborators
 You are recognized as a resource or high impact contributor as evidenced by conference presentations or publications in refereed journals
 You are flexible and creative in pursuing new topics and carrying out forefront research in high field laser-matter interaction, high energy density laboratory physics and particle acceleration
 You love digging into and solving complex problems that require attention to detail and are a critical thinker
 You are a team player, like traveling, and enjoy working in multi-disciplinary teams


 Why Marvel Fusion?


 Working alongside world-leading scientists and experienced entrepreneurs in the field of Fusion
 Part of a start-up where growth on a company and individual level is the default
 Working on complex technological challenges to solve one of the biggest problems of humanity


 What we offer


 An opportunity to make a huge impact on the future of our planet through transition to clean energy
 Flexible working, location- and hours-wise
 A human-centred company culture with super nice and supportive colleagues
 A great sense of community through team events and fun in and outside the office
 Highly competitive compensation and benefits package



   Marvel Fusion, founded in 2019 and based in Munich, is a technology pioneer in the field of safe, clean, and reliable power generation. With the aim of solving one of the biggest problems of humanity, we are developing a completely new type of fusion energy technology that dramatically increases the probability of fusion and builds on recent advances in laser and nanoscience.

We, the BMW Group, offer you an interesting Master Thesis in the area of Delivery Assurance & Digitalization.

 To take our operations to the next level, the BMW Groups – Delivery Assurance department is looking for a Master Thesis intern to contribute to the Supply Chain innovations Think Tank of BMW Group and continue BMW’s leadership in supply chain management. The goal of the team will be to research emerging technologies, methods, KPI ranking methods and including a bit of Data Science (ML, AI, BI etc.)
 As a master thesis student, you will be part of the BMW Supply Chain Digitalization Working Circle, a global network of supply chain and data science experts deploying and sharing digital solutions at the BMW Group.

 What awaits you?

 You will create a constant knowledge feed to BMW Management on trends and possibilities for growth in the supply chain space where our focus will be to tackle the short and mid-term risks by incorporating the tribal knowledge along with data science.
 Research the external KPI’s for example Covid 19, Semiconductor issue, Political Tension etc. that affect the resilience of supply chain.


 Come up with a ranking system of the KPI’s using different research methodologies for example AHP, TOPSIS etc.
 Conduct research interviews, surveys with people driving the Operational Supply Chain to gain tribal knowledge.
 Researching supply chain resilience strategies and methods.
 An opportunity to work with the Silicon Valley Team, researching and providing inputs alongside our Head Quarters- Munich.
 You will present your results directly to BMW management and have contact with various leaders and bright minds across the business.


 Hands on to latest technological advancements in the field of supply chain and data science.


 What should you bring along?

 Currently enrolled full time in a graduate program at an accredited college or university studying Supply Chain or Data Science.
 Experience in research and publications will be an advantage.


 Basic Knowledge in Data Engineering, Data Science: Understanding of different data visualizations tools for i.e., AWS QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, Foundry by Palantir etc.
 Proven experience as a Researcher, Supply Chain Expert, Data Scientist or in a similar role.
 You should be a self-starter, who likes to take initiatives and bring in creative ideas.
 A sharp intellect to grasp complex systems and problems
 Experience with automotive industry, or research institute is a plus, but not necessary.


 Are you enthused by research, innovative technologies, and an innovative environment? Apply now!

 Earliest starting date: 09/01/2022
 Duration: 6 months.  Working hours: Full-time
 Contact: BMW Group Recruiting Team +49 89 382-17001

PURPOSE OF YOUR JOB 
Scientist (w/m/d) Drug Product Characterization for Biopharmaceuticals – Liquid Chromatography  Our “Business Unit Formulation and Lyophilization” is looking for a new colleague, who wants to be a part & contribute in our new Liquid Chromatography team in Martinsried close to Munich.  Are you passionate about Formulation and HPLC to drive the growth of Coriolis at Martinsried?   Come be part of our growing and highly motivated team – apply now! 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITY 



Lead/support client projects for the characterization biopharmaceutical molecules in drug products by using liquid chromatography (LC) techniques (e.g., HPLC and UPLC systems of various manufacturers; SEC, IEX, RP and other separation principles) 



Perform LC measurements as part of method implementation, method development, method qualification, method validation, troubleshooting and routine analysis 



Perform data evaluation of analytical results and reporting activities 



Communication and discussion with project teams and/or clients 



Act as LC related matter expert giving support to project teams and support training of new employees 



Support optimization of existing LC facilities and implementation of new LC technologies, systems and/or business areas at Coriolis 



Maintains cutting edge scientific knowledge in liquid chromatography techniques 



WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED 



University degree in pharmacy, pharmaceutical sciences, (bio)chemistry, biotechnology, or related field 



A minimum of 3 years relevant hands-on experiences working with LC analysis in a R&D environment 



Solid theoretical understading of LC technologies with various separation principles such as SEC, IEX, RP is crucial 



Experience working with characterization of biopharmaceutical molecules, including proteins, peptides, nucleic acids, ATMPs, GMOs, vaccines and virus (-like) particles in drug products by using liquid chromatography (Dionex/Agilent/Waters) is advantageous 

- Open for new ideas and tasks, high willingness to learn - hands on mentality 


Have the ability to work independently and reliably and to document accurately 



Team player with strong motivation, inter-personal skills and good communication abilities 



INVEST IN YOURSELF 

- Ownership: All team members are empowered to bring ideas, make decisions and have impact. Participate in our equity program and share in our success. 
- Transparency: Everyone at Coriolis is regularly updated on strategic progress, KPI tracking, product updates and changes. 
- Growth: Not only will you grow in your role, you also have access to our people development budget. 
- Flexibility: Work on your terms, by leveraging our hybrid-office arrangement. No minimums or maximums. 


WHY TO JOIN CORIOLIS? 
As Scientist in Liquid Chromatography group, you will join a highly motivated, interdisciplinary team performing contract research and development for customers from the (bio)pharmaceutical industry worldwide.  We offer you diversified and challenging areas of responsibilities in our innovative company. We actively support your personal development (technical, scientific and personal skills) especially by training on relevant techniques for characterization of (bio)pharmaceuticals.  Beyond that Coriolis offers a variety of benefits and team activities to its employees.   Let’s formulate innovation together…  Our success & development is created by the people working together @Coriolis. We put People first! That’s why we have a growth mindset, and value personality, collaboration and community to create an empowering and inspiring working space with focus on quality and costumers.   We would like to grow together with you!  Let’s continue building and creating the future now and join our Team of currently around 140 employees. In a highly motivated and interdisciplinary team, we provide you with a great chance to increase your experience. We offer an attractive work space at the Martinsried site. Let’s make a difference together!   Coriolis Pharma is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, citizenship or gender identity, color, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, marital status, age or individual preferencies. Let's win together
 At Temedica, we break new ground in the digital health sector and challenge the traditional healthcare model. We believe that individualised treatment is a fundamental right of every patient and, at the same time, is key to a better overall quality of care. Putting the patient into the centre of healthcare, Temedica improves patient outcomes by offering personalised patient support and using artificial intelligence to translate patient behaviour and experiences into sensible interventions.  Are you looking to join an inspiring team and explore the most cutting-edge developments and opportunities within the digital health sector? Are healthcare and digital technology your passions? We are continually looking for new talents and experts in the field who want to share our vision of crafting the future of personal health!  As a Data Scientist with us, you will have the opportunity to explore exciting and diverse data, work with cutting-edge algorithms and technologies and participate in the development of solutions that generate new insights for healthcare.
 Your Role with us


 Analyze a wide variety of data with the aim of continuously driving improvements and enabling new discoveries.
 Apply state-of-the-art methods from statistics, ML and NLP during the development of solutions for various internal and external use cases.
 Collaborate with talented data scientists, data engineers, software developers, and other stakeholders in an agile environment.
 Create data visualizations that make our results accessible and useful for internal and external stakeholders.
 Develop new ideas, do research, and implement prototypes and PoCs - always with the aim of taking the skills of the whole team to the next level.


 What you bring to the table


 You have an BSc or MSc in computer science/mathematics/engineering or similar.
 You have 3+ years practical experience as a data scientist (full time employment) or in a similar position.
 You have a strong knowledge of Python and SQL and practical experience with relevant libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.
 You have a strong knowledge of applied statistics, ML and ideally NLP and you are familiar with methods and technologies for data visualization.
 Hands-on experience with cloud architecture and technologies (Google Cloud Platform GCP, AWS or Azure).
 You are fluent in English (spoken and written) - German is a plus!


 What we bring to the table
 Aside from the people, the role, our culture and our mission, we have countless other aspects that make Temedica a great place to work at:

 We are an open-minded, international team that loves collaborating to reach our goals.
 We live a professional feedback culture with objective performance reviews and room to grow.
 We invest in your personal and professional growth and align on your career development plan.
 We equip you with state-of-the-art technology (MacBook Pro, etc.)
 We offer a workplace where you can feel comfortable right in the city centre of Munich.
 We enjoy spending quality time together such as Go Kart and sports activities.
 We are a market-proven, well-funded and fast-growing company.
 We provide extensive language training programs in German.
 We offer JobRad® and Corporate Benefits.
 We offer relocation and visa support.


 Join us!
 Are you looking for an exciting challenge within digital health? We are looking forward to your application!

Job_Title: Data Scientist Focused On Trustworthy Ai
Description:
Data Scientist focused on Trustworthy AI (m/f/d) * 
For the Data & Analytics Division – Artificial Intelligence


Location  Munich , Germany 

The Artificial Intelligence group in the Data & Analytics Division leverages state-of-the-art machine learning technologies to shape the future of the insurance industry. Data can be internal, external, structured or unstructured. Our missions encompass improving underwriting (risk assessment and pricing), claims management decisions and offering new services and business models through data-driven methods. Our focus areas span a wide range of applications, including automated information extraction, risk model improvements, remote sensing and certification and insurance of algorithms. Our department cooperates closely with Data Engineering, IT, business units, and Global Innovation. Junior Data Analyst 

 (all genders) 

 Frankfurt Hamburg Munich 

 Shaping the Digital Future 

 DEVnet consultants blend technological knowhow with analytical insights and industry expertise to develop sustainable solutions in a data-driven world. Founded in 1998, the company is headquartered in Grünwald near Munich with three further locations in Germany and Poland. 

 Its 150 experts collaborate with clients ranging from global banks and insurances to providers of energy and mobility as well as startups in the digital economy. They focus on organising data, developing platforms and algorithms, generating insights and facilitating digital transformation to build digital fitness. 

 #1 
What the job offers you 
Within the scope of projects, you will answer industry-specific questions, for example in the areas of risk, asset management or energy trading 
You will analyse and structure problems and develop concepts for requirements, solutions and tests 
You will be intensively involved in the development, realisation and implementation of new IT solutions for our customers 
You will organise and analyse data (both small and big data) and visualise results with the help of business intelligence and dashboard solutions 
You will identify and evaluate potentials for optimisation and efficiency increases within existing processes, e.g. through innovative digital solutions 
You will develop intelligent algorithms and machine learning models for advanced analytics, in suitable programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, Matlab or R 
You will work closely with specialist and IT departments 
You will work on new topics and contribute to the know-how sharing 
#2 
A few key data you should agree with 
Successfully completed studies in (economics) mathematics, statistics, physics, (economics) computer science, economics, or a comparable course of study 
Team orientation with very good communication and presentation skills: German as well as written and spoken English 
Passion for new technologies and digital trends 
High affinity for IT topics in combination with an interest in data and business analysis 
Strong analytical and conceptual skills 
A structured, independent and results-oriented way of working 
Willingness to travel nationally 
Ideally, first practical experience or professional activities in relevant subject areas 
If applicable, initial knowledge of programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Matlab, R, Java, C# or C/C++), database systems (e.g. SQL, Oracle, MongoDB) or cloud technologies (e.g. MS Azure, AWS) 
#3 
Benefits 
You will get to know the consulting and project business together with our experienced analysts 
Varied projects in a wide range of tasks and areas of responsibility 
Interesting projects with international clients using state of the art technologies 
Personal coaching and mentoring by our senior/principal experts, you will develop your own ideas with colleagues and work independently on new topics 
Individual training and professional development 
Independence and rapid assumption of responsibility 
Working in a friendly environment with flat hierarchies and short communication channels 
Room for your creativity and participation 
We attach great importance to team spirit and personal responsibility 
Performance and commitment are rewarded in an above average and appreciative way 
Attractive salary and profit-sharing scheme 
Permanent employment contract 
We offer jobs in the most beautiful regions of Germany in top locations (Hamburg, Frankfurt am Main or Munich) 
30 days holiday 
If required, we are also happy to help with finding accommodation or work visas

Founded in 2000, JetBrains is a world-leading vendor of professional software development tools. We are passionate about making software development a more productive and enjoyable experience through intelligent tools that help developers to escape the routine and their creativity to thrive. We conduct various kinds of research for our product teams: Intellij based IDE’s, Space, Fleet, TeamCity, YouTrack. We are looking for talented, inventive, and passionate people to join our team.
 As part of our team, you will:

Develop a system of metrics for the advancement of JetBrains products: where usability problems occur within the product, how changes in the product affect the metrics and what experiments are necessary for the product improvement.
Perform A/B testing, develop testing conditions, and interpret the results.
Provide recommendations for product improvement and search for the best solutions for UX enhancement.
Collaborate with managers, developers, and designers.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to support product decision-making.

Qualifications:

Analytical thinking, the ability to challenge hypotheses, analyze and structure data, draw conclusions and interrelate data.
Knowledge of mathematical statistics and experience in its application.
Confident use of Python (Pandas, Numpy), experience with SQL.
Ability to choose the right way to assess data: analytics, research, or usage of external data.
At least one year of experience in data analysis or related fields.
Commitment, self-management, and attention to detail.
Ability to solve non-trivial tasks under incomplete data conditions.






Fascinating work in a dynamic, friendly team.
 Competitive salary.
 Flexible working schedule.
 Six weeks of paid vacation (local regulations can be applied).
 An office library with specialized work-related books and magazines.
 Comfortable working environment, with ergonomic workplaces, fitness and leisure zones and a company-paid car park.
 Excellent opportunity for professional and personal development, opportunity to travel to professional conferences worldwide.
 Additional benefits including lunch, free refreshments and snacks in the office, and more.

IDS GmbH - Analysis and Reporting Services (IDS) unlocks the value of data for the global investment industry: We validate, refine, and link data from a wide variety of sources and make it available for mission-critical processes along all investment strategies and products quickly, worldwide, and at any time. Fund management companies, insurance companies, banks and pension funds can use IDS to access a flexibly scalable data platform as well as all necessary analyses and reports in the desired format. As a 100% subsidiary of Allianz SE, IDS has stood for stability, reliability and certified security in the handling of its customers' data since 2001.
 



 JOB PURPOSE/ROLE


  Join our team as a Financial Data Analyst who is able to take over service ownership and strategically improve our operational processes. We combine Finance and IT know-how to get maximum value out of the data for our clients. Our team is responsible to provide high-quality processes and data, supporting the reporting and decision-making process of one of the world’s leading financial institutions. In this role you will gain deep insights into portfolio structures and the underlying data model of a major financial company.
 

  If you are enthusiastic about data, then you are exactly right with us! You can expect an international environment with flat hierarchies which creates freedom to bring in your ideas and experiences. Further we offer an extensive onboarding program to support your entry into IDS GmbH.
 



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Take over ownership for the services provided by our team
Quality assurance of all relevant data sets (e.g. portfolio data) for providing downstream services with high-quality data
Ensure smooth data processing and the achievement of agreed data quality standards in close cooperation with the team, developers and external providers
Handle complex client inquiries, e.g. analyzing data flows and validating results
Proactively identify process improvements and work with experts from other departments to ensure the continuous improvement of our services 
Participation in projects





KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE


University degree in mathematics, economics, business administration, finance and/or equivalent experience in finance
Good knowledge of financial instruments and capital markets, knowledge about fund structures and benchmarks is an advantage
High data affinity and experience in data analysis, preferably with relational databases (SQL, PL/SQL)
High responsibility and process-oriented thinking
Experience in working with or management of service providers is an advantage
Team player mentality, creativity and problem-solving mentality
Strong service attitude, autonomy and an above average willingness to perform
Fluent in English, German is an advantage





WHAT WE OFFER


Benefit from flexible working hours, a home office arrangement and 30 vacation days per year
With us, you can expect an intercultural environment with flat hierarchies, a familiar working atmosphere as well as independent work in dedicated teams
Become part of a company with start-up spirit that combines the advantages of the Allianz Group
Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities and shape your individual career path
Benefit, among other things, from annual bonus payments, additional benefits, health initiatives, employee restaurant and a company pension plan





  Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
   We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
   We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
   Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Company Description
  We are Tipico, the leading sports betting provider in Germany and one of the most exciting tech companies in the industry. We are fueled by our passion for the perfect product, using the newest tech stack to make advances every single day. Our culture is bursting with energy and ambition where we generate intense moments of Spannung, thriving through our values of Trust, Progress, and Passion. We push the limits of what’s possible because we believe that when adrenaline meets progress, awesome things happen.



 Job Description
  Do you get excited by the power of numbers? Ready to do some coding? Tipico is looking for a Quantitative Research Analyst to join our Bookmaking team. This role combines the two fields of statistical analysis and trading strategies by developing smart and innovative automated solutions and (sports) models. You will be involved all the way from the idea creation until the final delivery of the product or project.
 Are you ready to turn up the power and bring the thrill of Spannung into your working life? Then show us your game face – because we’re looking for a Quantitative Research Analyst (m/f/x) to join the team!
 Your playing field:

 You will maintain and create production code of trading and risk management tools in line with the departments’ strategic objectives – to keep us on top of the game
 We never settle and continuously want to improve. Therefore, you would construct and execute tests to analyse and improve our pricing strategy
 Numbers don’t lie. You perform ad hoc analyses as requested by management with data extracted from Redshift using SQL
 You financially assess proposed improvements to sports betting products and operations
 We believe in you and listen to your recommendations of new techniques and technologies to achieve the objective




 Qualifications
  Which skills should you bring to the pitch:
 University Degree. You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or other related disciplines.
 Programming Skills. You are an experienced user of R and Python and know how to keep the quality of bigger programming projects on a high level.
 Mathematical mind. You are passionate about statistics and probabilities.
 Work Experience. Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role, optimally in the sports or betting industry.
 Knowledge of SQL scripting. You know how to get your data from a SQL-DB.
 Nice to have:
 Score extra points with us with previous programming projects in a sports or betting context.
 Knowledge in other programming languages.
 Additional Information
  This is how we score with you:
 Established International Group. We have a solid foundation on which to grow. Personal and Professional Growth. We offer you opportunities to develop and grow to unlock your potential. Relocation Support. To make your move to Munich as smooth as possible. Sports Allowance. We love sports so we subsidize your membership to keep you active. Modern offices. Equipped with the latest tech and in the heart of the bustling city, offering a convenient commute to work. Events. Sponsored Charity and Team gatherings, we like to have fun together as one team and reinforce our connections. Supportive Environment. We believe in collaboration and working together as a team, but we also give importance to the uniqueness of each and every one of us.
 Think a career at Tipico is right for you?
 Apply now and join our winning team! If you have any questions or comments about this role, our TA team is happy to help you! Feel free to reach out to us on our social media channels
 We look forward to your application!
