IDS GmbH - Analysis and Reporting Services (IDS) unlocks the value of data for the global investment industry: We validate, refine, and link data from a wide variety of sources and make it available for mission-critical processes along all investment strategies and products quickly, worldwide, and at any time. Fund management companies, insurance companies, banks and pension funds can use IDS to access a flexibly scalable data platform as well as all necessary analyses and reports in the desired format. As a 100% subsidiary of Allianz SE, IDS has stood for stability, reliability and certified security in the handling of its customers' data since 2001.
 



 JOB PURPOSE/ROLE


  Join us as Business Analyst (m/f/d) for Asset Owner Services in the team SDM Investment Management. You will support our teams in providing outstanding services and solutions in the context of investment management reporting. 
 

  You are responsible for deep dive data analysis, process optimization and the design and continuous improvement of customized reporting solutions for our clients. The Asset Owner Services department has a strong focus on investment management reporting related topics, e.g. ESG, SolvencyII, IFRS9, compliance topics, pre-processing of local data, derivatives reporting etc., and combines technical expertise with profound business knowledge.
 

  We offer an opportunity to work in a motivating environment characterized by a wide variety of business and IT services, cultural diversity and interacting with a large number of people. You will closely collaborate with our service lines, development and service delivery management on providing our analysis and reporting services to the customer.
 

  To support your entry into IDS GmbH we offer a comprehensive onboarding program.
 



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Creation of design proposals and specification of new (reporting) requirements together with our service delivery managers and experts
Coordination of IDS colleagues and Allianz expert teams
Steering and coordination of implementation of new requirements
Analysis and fixing of data or process errors to ensure excellent data and report quality
Living a culture of openness to innovation and driving and implementing continuous improvement
Close collaboration with our service line colleagues to ensure stable operations
Third level contact for our clients
Ad hoc analysis of requests and process failures including creation of mitigation measures





KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE


University degree preferably in economics, business administration, business information technology, mathematics, physics and/or an equivalent experience in finance
Capital market, finance and/or accounting knowledge
Experience with databases (Oracle/SQL) 
Experience with Business Intelligence applications (e.g. PowerBI, COGNOS) is an advantage
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Strong customer and service orientation
High degree of analytical thinking, motivation, autonomy and an above-average willingness to perform
IT affinity and strong background in data processing 
Fluent in English and in German




WHAT WE OFFER


Benefit from flexible working hours, a home office arrangement and 30 vacation days per year
With us, you can expect an intercultural environment with flat hierarchies, a familiar working atmosphere as well as independent work in dedicated teams
Become part of a company with start-up spirit that combines the advantages of the Allianz Group
Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities and shape your individual career path
Benefit, among other things, from annual bonus payments, additional benefits, health initiatives, employee restaurant and a company pension plan





  Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
   We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
   We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
   Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Job_Title: Finance And Controlling For Facility Management
Description:
Job Description: 
A vacancy for a Finance and Controlling for Facility Management (d/f/m) has arisen in Facility Management Controlling in Ottobrunn. 

As an operational Function Controller for German Entities, you will be part of the Finance community with different links to project and support function organizations. You will contribute substantially to managing the cost of Integrated Functions. You will ensure the right cost and associated statistical key figures planning for OP, Budget & Forecast in close relation with the Financial Business Partner, HR and operational stakeholders. You will gather and support providing data to enable educated decision making on management level and give visibility about performance versus targets. You will highlight and analyze discrepancies and propose actions to optimize financial and operational performance. To do so, you contribute to collaborate and challenge the business partners from all directorates (e.g. Operational, Project Organization, Accounting & Cost Accounting Procurement and other Finance departments). Moreover, you will support key change decisions and contribute to reduce the risks and optimize the costs, to look for long-term company profitability and competitiveness for our company. 

Being a Function Controller requires a robust company and business understanding, a feeling for numbers and solid social skills to be able to manage your stakeholders in adversity towards the best business decisions for the company. The role is challenging in its complexity and has to be undertaken by somebody who is capable to understand the people, the products, the organization and the numbers. You will be embedded in our Finance community and work closely with your operational partner. A high level of self-awareness, emotional intelligence, conflict management skills, persistence, and assertiveness is required to master this role. 

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include: 

Facility Management controlling 
Coordinate FM controlling team in Germany (MAN/OTN/FHN/BRE) 
Promote collaboration and out of silos mindset, implement value adding and lean processes 
Simplify, benchmark, analysis & define modifications of allocation / recharging schemes 
Challenge and support the business in terms of financial & operational performance improvement 
Responsible for all financial planning & reporting processes (OP, FC, budget, target setting and actuals) for the German perimeter 
Evaluate deviations between actuals, OP, Budget and Forecast and possible impacts on programs and functions, propose corrective measures 
Analyze quantitative and qualitative data on performance against budget / targets, highlighting discrepancies and risks & opportunities 
Strive for harmonizing processes & reporting tools for all German sites 
Guidance & support of business cases & Investments 
Lead of transnational projects in FM controlling 
Understand & explain all aspects of the strategy, based upon Airbus business objectives 
Collaboration with transnational teams (FM / Operational functions / Support functions & Finance) in Airbus Commercial and Airbus Defense and Space 
Coordinate, lead and challenge transnational projects and initiatives like e.g. ERP roadmap, De-renting, Workplace of the future, approval processes Capex/Opex Projects, organizational changes e.g. FMREvolution, 
Operational lead in OTN 
Special tasks for FM controlling OTN (e.g. harmonisation topics) 
Communication, explanation of Budget towards user on site 


We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience: 

Academic degree in Business Administration / Finance or equivalent 
Experience within Finance & project management >5 years 
Experience in project management 
Excellent communication and organizational skills 
Know-how in communication towards Top Management 
Excellent skills in MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint 
Good knowledge in SAP CO/PS 
Good knowledge in Systems and Tools (SAP FI/MM) 
Negotiation level in English and German 
Time to time business trips to German sites required 


Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration. 

We Offer: 

Challenging tasks for/with unique services and products 
Pleasant working atmosphere in a professional and international work environment 
Comprehensive on-boarding included 
Exciting development opportunities and perspectives 
Extensive company training offers (eLearning and Classroom Trainings) 
Flexible working hours 
Compatibility of work and family life 
Attractive remuneration 
Company Pension Scheme 
Good connections to public transport and local parking facilities 
Catering facilities on site 


This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities. 

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth. 

Company: Airbus Defence and Space GmbH 
 
Contract Type: Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido 
 
Experience Level: Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional 
 
Job Family: Controlling <JF-FI-FO> 
 
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.  Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. 
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . 

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Job_Title: Duales Studium 2023 - Bachelor Of Science Wirtschaftsinformatik
Description:
Stellenprofil:




  Du bist ein echtes Analysegenie und IT-Anwendungen begeistern dich? Aber gleichzeitig kannst du dir deinen Alltag ohne wirtschaftlichen Themen nicht vorstellen? Dann revolutioniere gemeinsam mit uns die IT-Lösungen in der Versicherungsbranche!
 

  Bereit zum Durchstarten? Während deines dreijährigen dualen Studiums an der Dualen Hochschule Stuttgart kombinierst du betriebswirtschaftliche und IT-spezifische Kenntnisse und legst deinen Abschluss mit dem Titel „Bachelor of Science“ ab. Daneben bist du praktisch sofort mittendrin: In unseren IT-Abteilungen innerhalb der Allianz arbeitest du in Teams an Aufgaben und Projekten mit, wie zum Beispiel an der Entwicklung von Programmen und Apps. Bei uns wirst du in Projektarbeit eingebunden, erhältst Eigenverantwortung, Gestaltungsfreiraum sowie einen sicheren Partner für deine Bachelorthesis. Nach deiner Ausbildung kannst du dich zum:r Spezialist:in oder zur Führungskraft weiterentwickeln.
 

  Werde Teil des weltweit führenden Versicherungsunternehmens und erlebe während deiner Ausbildung das vielseitige und dynamische Versicherungsgeschäft. Als nachhaltiger Konzern achten wir besonders auf dich, unsere Umwelt und unsere gemeinsame Zukunft. Let’s care for tomorrow!
 



Dich erwartet bei uns...




  … Einblicke in unsere internen IT-Strukturen und -Prozesse, von Business Intelligence bis IT-Sicherheit, von Infrastruktur bis Hosting
   ... eigenständige Mitarbeit in agilen IT-Projekten und aktive Gestaltung der Digitalisierung in der Allianz (u.a. Front-und Backend-Entwicklung, Web-Entwicklung, Cloud, eigen entwickelte Anwendungen und Plattformen)
   … eine abwechslungsreiche sowie interessante Tätigkeit z.B. durch die Qualifizierungen in agile Methoden (Scrum), Java, Web-Entwicklung und weiteren aktuellen IT-Technologien
   … die Möglichkeit dich individuell weiterzubilden, um deine fachliche, als auch persönliche Entwicklung zu fördern (z.B. LinkedIn Learning, Kommunikationstraining uvm.)
 



Das bringst du mit...




  ... deine Persönlichkeit
   ... allgemeine/fachgebundene Hochschulreife oder Fachhochschulreife (Letzteres inkl. Deltaprüfung) mit überdurchschnittlichem Abschluss
   ... Spaß am Programmieren und Interesse an verschiedenen Phasen der Anwendungsentwicklung und an IT-Systemen
   ... gute Englischkenntnisse aufgrund der internationalen IT-Sprache sowie der Internationalität unseres Unternehmens
   ... Motivation und Organisationsfähigkeit, um Praxisphasen und Studium gleichzeitig zu meistern
   ... Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsfreude und Offenheit für eine vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit mit Kund:innen und Kolleg:innen
   ... Gestaltungswillen und Empathie für eine mögliche Karriere als Projekt- oder Teamleitung
 



Das bieten wir:




attraktive, überdurchschnittliche Ausbildungsvergütung
Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld sowie eine Erfolgsbeteiligung
40 € Vermögenswirksame Leistungen im Monat
25 € Fahrkartenzuschuss im Monat
die Möglichkeit in bestimmten Ausbildungsphasen unter Absprache mit deinem Vorgesetzten mobil zu arbeiten





  Bist du dabei? Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf und Zeugnissen.
 



Besetzungstermin: 01.10.2023


Bewerbungszeitraum: schnellstmöglich




  Bei Fragen melde dich gerne bei Frau Jasmin Wenzel: telefonisch unter +49 89 92529-25233 oder per Mail an jasmin.wenzel@allianz.de.
 



  Weitere Informationen über Ausbildung, Vergütung, Zusatzleistungen sowie die Allianz findest du unter https://careers.allianz.com.
 


 Bei Fragen zum technischen Bewerbungsprozess, wende dich bitte an recruiting-berufsausbildung@allianz.de.
 




  Die Allianz Group ist eine der am meisten vertrauten Versicherungs- und Vermögensverwaltungsgesellschaften der Welt. Die Betreuung unserer Mitarbeiter, ihrer Ambitionen, Träume und Herausforderungen macht uns zu einem einzigartigen Arbeitgeber. Gemeinsam können wir ein Umfeld schaffen, in dem sich jeder befähigt fühlt und das Vertrauen hat, zu forschen, zu wachsen und eine bessere Zukunft für unsere Kunden und die Welt um uns herum zu gestalten.
 

  Wir bei der Allianz glauben an eine vielfältige und integrative Belegschaft und sind stolz darauf, ein Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit zu sein. Wir ermutigen Dich, Dein ganzes Selbst bei der Arbeit einzubringen, egal, wo Du herkommst, wie Du aussiehst, wen Du liebst oder woran Du glaubst.
 

  Wir freuen uns daher über Bewerbungen unabhängig von ethnischer oder kultureller Herkunft, Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalität, Religion, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.
 

  Begleite uns. Let's care for tomorrow.
 

  Hinweis: Diversity of Minds ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil der Unternehmenskultur der Allianz. Ein Mittel, um vielfältige Teams zu erreichen, ist ein regelmäßiger Wechsel von Allianz Executive Mitarbeitern über Funktionen, Allianz Einheiten und Regionen hinweg. Daher erwartet das Unternehmen von seinen Mitarbeitern eine allgemeine Offenheit und eine hohe Motivation, regelmäßig Positionen zu wechseln und Erfahrungen innerhalb der Allianz Gruppe zu sammeln.

FUJITSU – hier steht der Mensch im Mittelpunkt!


Ob Hardware oder Cloud Solutions, SAP Services/Consulting oder IoT und Artificial Intelligence Lösungen - Als globaler Konzern bietet Fujitsu das gesamte Spektrum an IT-Services und Produkten aus einer Hand an. Unser Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden pragmatisch im Tagesgeschäft zu unterstützen und sie gleichzeitig für die digitale Transformation zu rüsten.


 Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für die Standorte Stuttgart, Hamburg, Berlin, Frankfurt am Main, Düsseldorf, Hannover, Neckarsulm, Frankfurt, Nürnberg, München, Walldorf einen:


Business Development Manager (w/m/d)


Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie:



Als Mitglied des CE-weiten Business Development Teams Manufacturing & Automotive und arbeiten Sie eng mit den Kollegen der Consulting- und Deliveryteams zusammen 
Identifikation von vertikalen Lösungsansätzen speziell im Umfeld der Prozessoptimierung und Prozessautomation 
Sicherstellung der Kundenzufriedenheit und reibungslose Koordination der Zusammenarbeit aller relevanten internen und externen Schnittstellen 
Proaktive Unterstützung der Marketingaktivitäten zum Beispiel im Rahmen von Telemarketingaktionen oder fachspezifischen Messen und Events 
Co-Creation mit unseren Kunden mit dem Ziel der Identifikation gemeinsamer Lösungsansätze 
Entwicklung von Strategien in Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern (Vertrieb, Marketing, Produktentwicklung, Technologie-Partnern, etc.) auch beim Kunden vor Ort 


Folgende Qualifikationen sollten Sie mitbringen:



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Betriebswirtschaft, der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation 
Branchenerfahrung im Umfeld Manufacturing & Automotive 
Kenntnisse im Bereich Prozessoptimierung und Prozessautomatisierung 
Sie bringen Erfahrung in einem oder idealerweise mehreren der folgenden Bereichen mit: SAP, ServiceNow, Robotic Process Automation, Hybrit-IT, Connected Services, Digital Business Consulting 
Hohe Kundenorientierung, wirtschaftliches Denken und Handeln sowie eine analytische Arbeitsweise sind für Sie selbstverständlich 
Ausgeprägter Teamgeist sowie interkulturelle Kompetenzen und Erfahrung in der Mitarbeit in internationalen, virtuellen Teams 
Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden ihr Profil ab 


Warum Fujitsu?



Dank hoher Eigenverantwortung und Flexibilität haben Sie die Möglichkeit wirklich etwas zu bewirken 
Durch flexible Arbeitszeiten & -orte bieten wir bei Fujitsu eine gute Vereinbarkeit von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf 
Gemeinschaft und Wertschätzung des Einzelnen sowie Firmenfeiern & Teamevents 
Die Fort- und Weiterbildung unserer Mitarbeiter wird bei Fujitsu groß geschrieben – auf nationaler und internationaler Ebene bieten wir ein breites Spektrum an 
Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in Führungs- oder Expertenlaufbahnen 
30 Tage Urlaub & Sonderurlaub 
Die Gesundheit unserer Mitarbeiter ist uns wichtig – Fujitsu bietet verschiedenste Gesundheitsprogramme an 
Verschiedenste Vergünstigungen und Mitarbeiterrabatte 


Erfahren Sie mehr über unsere Werte und Unternehmenskultur:

Trusted to deliver - Bei uns erleben sie vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit in allen Bereichen, die Ihnen den notwendigen Freiraum zur persönlichen Entfaltung ermöglicht
Do the right thing - Unser Ziel ist es, die Welt nachhaltiger zu machen, und mit unseren Produkten und Dienstleistungen einen positiven Einfluss auf die Gesellschaft auszuüben.
Work your way - Gestalten Sie Ihre Welt mit Flexibilität, damit Sie eine gesunde Balance zwischen Arbeit und Privatleben genießen können
Achieve together – Wir übertreffen gemeinsam unsere individuellen Ziele und schaffen Mehrwert für alle Beteiligten
Play your part in a leading global technology business: Gestalten Sie Ihre Welt in einem führenden globalen Technologieunternehmen, das die Welt verändert und Innovationen vorantreibt. Wir respektieren Fairness, Chancengleichheit und fördern die Vielfalt mit all ihren Facetten sowie die Inklusion im Unternehmen

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.
  

Customer Success: Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated Customer Success team that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes.
   We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.
 
 Responsibilities

   As the Customer Success Account Manager - Manager (CSAM - M), you lead a high-performing team of seasoned Customer Success Account Managers (CSAM) that are well versed in cloud adoption, program delivery management practices, and technology trends. This is an exciting role that will help fuel customer success through your leadership with business, customer, and team growth! 
   The CSAM-M is accountable for end-to-end service program delivery within an assigned portfolio of customers, representing Customer Success throughout all phases while demonstrating a critical partnership with internal and external stakeholders. The CSAM-M serves as the primary leadership point of accountability and/or escalation for their portfolio of customers. This role has direct people management responsibility for Customer Success Account Managers and supervises the Customer Success and Support deliveries to customers by their team. The CSAM-M is responsible for driving customer satisfaction, customer effective use of Microsoft’s cloud platforms, consumption, growth with fulfilling Support contractual obligations, and the governance of delivery for their portfolio of accounts led by their CSAMs.
 



Key responsibilities include: 




Leadership: 


Demonstrate strength of character and set the tone as a role model; coach, provide feedback and direction to the team; value and care about the people in the team; create an open and trusting environment where people thrive. 
Create clarity and shared understanding; generate positive, motivating, creative energy; deliver success through a “growth mindset”. 



Customer Relationship Management: 


Create and nurture strategic relationships with key customer stakeholders, often as part of a steering committee, to ensure delivery value is on track and major issues are being anticipated, identified, and managed. 
Develop Practice strategy aligned with business and IT objectives, priorities, and strategies of Customers. 



Account Planning: 


Bring Customer and industry insights to the Account Planning rhythm for strategic Customers 
Support and coach CSAMs to collaborate with Account Teams in developing Customer Account Plans that align the vision for Microsoft's offerings with Customer objectives and strategies. 
Develop and support CSAMs in portfolio prioritization and planning of Customer engagements to achieve Customer objectives and value. 



Opportunity and Pursuit Management: 


Instill a team culture of identifying and sharing Customer insights and opportunities with the broader Account Team. 
Drive partnership with internal Account Teams to identify, create, and support the pursuit of growth opportunities across the Practice. 



Consumption and Delivery Execution: 


Oversee CSAMs in effective delivery against their portfolio of prioritized solutions and workloads to drive Customer value realization and Microsoft cloud consumption. 
Anticipate, identify, and mitigate blockers to Customer success goals and partners with internal and external stakeholders to accelerate Customer value realization and Customer satisfaction. 



Staffing and Skilling: 


Hire, on-board, develop and manage a diverse and inclusive team of Customer Success Account Managers; lead and motivate this team to high-performance. 
Develop and execute skilling plans for CSAMs and oneself to build technical and professional expertise in alignment with business priorities. 


Qualifications

   To be effective as a CSAM-M, you will be able to influence across organizational boundaries and have leadership experience in building, coaching, developing, and retaining high performing teams to achieve business results, Customer success and value realization.
 


 Required Qualifications:



 Experience: several years solution delivery, practice management, customer-facing consulting, or portfolio management experience
 Change: Experience driving business change management and/ or technical adoption
 Collaboration: Ability to generate trust, build alliances, and orchestrate interdisciplinary teams to the benefit of Customers
 Communication: Thought leader with executive presence, including the ability to hold CxO and BDM level discussions, exceptional interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills
 Travel: Readiness to Travel: 10-30%



 Prefered Qualifications:


 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business or related field (or equivalent experience)

 Certification in one or more of the following technologies: Cloud, mobile, Database, Big Data, BI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence
 PMP or other project management certification

Wir gehören zu den weltweit führenden Unternehmen im Bereich Orthopädie, Arthroskopie, Sportmedizin und Orthobiologie. Getreu unserer Mission Helping Surgeons Treat Their Patients Better entwickeln wir seit 40 Jahren innovative Produkte und Operationsverfahren. Arthrex wurde 1981 in München gegründet – heute befindet sich unser Hauptsitz in Naples (Florida, USA) mit weiteren Niederlassungen in 21 Ländern. Unsere Firmenkultur ist geprägt von einer länderübergreifenden Zusammenarbeit sowie einem Austausch mit Kolleginnen und Kollegen unterschiedlicher Nationalitäten. Die Erschließung neuer Geschäftsfelder und die Erweiterung unserer Produktpalette tragen zu einem stetigen Wachstum bei und lassen uns auch in Zukunft federführend bei der Entwicklung qualitativ hochwertiger Produkte sein. Unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter tragen mit ihrem Engagement wesentlich zu diesem Erfolg bei. Dafür bieten wir ein motivierendes, wertschätzendes Arbeitsumfeld.

(Junior) Analyst Strategic Business Development (w/m/d)

Sie haben Freude daran Ergebnisse strukturiert aufzuarbeiten, visuell verständlich darzustellen und zu präsentieren

Job_Title: Praktikum Oder Werkstudententätigkeit  Im Bereich Big Data/Bi/Data Analytics
Description:
Deine Aufgaben:

Du bist Teil des Business Intelligence Teams bei DEDIQ, das unsere Beteiligungsunternehmen in der Unternehmenssteuerung und das Investment Team bei Transaktionen mit Datenanalysen unterstützt
Du führst nach angemessener Einarbeitungszeit und in enger Zusammenarbeit mit operativ Verantwortlichen aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen, eigenständig Analysen durch und leitest Handlungsempfehlungen daraus ab
Du beantwortest datenbasierte Fragestellungen aus dem Business mit Hilfe von Tableau, Excel, SQL oder Google Analytics
Du unterstützt uns bei der Aufbereitung von Daten und der Erstellung von Berichten über viele Unternehmensbereiche hinweg, die datengetrieben gesteuert werden (z.B. Online Marketing, Einkauf, Logistik, Finance)
Du lernst Daten in Tableau, SQL und Excel selbstständig aufzubereiten

Dein Profil

Du absolvierst gerade deinen Bachelor oder Master, vorzugsweise eines technischen, naturwissenschaftlichen oder betriebswirtschaftlichen Studiengangs
Du zeichnest dich durch eine sorgfältige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie ein hohes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen aus
Du denkst dich gerne in analytische Fragestellungen ein und verfügst über ein Basiswissen in der Arbeit mit Excel
Du hast erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenbanken (SQL), Datenaufbereitung oder (statistischer) Datenanalyse sind ein Plus
Du hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und denkst dich schnell in neue Problemstellungen ein

Was wir bieten

Eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Praktikanten-/Werkstudententätigkeit in einem jungen und dynamischen Unternehmen im Herzen von München
Ergebnisorientiertes Arbeiten in einem hochmotivierten, inspirierenden Team, mit klarem Fokus auf Inhalte und Lösungen
Die Möglichkeit, die Weiterentwicklung unserer Beteiligungsunternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten, mit einem Einblick in sämtliche Unternehmensprozesse und wichtige Zukunftsentscheidungen
Ein attraktives Gehalt und spannende Projekte, die darauf warten, umgesetzt zu werden


  Jetzt bewerben

We are hiring a Product Marketing Intern who is ready to join a dynamic and vibrant company for 6 months.
 



 What You Will Be Doing:



 Your goal in this position is to help support and execute the surface materials strategy.
 


 How will you meet this goal?




 Do you love to dive into topics through research? You perform competitive analyses and investigate what the competition is doing in the field of surface materials.
 You support portfolio management for surface materials. You communicate with internal and external stakeholders to drive projects forward.
 You will collaborate with project leadership, support the creation of relevant tools, and serve as an interface for material-specific issues
 You will support sub-projects, revise material overviews and create a material library based on the overviews



 Your Future Team:



 Surface Materials owns the “aesthetics” of our furniture offerings. We are an essential, core aspect of our organization and business model. We lead all textures, samples, fabrics, and all components of their processes for our furniture products.



 Who you are:



 You are motivated, creative and also like to think outside the box.
 You’re the team member on a group project that initiates the conversation and is willing to help others on top of your own responsibilities.
 You are open-minded, articulate and empathetic and integration is their belief
 You love other cultures and want to learn more about them (global aptitude/ cultural intelligence.)



 Qualifications:



 Ideally, you have previous work experience in a business environment.
 Fields of study: Business, marketing, project or product management.
 Skills: Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook/ Teams



 Why People Choose to Work with Us:



 As a student associate in Surface Materials, you can expect to learn a broad base of business skills, not just marketing. This will be attained through support of Surface Materials portfolio, learning supply chain, Collaboration with Design & Project Management, working in a true team environment, and time management.
 


 At Steelcase, we put people at the center of everything we do. We understand the role of work and believe that it can bring meaning and purpose to the lives of our customers and our employees. We prioritize supporting our employees both in and out of work, in all aspects of their lives. When we bring our talents together, we make a positive lasting impact through our work and communities.
 


 Who We Are:



 Organizations around the world trust Steelcase to help them create places that help people work better, be inspired, and accomplish more.
 

   We design, manufacture, and partner with other leading organizations to provide architecture, furniture, and technology solutions- accessible through a network of channels, including over 800 Steelcase dealer locations. Steelcase is a global, industry-leading, publicly-traded company with fiscal year 2021 revenue of $2.6 billion.

Deine Aufgaben 
 
Als Business Intelligence Specialist arbeitest du eng mit den Teams und Führungskräften der verschiedenen Geschäftsbereiche der Bilthouse-Gruppe zusammen
Im Austausch mit Investoren, Vorstand, und Stakeholdern in den anderen Teams ermittelst du Anforderungen und priorisierst diese gemeinsam mit dem Team.
Du konzipierst, gestaltest und entwickelst Reporting-Landschaften für Aussteuerung und Controlling im Vertrieb sowie zur gezielten Erkennung von Verbesserungspotentialen für unser Trainings Team.
Als Teil der zentralen Reporting-Funktion der frisch gebildeten Bilthouse-Gruppe treibst du die Konsolidierung verschiedener Reporting-Landschaften zu einem einheitlichen BI Setup
Hierfür nutzt du Transaktions- und Masterdaten aus unserem Data Warehouse. Dabei implementierst du auch gelegentlich Anpassungen / Ergänzungen zu unserem relationalen Datenmodell, um Auswertungsanforderungen besser umsetzen zu können.
Dein Profil 
 
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Big Data, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem anderen relevanten Feld sowie Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence
Du begeisterst dich für die Themen Data, Analytics und Reporting und bist stets interessiert an neuen Technologien
Du bist ein starker Kommunikator und hast die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte auf das Wesentliche zu fokussieren
Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL
Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung mit Power BI
Dich zeichnet ein hohes Maß an Zuverlässigkeit für deine Themen sowie ein hohes Maß an Teamfähigkeit aus und deine Deutschkenntnisse sind auf muttersprachlichem Niveau, zudem hast du sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Unser Stack 
  Wir nutzen einen ELT-Stack um Daten aus unseren Quellsystemen zu beziehen, in unser Data Warehouse zu laden, und schließlich für Analyse-Zwecke aufzubereiten. Folgende Tools sind dabei im Einsatz:

Warehouse-Datenbank: PostgreSQL
Extract & Load: Meltano mit Singer Taps und eigenen Python Extraktoren
Transform: dbt
BI-Tools: Metabase + Power BI
Deine Vorteile 
  Tolle Vertragsbedingungen mit

attraktiver Vergütung und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
unbefristeter Laufzeit

Moderne Unternehmenskultur mit

der ganzen Bandbreite von Teamwork bis HomeOffice
viele tolle Benefits (z.B. Edenred-Gutscheinkarte, JobRad, BAV)
einem unkomplizierten Miteinander ohne DressCodes - Außerdem sagen wir: Du
ein unglaubliches People-Team mit einer empathischen und wertschätzenden Führungskraft

Wertvolle Perspektiven mit

eigenem Verantwortungsbereich und Raum zur Entfaltung von Ideen
Unterstützung bei der fachlichen Weiterbildung
einem Unternehmenswachstum, das durch die Decke geht - Wir verdoppeln uns nämlich regelmäßig seit 4 Jahren
About FinLink 
  FinLink is a next generation mortgage platform making home ownership simple, transparent and accessible for everyone.
 In our mission to make home ownership simple, transparent and accessible for everyone, FinLink has helped more than 100.000 people finance their home.
 We are a b2b2c software company striving to give home buyers and mortgage advisors a fully digital mortgage experience.
 We connect the home buyer’s journey of buying property with value-adding services along the way such as property valuation, robo-advice for financing options and leveraging AI to classify and read documents.
 Our advisor-facing application includes a fully-fledged back-office that empowers the advisor to support the customers with a maximum service level: We offer a reliable and efficient mortgage application processing using workflow management, e-mail, chat, as well as secure handling of financial documents - just to name a few.
 Our vision is to connect all areas of the real estate ecosystem to be a central hub for every stakeholder in the market. Our partners include real estate platforms (e.g. Immoscout24 and Immowelt), property valuation companies and lenders.
 Over 600 mortgage advisors from 100+ different companies use FinLink, including Swisslife Select, Baufi24, Homeday and Immo-finanzcheck.
 FinLink is part of the Baufi24 group, Germany’s fastest growing mortgage broker with 60+ branches across Germany.


 You can learn more about us here:
 FinLink
 ImmoLink
 Baufi24 Podcast

Job_Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Geospatial Data
Description:
THERE’S NOTHING ARTIFICIAL ABOUT THE INTELLIGENCE BEHIND OUR AI.
 SHARE YOUR PASSION.
 Artificial Intelligence and machine learning are at the cutting edge when it comes to shaping next-gen mobility in areas like autonomous driving. But it takes real intellectual leadership and expertise to identify and then harness the AI trends and technologies that will transform the way people travel for good.


Anticipating future drivers' expectations and meeting them with intelligent experiences is the challenge of the AI-based vehicle functions team within BMW Group Research. Our team strives to create immersive prototypes of a personalized, location- & context-aware mobility experience towards future mobility, customer experience and autonomous driving functions.

 What awaits you?

 As part of the team, you will work with mainly geospatial data to identify insights and hidden patterns based on complex data structures and user experience questions.
 You will use the complete Data Science, Machine Learning and Engineering pipeline to design and implement user functions.
 As part of your role, you will be visualizing and presenting findings and patterns to our stakeholders and management.
 In your project, you will create and develop fundamental and advanced Machine Learning models to provide and enable intelligent user experiences within our cars.
 You will be part of the team to enhance our software architecture and cloud infrastructure with data assets and pipelines for Machine Learning and AI.


 What should you bring along?

 University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or a comparable qualification.
 Several years of professional experience as Data Scientist, Data Engineer or Machine Learning Expert.
 Excellent programming skills (esp. Python, Scala, ...) with experience and knowledge of data and machine learning libraries and frameworks (esp. scikit-learn, pytorch, tensorflow, dask, ...).
 In-depth knowledge of and experience with cloud-based, distributed machine learning, data science and data engineering tools (e.g. Sagemaker, Spark, Flink, EMR, ELK-Stack, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, ...). 
Experience in visualizing data, analyzing results and communicating highlights to different stakeholders and management.
 Experience in managing projects with organizing tasks, budgets and milestones.
 Business-fluent English, German would be a plus.


 You are passionate about data science and machine learning? Apply now!

 Note: Please apply exclusively online via our career portal. Applications via other channels (esp. email) cannot be considered.

 What do we offer?

 30 days of holiday. 
Attractive remuneration. 
BMW & MINI promotions. 
Career development.
 Flexible organisation of working times. 
High Work-Life Balance. 
Mobility offers. 
And many other benefits - see bmw.jobs/benefits


 Earliest starting date: from now on
 Type of employment: unlimited Working hours: Full-time
 Contact: 
Enrico Horn BMW Group Recruiting Team +49 89 382-17001

Job_Title: Senior Perception Algorithm Engineer C++ - Autonomous Driving
Description:
AUTONOMOUS DRIVING IS BUILT ON FREE THINKING.
 SHARE YOUR PASSION.
 Revolutionising the future of mobility means setting standards today. Our vehicles already use intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving requires visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams in centres of excellence networked around the world to redefine the limits of what is possible.


A key aspect of autonomous driving is to be aware of the current local environment. We develop new state-of-the-art environment perception algorithms to accurately detect and track surrounding objects and obstacles based on measurement data of multiple sensors. As part of our team, you generate efficient and high-quality software that improves the perception capabilities and thereby also the safety and comfort for the future generation of autonomous vehicles at the BMW Group.

 What awaits you?

 As part of our feature team, you work on innovative algorithms for the environment perception of autonomous vehicles, especially multi-sensor detection/tracking of stationary obstacles and drivable space.
 You challenge state-of-the-art methods by extending existing concepts and developing new strategies.
 A state-of-the-art DevOps toolchain including Bazel, GitHub, Ansible, Artifactory, and Zuul to develop and deliver our software.
 Your tasks are versatile and include high-quality test-driven software development targeting series production, prototypical development of new concepts, a detailed in-depth qualitative and quantitative evaluation of different approaches, as well as integrating and testing developed software in our test fleet.


 What should you bring along?

 University degree (Master or PhD) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering / Information Technology, Robotics, or related field of study.
 At least 3-5 years of experience with developing embedded real-time systems. 
Profound practical experience in software development, especially excellent C++ programming skills. 
Strong expertise of sensor technologies, especially lidar, radar, and camera.
 In-depth algorithmic background in sensor data processing (especially occupancy grid mapping, data fusion, probabilistic state estimation, and clustering).
 Substantial experience with parallel data processing architectures and models (GPGPU, SIMD, CUDA, OpenCL, OpenMP) and optimizing code for specific hardware architectures.
 Business-fluent English.


 You are enthused by an innovative-volatile environment? - Apply now!

 Note: Please apply exclusively online via our career portal. Applications via other channels (esp. email) cannot be considered.

 What do we offer?

 30 days of holiday. 
Attractive renumeration. 
BMW & MINI promotions. 
Career development.
 Flexible organisation of working times. 
High Work-Life Balance. 
Mobility offers.
 And many other benefits - see bmw.jobs/benefits


 Earliest starting date: from now on
 Type of employment: unlimited Working hours: full-time
 Contact: 
Tamara Vuckovic BMW Group Recruiting Team +49 89 382-17001

Job_Title: Senior Consultant  - Allianz Consulting - Data Analytics #Standwithukraine
Description:
Job Purpose / Role




  Allianz Consulting was established in 2004 as the internal consulting division of Allianz Group. Our vision is to be the consulting partner of choice for Allianz Group core segments. Our experienced consulting teams support all Allianz operating entities worldwide in planning and implementing their local key strategic projects.
 

  Our consulting services focus on our clients' needs ranging from strategy, market management, sales and distribution, IT, organization, claims and operations to central functions and agile. We bring deep industrial and functional expertise to fulfill our clients’ requirements and support the overall vision of Allianz Group. In our practice area Emerging Technologies, we are excited to shape the future of Allianz with value-based and data driven solutions for Technology & Innovation.
 

  Joining Allianz Consulting means working in a fully international environment alongside talented colleagues who enjoy sharing their knowledge and experience, having increased personal responsibilities and working in a flat management hierarchy. Allianz Consulting has a reputation of focussing on growing its talent and on-the-job training from the very first day to ensure strong career development and preparation for future opportunities within the Allianz Group.
 



Key Responsibilities




Professionalization of Data Analytics & BI Use Cases while consulting in an interdisciplinary team under challenging technical and organizational parameters at Allianz Group
Responsibility for project progress and technical leadership of project team members
Enhancement, design, and presentation of use cases in data-based innovation
Independent promotion of innovative topics & sustainable solutions for Allianz departments in various insurance domains, considering technical as well as economic aspects
Support clients in the integration and enhancement of BI, Analytics, and Big Data solutions
Use of mathematical-statistical methods and creation of scenario models
Optimization of organizational processes based on analyses to create transparency, derive innovations and value-chain based business development
Creation of multidimensional insurance or operations models and solutions in data analytics to show our customers options for action (in the context of e.g., internal processes, claims analytics, sales & marketing analytics, or operations)
Data manipulation, analysis, and visualization of large amounts of data as a basis for precise prediction models
Collaborate with stakeholders on all levels to gather business requirements and specifications, perform strategic analysis and feasibility studies





Key Requirements / Skills / Experience




Successfully completed studies in business administration, economics, computer science, mathematics, software engineering, business informatics or engineering sciences and at least 3 years of professional experience, ideally in consulting with experience in Business Intelligence or Advanced Analytics (databases, data architecture, data modelling, project management)
Highest level of client and service orientation 
Commitment, high degree of responsibility and team spirit, very good communication skills in German and English as well as analytical thinking, precise working methods, and customer orientation





Desired Requirements / Skills / Experience




In-depth experience in data evaluation with MS Excel, ideally including Power Query/Pivot/BI or VBA
Advanced stakeholder management and presentation skills with exposure to senior management, proven experience in consulting or comparable service provision
Knowledge in the following areas is an advantage 
   
Data governance and strategy
Data manipulation (e.g., Python, R), analysis and visualization of large amounts of data (e.g., Databricks/Spark, MS Power BI, SAP Analytics, Qlik, Tableau)
SQL and SQL services, platform support (SharePoint, SQL Server)

3 years of responsibility for project progress and professional leadership of team members, as committed team player with a high sense of responsibility


  Insurance experience is not required but a plus, the expectation is that missing experience will be caught up during employment
