Job_Title: Business Development Manager, International Expansion , Amazon Incentives
Description:
BA/BS degree required.
Multiple years of experience in a direct enterprise sales role: business development, B2B sales, account management, or consulting sales.
 Job summary 
At Amazon Incentives, we strive to support corporate customers across all sizes and industries in rewarding their employees and customers, providing convenient and effective incentive solutions that are desired by recipients. As part of that, we offer Amazon Gift Cards, Prime Memberships and other branded values to businesses in eight European countries, where Amazon is present with a customer-facing storefront. 

 Amazon Incentives is looking for a customer-obsessed and results-oriented Business Development Manager, International Expansion to help us expand and grow the program in existing and new geographies. You will be a key contributor to shape our expansion strategy, own the launch and ramp-up of new territories, as well as deliver non-organic incremental initiatives for established locales. 

 This role requires a leader with a passion for servicing B2B customers and delivering results, who is able to build a business development strategy and execute it effectively by leveraging internal stakeholders like marketing, business intelligence, and other Amazon business units. You are an enthusiastic sales expert with proven enterprise client engagement and negotiation experience, able to deliver results autonomously and through others. You will identify major opportunities and risks for the market segment, elaborate strategical and tactical plans to achieve set goals and report progress to senior stakeholders. Externally, you will negotiate with distribution partners and clients, becoming their trusted advisor for products and use cases. 

 This role has high visibility within the EU team and leadership. Success in this position will require strong leadership skills, sound business acumen, excellent negotiation fundamentals, first-rate analytical capabilities, and an innovative approach to resource allocation. 

 Key job responsibilities 


Creating a business development strategy to achieve business objectives.
Execution of sales strategy to acquire new corporate clients and drive incremental business, with a focus on new territories.
Prospecting and lead generation initiatives, build a solid pipeline within targeted segments for the Amazon Incentives product suite (Gift Cards, Product Vouchers, Prime Promo Codes).
Managing existing accounts and seeking development opportunities within an owned portfolio.
Exploring market segment trends and collecting customer feedback to influence product/service development, working closely with stakeholders.
Collaborating and influencing internal stakeholders (Marketing, Operations, Product, Legal, and Finance)
Networking with Amazon retail and other corporate teams to unlock cross-department opportunities.
 A day in the life 
As Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for building a strategic plan to enter new territories and grow existing ones. You will be the main POC for internal stakeholders in relation to your owned portfolio and coordinate execution of initiatives. You will own the complete sales cycle for prospects, which you will acquire via inbound and outbound activities, leading the negotiation with clients to closure and ensuring ramp-up of the accounts. You will manage client requests and work with partner teams to continually improve the client experience. You will conduct performance analysis to ensure profitability of your portfolio, negotiate renewal terms with clients and provide business reporting to inform sales strategy and product/process improvements. 

 About the team 
Amazon Incentives enables businesses world-wide to improve employee motivation, increase customer loyalty or drive behavioral changes with Amazon Gift Cards, Product Vouchers, and Prime Promotional Codes. The selection, convenience and flexibility of our products allow our corporate clients to incent their audience with a reward that is relevant and meaningful to them. You will be part of a lean team with short reporting lines that enable autonomous decision-making. You will have the chance to closely work with peers and stakeholders across EU and NA, as well as gain exposure to business units outside your organization. 


Check out our Amazon benefits here:
 https://www.amazon.jobs/en-gb/benefits/global 



MBA or equivalent.
Strong negotiation skills with proven track record of winning new business.
Track record of working independently in building a pipeline through outbound prospecting (cold-calling, social media, etc.).
Ability to thrive in an ambiguous sales environment, applying solid judgement to make the right decisions.
Must be metrics driven and able to understand complex pricing structures. Proven analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to manage the business ‘by the numbers'.
Entrepreneurial mindset, with the tenacity to develop ideas independently, and the ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Customer service mindset to provide customers with the best experience.
Motivation to drive the business, a proactive attitude and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to achieve goals.
Advanced knowledge of Excel.
 Excellent command of Salesforce.com and related CRM tools. 


German language skills
 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. 

 m/w/d

In der vitagroup arbeiten deutschlandweit über 300 Spezialisten Tag für Tag daran, die Gesundheitsversorgung durch fortschrittliche Technologie und intelligente Services nachhaltig zu verbessern. Unsere digitalen Produkte und Lösungen zeigen schon heute, was in Zukunft möglich sein wird. Wir machen die Gesundheitsversorgung in Deutschland und der Welt durch die intelligente Nutzung von Daten besser. Unser Kernprodukt, das HIP Clinical Data Repository, speichert Gesundheitsdaten strukturiert und herstellerneutral nach offenen Standards. Damit bieten wir eine topaktuelle, auf neuesten Technologien basierende Softwarelösung für die aktuellen Anforderungen des Marktes. Zielgruppe sind alle Anbieter, die sich um Gesundheitsversorgung oder -Forschung bemühen: Von der Klinik über Kostenträger oder Gesundheitsregionen im In- und Ausland.
Bist Du Organisator, Gestalter und Macher (m/w/d)? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt!
Vor dem Hintergrund unseres strategischen Wachstumskurses bauen wir unsere Vertriebsorganisation konsequent aus. Damit wir unsere Lösung optimal in den Bereichen Marketing/Marktforschung, Market Access oder Gesundheitsökonomie platzieren können, suchen wir Dich, um mit unseren KundInnen an innovativen Lösungen zu arbeiten und neue Impulse am Markt zu setzen.
Dafür brauchen wir Dich

Auf Basis hochstrukturierter Gesundheitsdaten erarbeitest Du medizinische Anwendungsfälle
Du nutzt openEHR-Standards zur Modellierung von Gesundheitsdaten. und medizinische Terminologien für die Optimierung von Gesundheitsdaten
Gemeinsam mit unseren KundInnen arbeitest Du an der Beantwortung medizinischer und / oder versorgerischer Fragestellungen auf Basis unseres HIP CDRs
Du formulierst konkrete, kundenindividuelle Fragestellungen und greifst dabei auf OpenEHR Daten zu und verarbeitest sie. Dein Verständnis von medizinischen Zusammenhängen und eine Affinität zu Daten und deren Analyse helfen Dir dabei
Du erstellst proof-of-concepts/minimal-viable-products für interne und externe Kunden. Zudem unterstützt Du das Vertriebs- und Professional Services Team bei der Erstellung von Angeboten oder Prototypen und testest diese ausführlich
Du wirkst bei der Automatisierung von manuellen Prozessen mit: Dies beinhaltet die Identifikation von optimierbaren Prozessen, die Analyse des bisherigen Prozesses und die anschließende Automatisierung in Zusammenarbeit mit einzelnen Teammitgliedern
Bei funktionsübergreifenden Initiativen bist Du von der Idee bis zum Pilotprojekt mit dabei
Du förderst die Zusammenarbeit mit Added Value Resellern, Beratungsunternehmen bei dem Aufbau neuer Produktangebote
Beim kontinuierlichen Aufbau von strategischen Partnerschaften hilfst Du
Du treibst den Auf- und Ausbau eines Innovations-Netzwerks voran
Sowohl intern als auch extern überzeugst Du mit Deinen Präsentationen über neue Technologien und neuartige Anwendungsfälle

Das bringst Du mit

Du verfügst über mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit digitalen Innovationen
Du verfügst über einen Master-Abschluss in IT und/oder Business, Innovation oder der strategischen Förderung oder einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
Du warst schon im Vertrieb tätig und hast erste Erfahrung im Projektmanagement
Dich zeichnet Deine gründliche Arbeitsweise mit Auge für Details und Pragmatismus aus
Du kannst aktiv Zuhören und auf Kundenbedürfnisse eingehen
Du hast starke analytische Fähigkeiten, eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe und die Leidenschaft, aus komplexen Daten kundenorientierte Ergebnisse zu gewinnen
Deine Arbeitsweise zeichnet sich durch ein hohes Maß an Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Zuverlässigkeit und Eigeninitiative aus
Du hast sehr gute Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten auf Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift
Du konntest idealerweise bereits Erfahrung im Gesundheitswesen wie z.B. IoT, Business Intelligence, Clinical Decision Support, Telemedizin sowie

ein Verständnis von Gesundheitsdaten und Industriestandardformaten, einschließlich klinischer Daten wie z.B. FHIR/HL7/CDISC/ IHE sammeln, * Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit pharmazeutischen oder medizinischen Daten und kennst Dich mit SAS oder epidemiologischen Fragestellungen aus
Dein Plus bei der vitagroup

Agile & digitale Unternehmensstrukturen

Arbeitsort: Mobil

Our Company 

 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! 

 Job Description 

 This is an exciting opportunity to join the Professional Services Operations team as we support a rapidly growing services organization!!! As a member of the PS Delivery Analytics team, the Sr. Business Analyst will help navigate where we are headed using tools and models to provide insights to how much revenue we can deliver in upcoming quarters and the right mix of capacity to meet demand. 
The ideal candidate for this role can do multi-dimensional revenue planning and demand modeling as well as succinctly communicate model characteristics, output, and variances to Leadership. The modeling work has an entrepreneurial component, which requires a strong understanding of systems and tools used in PS to develop solutions connecting the dots of what we sell to who delivers. Our team works with people both globally and remotely as well as engage in processes in a matrix organization. 


What You’ll Do:
 Using data driven solutions to support the Q+1 (next quarter’s) revenue planning process. These include: 
Collaborating with our Global Delivery Center in India to build and lead a demand model in order to project expected hours and revenue by Geo 
Partner with the JAPAC team in supply/demand planning and any ad hoc analysis 
Provide a weekly tops-down analysis of APAC and Japan revenue performance 
Responsible for tracking JAPAC bill rate performance and backlog trending 
Support the JAPAC Delivery Operations Managers on other ad-hoc or recurring analysis that will help the business 
Effectively communicate recommendations to partners to influence business decisions that enhance business performance 
Achieve an integrated understanding of the important metrics and how they impact performance 
Identify and lead changes (tools, process) that better connect what we are selling to the resources available to deliver 


What You’ll need to Succeed:
 7+ years’ proven experience in software, SaaS and/or related industry 
Bachelor’s degree in a business, finance, or analytics related field 
Deep experience in analytics, data science, and/or financial modeling – particularly in building, deploying, and tracking forecasting or capacity models. 
Exceptional Excel skills; experience in PowerBi is a plus 
Self-starter who can handle complex tasks with minimal direction and develop new strategies and ways of approaching business challenges. 
Strong communication & interpersonal skills with ability to simplify the complex and use data storytelling to influence/drive decision making across cross-functional teams. 
Strong project management, planning, and organizational skills, including ability to handle several projects at a time in a fast-paced environment. 
Problem solver who can challenge the status quo and self motivated to take on unknowns!!

The Role
 We are more than a support team. We enable the rapid but sustainable growth of Personio and ensure the financial health and legal stability of the organization. If you want to work and learn in an interdisciplinary team of Finance, Legal and Business Intelligence and want to make a difference from day one, the BIFL team is the right place for you. We see ourselves as co-pilot of our business leaders and partner collaboratively with the entire organization, to enable data-driven decision-making by providing thoughtful analysis and insights. We are looking for a highly motivated Junior Manager Strategic FP&A (m/f/d) helping to evolve the strategic FP&A function at our company. In collaboration with highly-motivated colleagues, you will run and improve budgeting and forecasting processes, maintain the company finance model, run a company-wide financial planning tool, analyse business cases and bring financial literacy to the entire company.  Your responsibilities will include:

 Maintain and improve the integrated financial model of Personio
 Support further roll-out of Workday Adaptive Planning as a company-wide financial planning tool, as well as integration with Workday as finance ERP
 Support all forward-orientated key finance processes including long-term strategic plan, annual budgeting and rolling forecast
 Lead quantitative and qualitative analytical work that unlocks business insights and drives decision-making on key business topics (e.g. development of business case for new growth initiative)


 What you need to succeed


 You have relevant working experience in Finance, ideally in the field of (Strategic) FP&A
 You have a Bachelor/Master degree in business administration, economics, mathematics, physics or any related field
 You have profound knowledge of Google Workspace (incl. Google Sheets & Google Slides)
 Ideally you have first working experience with Adaptive Insights / Workday Adaptive Planning (or any highly comparable tool like Anaplan)
 You can professionally communicate in English (German is a plus)
 You are willing to learn fast and to take responsibility from day one
 You have an independent, analytical, data-driven, well-structured and solution-oriented work ethic


 Why Personio
 Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work! Work with us and receive:

 Competitive compensation package that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
 28 days of paid vacation, plus another additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
 2 Impact Days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibility
 Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! We offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework to suit your needs
 Annual personal development budget of €1,500 for conferences, courses, books, career coach, etc.
 Regular company and team events like Oktoberfest, ski trips, Christmas parties, and more! (COVID permitting)
 High-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes
 Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
 Save money with corporate discounts across brands like Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, and more
 Invest in your retirement via the Personio Pension Scheme, including a Personio contribution
 Choose between green mobility options, including a JobRad® bike or monthly public transportation ticket
 Access multiple fitness studios and sports facilities across Germany for €22 per month with a subsidized Qualitrain membership
 A beautiful, spacious office in the heart of Munich, complete with professional espresso machines, free drinks and snacks, and indoor and outdoor break spaces 

We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates, transforming the way millions of people experience work every day. In June 2022 we raised a second Series E funding of $200 million, allowing us to turbocharge this change and making Personio the fastest-growing and most valuable HR technology company in Europe.
 
 With over 6,000 customers and a team of 1,500 in seven offices across Europe, now is the perfect time to join! We’re hiring talented, impact-driven individuals who want to be more than just another employee. Will you be one of them?
 
 Personio is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We #EmbraceUniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to scale, we focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally.
 
 We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Job_Title: Werkstudent - Risk Data Analyst Credit Decision Engine
Description:
Die HypoVereinsbank ist Teil der UniCredit, einer paneuropäischen Geschäftsbank mit einem einzigartigen Angebot in Italien, Deutschland sowie Zentral- und Osteuropa. Unser Ziel ist es, die Gesellschaft dabei zu unterstützen sich weiterzuentwickeln, indem wir allen Beteiligten das Beste bieten und das Potenzial unserer Kund:innen sowie unserer Mitarbeiter:innen in ganz Europa zur Entfaltung bringen. Deshalb wurden wir bereits zum wiederholten Mal als europäischer Top Employer ausgezeichnet.


 Die Digitalisierung und unser Bekenntnis zu den ESG-Grundsätzen (Nachhaltigkeit & soziale Gerechtigkeit) sind Grundlage für unser Handeln. Sie unterstützen uns dabei, unsere Stakeholder hervorragend zu begleiten und eine nachhaltige Zukunft für unsere Kund:innen, die Gesellschaft und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen zu gestalten. Da die Vielfalt in einem Unternehmen auf der Einzigartigkeit seiner Mitarbeiter:innen beruht, respektieren und fördern wir Individualität in allen Dimensionen von Diversity.








         Deine Welt sind Daten? Du interessierst dich für innovative IT-Anwendungen? Du möchtest bereits während deines Studiums Erfahrung im Bereich Analytics, IT und Automatisierung im Finanzumfeld sammeln und mit deinen Ergebnissen an der strategischen Weiterentwicklung der Credit Decision Engine (CDE) mitwirken?
        




         Das Team „CDE Rules and Tools“ im Bereich Strategic, Credit and Integrated Risks ist verantwortlich für die in die Kreditentscheidungsprozesse integrierte Credit Decision Engine (CDE).
        





         Die CDE unterstützt die Benutzer, effizientere und effektivere Kreditentscheidungen in Echtzeit zu treffen und trägt somit als entscheidender Baustein zum Erfolg der digitalen Transformation zum innerhalb der UniCredit bei.
        


        Du unterstützt das Team bei Monitoring und Reporting der gewonnenen Daten und trägst so zur Weiterentwicklung der CDE bei
       









Das erwartet Dich bei uns 








Du bist unmittelbar am Weiterentwicklungszyklus der Credit Decision Engine beteiligt
 Du erhältst Einblick in ein modernes und flexibles Datenmodell und die zugehörige Datenbankstruktur
 Du unterstützt uns bei der Automatisierung unseres Reportings zu den getroffenen Kreditentscheidungen
 Du arbeitest mit einem State-of-the-Art Entscheidungstool (FICO Blaze Advisor)










Das bringst Du mit 








Studium im letzten Bachelor-Studienjahr oder laufendes Masterstudium mit Fokus auf (Wirtschafts)-Informatik / Mathematik / Naturwissenschaften / Ingenieurwissenschaften oder wirtschaftswissenschaftliches Studium mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt
 Erste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken und Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Programmiersprache, wie z.B. Python oder SAS
 Ausgeprägte Analyse-Fähigkeiten und Spaß an Lösung konkreter komplexer Aufgabenstellungen.
 Sicherer Umgang mit Office-Anwendungen
 Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse










Das bieten wir Dir 







#EnjoyMunich – Arbeite in der schönsten Stadt Deutschlands: Berge und Seen vor der Haustüre, jede Menge Kulturangebote und natürlich Weißwürste, Oktoberfest und Fußball
#BalanceYourLife – Digitalisierung und Flexibilität prägen unsere moderne Arbeitswelt. Gestalte Deinen Arbeitsalltag so, wie er am besten zu Dir passt: Ob im Office oder remote. Du bekommt einen Arbeitsvertrag mit bis zu 20h/Woche, die Du Dir dank Gleitzeit frei einteilen kannst
#GetMoneyAndMuchMore – Du wirst überdurchschnittlich gut und nach Bankentarif bezahlt. Das sichert Dir Urlaubsanspruch sowie Anspruch auf Lohnfortzahlung im Krankheitsfall
#UnlockYourPotential – Eine steile Lernkurve ist Dir garantiert. In Deinem abwechslungsreichen Werkstudium kannst Du Dein theoretisches Wissen aus dem Studium mit Praxiseinblicken ergänzen und so herausfinden, wo Deine Leidenschaft liegt
#MakeInnovationHappen – FinTechs, Big Data, Bitcoins: Das Bankenwesen entwickelt sich rasant weiter. Gestalte den digitalen Wandel einer der veränderungsstärksten Branchen aktiv mit, indem Du Deinen frischen Blickwinkel und Deine innovativen Ideen mit einbringst
#JoinOurTeam – Unsere Mitarbeitenden sind die treibende Kraft hinter unserem Erfolg und damit unser höchstes Gut. Weil wir uns unserer Verantwortung als Arbeitgeber bewusst sind, wurden wir erneut als Top Employer ausgezeichnet. Werde auch Du Teil unseres Teams
#ComeAsYouAre – Wir setzen uns für ein gerechtes und integratives Miteinander ein. Deshalb haben wir die Charta der Vielfalt unterzeichnet, gehören zu den Valuable 500 und fördern Menschen mit Behinderung in der Arbeitswelt. Die UniCorns vertreten unsere LGBTQI+ Kolleg:innen, während wir mit unserem Gender Diversity Programm für Chancengleichheit sorgen. Inklusion ist eine Verantwortung, der wir uns bewusst sind und die wir gerne tragen

Job_Title: Credit Analyst For Corporations, Complex Financing Transactions And Political Risk *
Description:
Credit Analyst for corporations, complex financing transactions and political risk (m/f/d)*

Location Munich

Credit risks are the main underwriting focus of the Financial Risk division team. We particularly account for trade credit, political risk, and surety in (re-)insurance. You will support our global team in analysing corporations, assessing complex business and in preparing independent credit decisions. Working together with you and using our broad range of expertise, we will actively push ahead with our division’s business development.
Your job

Analysing the creditworthiness of corporates and large business transactions
Evaluating complex financing structures including structured finance, export finance and sovereign risk profile transactions
Preparing internal credit applications with conclusive recommendations and independent justification of decisions for internal stakeholders and clients
Determining our risk appetite for major individual risks and the main business sectors
Monitoring the existing credit portfolio, identifying increased risks at an early stage and implementing appropriate risk control measures
Maintaining client contacts regarding product- and risk-related topics
Supporting further development of our internal tools and credit management systems
Assisting the examination and development of strategic growth initiatives and new business opportunities

Your profile

University degree, preferably in business, economics or equivalent training (banking traineeship followed by further education and training)
Professional experience in the field of corporate risk analysis supplemented by a sound understanding of risk analysis in structured finance, project finance, export finance, cash-flow-based lending or other product segments
Keen interest in following global political developments and geopolitics and ability to apply macroeconomic factors to credit decision-making
Sound knowledge of accounting and supervisory regulations
Sense of responsibility, willingness and ability to justify decisions in a clear and comprehensible manner, business-oriented approach
Ability to work in a team, proactive approach, ability to work independently
Confident manner, high degree of social skills and intercultural mindset
Fluent in German and English, additional language skills are a plus

About us
As the world's leading reinsurance company with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into a manageable risk we enable fundamental change. Join us working on topics today that will concern society tomorrow, whether that be climate change, major construction projects, medical risk assessment or even space travel. Together we embrace a culture where multiskilled teams dare to think big. We create the new and the different for our clients and cultivate innovation. Sounds like you? Make it happen and be part of Munich Re.


You will work in an environment where we think big: Change and culture are continuously role-modeled. We create and articulate a compelling and ambitious shared purpose, vision and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning
You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders
We communicate in a clear & authentic way: We interact with a positive and humble spirit. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn
You will grow with your clients: Whatever our role, we support business, in an efficient and effective way, to create value for our clients. We embrace new ways of working leveraging digitalization to deliver solutions
Join us, and experience that we lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to be capable of joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged

Apply now! Apply now! 
 Münchener Rückversicherungs-Gesellschaft Ann-Kathrin Hinz da Costa • HR Consultant Königinstraße 107 • 80802 München • GERMANY

Job_Title: It Solution Architect Business Intelligence And Planning
Description:
IT Solution Architect Business Intelligence and Planning (m/f/d) * 
In the central division Information Technology (IT) for the department Business Solutions (BS)


Location  Munich , Germany 

The IT Business Solutions Corporate Cross Functions section delivers business value through the management of IT products including execution of change projects, implementation and maintenance of applications in the area of Business Intelligence, Reporting and Planning. Business Solutions Corporate Cross Functions owns the key relationships (representing all IT service functions) with business units of Munich RE and closely collaborates with them in a Competence Center organization. This position will be located in Munich.

Your job 

Designing and implementing architectural solutions for Business Intelligence, Enterprise DWH, Financial Management Reporting and/or Financial Planning applications
Aligning business requirements with technical demands considering the enterprise architecture plans
Balancing out functional, service quality and systems management requirements in a complex Business Intelligence environment characterized by very high data volumes
Supporting strategic direction of technology investments to assist in the development of the enterprise architecture and maximize the return on technology investment
Overtaking responsibility for the adherence to appropriate standards (performance, monitor capability, audit compliance, security)
Identifying market trends in the area of Business Intelligence and support of Munich Re's business development using new future technologies in close alignment with the Enterprise Architecture Team
Technical end-to-end (sub) project management including consulting, conception, prioritization and steering of development activities considering the team´s capacity and timely as well as budgetary constraints
Communicating architecture objectives to business and consulting during the development of product requirements
Establishing and further development of an efficient Run organization in cooperation with our partners
Virtual and/or physical data integration in the sense of a single point/net of truth (virtual data warehouse)
Data modeling (data warehouse, databases) and data provisioning via reports or dashboards (data storytelling) or system interfaces

Your profile 

Very good university degree, preferably in engineering/computer science, or comparable qualification
Several years of experience in software development as an architect
In-depth knowledge of the overall software development and product lifecycle processes in the area of data warehousing, reporting or planning
Very good in-depth experience in technical development using well-known data integration, data warehousing and reporting/dashboarding technologies in SAP and non-SAP environment
Solid knowledge in data management, common database technologies and DWH/reporting (cloud) solutions, as well as data cataloging/master data management preferably in SAP environment
Proven track record of implementing projects that deliver real business value
Enthusiasm for technical problems and excitement for complex challenges and issues around data modeling and data flow implementation; knowledge of regulatory (insurance and banking) reporting is an advantage (HGB, IFRS, Solvency II)
Confident appearance; quick comprehension; structured, methodical approach; strong conceptual skills and the ability to adequately communicate complex issues
Ability to work in a team; consulting skills and a cooperative working style; willingness to take over responsibility
Experience in dealing with different stakeholders; ability to develop alternative proposals or compromise solutions whenever financial or business conditions do not allow for optimal solutions

  We are currently strengthening our sales department in

Are you ready to apply your research & development skills with AI-based solutions for biomedical imaging with focus on histopathology imaging; to impact and support AstraZeneca’s drug development and biomarker discovery programmes? AstraZeneca is a company that always follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines. If this sounds like a role you are excited about AstraZeneca might be the one for you!

 ABOUT ASTRAZENECA
 AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.

 SITE DESCRIPTION 
Our Computational Pathology Munich, one of over 400 sites here at AstraZeneca, providing an environment where everyone feels comfortable and able to be themselves is at the core of AstraZeneca’s priorities, it’s important to us that you bring your full self to work every day. To help you maintain your best self, here’s a sneak peek into some of the things this site provides for you: After-work events, lunch & learns, forward-thinking and spacious environment, balanced office working environment, events, family and childcare support and of course the Alps around the corner for hiking, biking and skiing.

 BUSINESS AREA
 From diagnosis to later stage development, we’re laser-focused on owning the way forward to build solutions that transform lives. We are passionate about identifying and treating patients earlier, where there is greater curative potential. With the greatest number of early stage cancer trials in the industry, we are getting closer to finding cures every day. It is the breadth and strength of our innovative pipeline that offers both security and stability. And with the goal to deliver 6 new molecular entities by 2025, it’s up to each of us to push our industry-leading Oncology pipeline forward and build the future.

 What you’ll do
 Development on AI based solutions for biomedical imaging, in particular, histopathology imaging supporting drug development and biomarker discovery programs, in close collaboration with interfacing functions at global AstraZeneca, in active scientific exchange with the computer vision and AI community.

 Generate data based on whole slide image analysis of histopathology imaging to advance the Early Oncology drug programs and AI-based biomarker solutions development.
 Further develop and apply the latest artificial intelligence methods to support image and data analysis in Translational Medicine and build towards deployment of these solutions into clinical practice.
 Work with our scientists to proactively automate workflows and train them in the tools/ standard processes critical for developing AI based image analysis.
 Inseminate knowledge, standard processes and developed algorithms and software tools to internal audiences in project meetings, AI seminars, documentation and code libraries, and to the external scientific and commercial communities.
 Collaborate with project team members and interfacing functions such as pathology, quality assurance, data management, software development, data science and bioinformatics.
 Follow the AstraZeneca General Laboratory Standard to support product quality and regulatory compliance in the development, manufacture and distribution of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients, Medicinal Products and Devices.


 Essential for the role

 M. Sc. or Ph.D. in computer science, bioinformatics, physics, mathematics or related scientific subject area.
 Track record of publications in the field of computer vision and machine learning.
 In-depth knowledge of software development using Python, deep learning and scientific compute libraries.
 Excellent communication and social skills while working in interdisciplinary, international and globally distributed project teams.
 Work independently on multiple tasks in a fast paced environment, be dedicated, detail oriented and constantly innovating.


 Desirable for the role

 Project experience in analyzing histopathology image data using state of the art deep learning methods (e.g. Convolutional Neural Networks, Graph NN, Vision Transformer) and correlating clinically relevant features with response to therapy and other clinical end-points.
 Experience working with Python (related technologies) and applying software development standards and in particular knowledge of python programming best practices e.g. documentation, pytest, type-checking etc.
 Project management skills, good organizational and planning skills, working in an agile project team working under a scrum process.


 Competitive salary package and benefits
 Close Date: 20/09/2022

 Why AstraZeneca?
 At AstraZeneca, we 're committed to being a phenomenal Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and release your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients, and society. A culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.

 So, what’s next? 

 Are you already considering joining the team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
 Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours.
 If you’re curious to know more please contact Louise Bennett


 Where can I find out more?
 Our Social Media,
 Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn
 Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook
 Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

Cartelux is on a mission to bring globally scalable video to the world’s most innovative brands. A rapidly scaling advertising technology company, with a thriving company culture, undergoing significant global expansion, Cartelux has launched into multiple industries including auto, property, finance and CPG. The Business Analyst position represents a truly unique opportunity to use your skills to affect a positive impact on our business & brand.
   

 About the role Cartelux is seeking an experienced Business Analyst for our proprietary platforms. At Cartelux, we manage fast paced, high value projects. As a Business Analyst, you are the key stakeholder on your project, responsible project scoping, gathering of requirements & intelligence and leading customer interactions. You will be able to maintain a close relationship with Business Stakeholders, working with them to analyse, communicate, test and validate requirements for the implementation or changes of the customized solution. Supported by our developer/architect you will define the final solution architecture, articulate it and ensure the follow up of their implementation.
   

     Germany is a key market for Cartelux ongoing growth & expansion globally. As a result we are on the hunt for Germany’s finest talent to accelerate & elevate Cartelux presence in Germany. As we are seeking the ideal candidate, and operate on a borderless basis, location is flexible across Germany. The role requires talent with supreme management and relationship credentials in addition to the ability to self-manage and be comfortable with the often changing landscape and business needs. Agility & Accountability are the key characteristics of the talent we are looking to add to our Cartelux team.
   

 Key responsibilities



      Analyse & capture requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, business analysis, task & workflow analysis.
    

      Document the requirements via Cartelux process by utilising use cases, solution design and UX.
    

      Lead workshops to drive detailed business requirements and conduct technical analysis of business requirements on project implementation engagements
    

      Engage & communicate with customers, understanding their business & anticipate solutions
    

      Develop processes & strategies to ensure projects are delivered accurately, on time & on cost
    

      Coordinate & oversee development with our technical team to ensure the delivery of the project
    

      Perform quality assurance to ensure the quality of the deliveries
    

      Assist in development of training materials
    

      Support product manager, sales team & technical team with new ideas, quotes and processes
    

      Provide first line support to clients with requests, changes, issues and help using the platform
    

      Monitor implementation process & campaigns running on channels i.e. Google, Line, Facebook
    

      Prepared to travel for key stakeholder meetings, if required.
    


 Skills & Experience to be successful in the role



      Business analyst role (3-4 years minimum)
    

      Academic degree in IT, project management or business analysis (Other qual considered)
    

      Analytic & Business focus mind
    

      Strong written and verbal communication – Germany & English
    

      Feeling comfortable in client facing activities (Operational and C-level)
    

      Eliciting & documenting business processes
    

      Time management, negotiation & stakeholder engagement skills
    

      Ability to work in a team and to collaborate with other members around project
    


 If you are interested in the position, please send your c.v. to hr@cartelux.com
     and make sure to include a cover letter along with the application to be considered.

ABOUT US
 If you are part of aioneers, you are on a journey to revolutionise supply chain management. You are part of a solid, creative start-up and a unique team. You do not only shape how companies manage their supply chain in the future or how aioneers grows – you also shape your own personal success story. At aioneers, we digitise tactical and strategic decision-making through our SaaS platform AIO for supply chain management and manufacturing operations. We believe in creating something big with the smartest technologies and people like you.
 YOUR ROLE AT AIONEERS
 To expand our team, we are looking for a passionate and detail-oriented data analyst.

 You analyze supply chain data using Python and create dashboards within consulting projects for our clients from different industries (e.g., pharma, manufacturing)
 You gather, transform and analyze data to identify supply chain improvement potentials
 You build the bridge between business and IT, helping to shape the best business solution while defining the requirements for the clients’ digitalization journey
 You will be an integral part of projects, creating and presenting product demos of our AIO platform and delivering these projects with strong customer interaction, driving workshops and solutioning
 You advise our clients not only on supply chain strategy and business transformation, but you also help our clients to digitalize and automate the management of their supply chains
 You are a self-motivated problem solver, who thrives in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment, combining technical, product, business and leadership perspectives
 You make decisions based on "best solution"
 You inspire our customers, every day anew, because this is the only way to achieve our goals!


 YOUR PROFILE
 You enjoy working in a professionally managed start-up and have fun working together to achieve success through your passion and commitment.

 Permanent residence in Germany with a valid work permit
 University degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Statistics or another quantitative discipline
 1-2 years of relevant work experience is considered a plus – applications from graduates are welcome
 Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with German language skills on at least B2 level
 Very good knowledge of supply chain management and operations
 Experience with Python and other scripting languages and tools (e.g., R, Spark, SQL)
 Experience in building dashboards with QlikSense / QlikView and/or other BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
 Experience with / interest in Azure Devops and Azure Databricks
 Experience in ETL processes & scripts, proficiency in MS Office with very good knowledge of MS Excel
 First experience with / technical understanding of software systems (e.g. ERP, advanced planning systems, BI tools) and data structures
 All skills to collaborate with customers as well as product and engineering teams
 Ability to understand customer requirements and challenges, prepare use case driven AIO platform product demos and conduct client presentations
 Affinity for new technologies and a drive to self-employed learning
 Affinity for an open feedback culture with flat hierarchies


 WHY AIONEERS?


 Permanent contracts: It is your chance to shape your future as well as that of a company
 Employee stock option program: Because we believe in you and your ideas, we share success with you 
Attractive insurance offer: We help you take care of your future by offering attractive insurance arrangements
 Flexible work arrangements: Enjoy the benefit of flexible work times as well as mobile working to maintain your work-life balance
 30+ 2 (Christmas Eve and New Year´s Eve) days of vacation: We add vacation days on top of the legal minimum so that you have enough time for relaxation in addition to work
 Mentor and buddy program: We support you from your first day: both in your daily tasks and in career development
 Team events: Family events with all aioneers, so that we not only work together but also celebrate together
 State-of-the-art equipment: State-of-the-art laptops and cell phones for more efficient and pleasant digital collaboration

Job_Title: (Senior) Clinical Scientist - Drug Development (All Genders Are Welcome)
Description:
Your mission
 We are currently looking for a (Senior) Clinical Scientist - Drug Development.  Ethris, based in the biotech hub Planegg / Munich, Germany, is a technical innovator in the field of messenger RNA (mRNA) therapeutics, an emerging alternative to gene therapies and protein-based drugs.  The company has developed two proprietary technology platforms to enable the use of mRNA as a therapeutic agent: stabilized non-immunogenic mRNA (SNIM®RNA) for transcript therapy and lipidoid nanoparticle (LNP) delivery technologies for SNIM® RNA delivery.  We focus on the development of mRNA-based therapeutics and vaccines for the treatment of respiratory diseases. Our technology helps replace or supplement missing or non-functional proteins or introduce new proteins to modulate disease progression or symptoms. We are committed to bringing these new technologies to patients as soon as possible.  Do you have an entrepreneurial mindset, and would you like to be at the forefront of mRNA therapeutics innovation? Join Ethris and become part of our journey!  As a (Senior) Clinical Scientist you will be contributing to or leading conceptualization, planning, management, analysis, and reporting of clinical development programs in the fields of respiratory, infectious, and rare diseases. Your key accountabilities will include:

 Contribute to the development and execution of integrated clinical development plans
 Support or lead development of study-related documents (clinical study protocols, IBs, eCRFs, and other clinical or regulatory documents) 
Support clinical endpoint characterization, selection, and justification
 Support the development of data review plans, continuous review of study data, and study data analysis and reporting (e.g., clinical study reports, manuscripts)
 Support the preparation and execution of investigator, advisory board, and health authority meetings
 Support the study team in the identification, set up and maintenance of electronic study tools (e.g., eCRF, clinical database UAT, data visualization systems)
 Generate study-related training materials and provide respective training to study team and study site staff
 Develop and maintain relationships with external partners such as KOLs and investigators
 Ensure Good Clinical Practice (GCP) compliance of clinical trials
 May deputize for Medical Director in clinical aspects internally and/or externally


 Your profile
 We are seeking an individual with the following qualification and skills:  

Advanced degree in life sciences such as MS, PharmD, MPharm, or PhD
 At least 2-4 years of experience in clinical research in Biotech or Pharmaceutical industry 
Disease area expertise in respiratory, rare and/or infectious diseases strongly preferred
 Solid knowledge of clinical trial procedures and Good Clinical Practice (GCP) 
Experience in clinical protocol development (ideally in Phase 1-2), clinical data analysis including use of electronic tools, and interpretation of clinical data
 The ability to lead by influence within a matrix structure, including strong analytical, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills
 Highly flexible working style and ability to work independently, prioritize, and delivery under pressure
 Excellent oral and written communication skills in English; German is an advantage but not required


 Why us?
 As a highly innovative and growing company in the field of biotechnology, we offer an immensely interesting as well as demanding job in close collaboration with the company management. You will get the opportunity of a “steep learning curve”, quickly growing operational, strategic and personal skills as part of a highly motivated team. An open communication culture and working atmosphere combined with a strong team spirit contribute to our success.  Ethris, based in the biotech hub Planegg / Munich, Germany, is a technical innovator in the field of messenger RNA (mRNA) therapeutics, an emerging alternative to gene therapies and protein-based drugs.
  The company has developed two proprietary technology platforms to enable the use of mRNA as a therapeutic agent: stabilized non-immunogenic mRNA (SNIM®RNA) for transcript therapy and lipidoid nanoparticle (LNP) delivery technologies for SNIM® RNA delivery.
  We focus on the development of mRNA-based therapeutics and vaccines for the treatment of respiratory diseases. Our technology helps replace or supplement missing or non-functional proteins or introduce new proteins to modulate disease progression or symptoms. We are committed to bringing these new technologies to patients as soon as possible.
 

Working and living in 
Munich
:
 Munich is a beautiful city in southern Germany that offers a particularly high quality of life and safety. The Munich area is considered one of the leading biotechnology hubs in Europe. Besides Ethris, the Munich area is home to around 350 companies that are active in the life science sector including roughly 130 small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Most of these SMEs are spin-offs from Munich’s renowned academic institutions: Ludwig Maximilian University, Technical University, Max Planck Institutes of Biochemistry, Neurobiology, and Psychiatry, and the Helmholtz Center for Environmental Health.

Responsibilities: 
 
   Hexagon ALI is seeking a senior data scientist to join a new, international development team specializing in the application of AI/ML algorithms to add intelligence to brownfield drawings and laser scans to feed smart data into our integrated suite of applications relevant to the lifecycle of process and power plants. You will work in an agile team based in Germany, collaborating with other teams based in the United States, United Kingdom, Israel, and India and working within a multi-tenant, Cloud-only application framework based on the latest technologies.
 


 Responsibilities include:
 


 Working as a member of an agile development team comprised of software developers, quality assurance and technical writers to develop and upgrade software products

Das Wichtigste über uns 
    
Als mittelständische Beratung mit 6 Standorten in München und der Welt helfen wir unseren Kund:innen dabei, digital, agil und vernetzt zu arbeiten.


Unsere Arbeitsphilosophie in vier Worten? Freude, Fairness und fantastische Ergebnisse. Unser Anspruch ist Exzellenz ohne Kompromisse, dafür mit einem wertschätzenden Miteinander.


150 Kolleg:innen mit internationalem Background sorgen für frischen Wind und ein vielschichtiges Umfeld. Charakterköpfe willkommen!




Hello, Junior Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d)! Munich Full-time employee 
  



     Bei diesem Job analysierst und visualisierst Du Daten, um Kollegen und Kunden geschäftsrelevante Erkenntnisse zu ermöglichen. Außerdem designst Du ETL-, Data-Warehouse-, Reporting- und Data-Management-Lösungen und implementierst diese bei unseren Kunden. Warum Du das genau bei uns tun solltest?
    

      Dafür gibt es viele Gründe. Doch der wichtigste lautet: Weil Ventum ein kleines bisschen anders ist als andere Consulting-Unternehmen. Unser Leitspruch lautet:
    

      Und das meinen wir auch so: Statt Machtkämpfe findest Du bei uns eine bunte, fröhliche und authentische Business-Familie, in der echte Werte zählen. Kurz: ein Platz zum Ankommen und Weiterkommen.
    






5 Dinge, die Du in diesem Job erleben wirst



Wie Du unsere Kunden mit innovativen, technischen BI-Lösungen begeisterst und entscheidend zur strategischen Entwicklung von Unternehmen beiträgst.
Den Moment, wenn Dir nach tagelanger Analyse komplexer Prozesse ein Licht aufgeht und Du einem Projekt zum Durchbruch verhilfst.
Wie Du ein von Dir mitentwickeltes Data-Warehouse-System in Betrieb nimmst und die ersten Analysen ablaufen lässt.
Wie spannend es ist, komplette Kundenworkshops von der Entwicklung über die Durchführung bis zur Nachbereitung zu verantworten.
Dass Du auch in einer Junior Stelle mit Deinem selbstständigen, unternehmerischen Handeln viel Gestaltungsfreiraum bekommst.






Dies ist Deine Traumstelle, wenn



Du fit in mindestens einer Programmiersprache bist und agiles Projektvorgehen für Dich keine blanke Theorie mehr ist.
Du eine Art Simultanübersetzer zwischen Mensch und IT bist und in einem Gespräch über fachliche Anforderungen vor Deinem inneren Auge bereits technische Konzepte Gestalt annehmen.
Wenn Du dank Deines Studiums im Bereich Wirtschaft oder Informatik Datenplattformen wie Oracle, PostgreSQL oder MSSQL bedienen kannst und Dich gut mit SQL und Datenmodellierung auskennst.
Es Dir Freude macht, Anwender zum vielfältigen Thema Business Intelligence, Data Analytics und Cloud Computing zu beraten.
Du Dich nicht nur mit Zahlen gut ausdrücken kannst, sondern in der Lage bist, komplexe Sachverhalte für andere verständlich in Wort und Schrift darzustellen.








Das gibt es on top



Ein Fellow (oder wie wir es nennen: Vellow), der Dir in Deinen ersten Wochen bei uns zur Seite steht. 


Einen erfahrenen Counselor aus unserem Team, der Dich langfristig bei Deiner Karriere passend zu deiner Lebensplanung begleitet. 


Einen Kisten-Pack-Bonus, wenn Du für uns umziehst. 


Wenn Du möchtest: Einen Arbeitsplatz in unserem neuen Büro mit Blick über den Olympiapark in München inkl. Themenrestaurants und Essenszuschuss. Wir sind aber auch offen für alternative Arbeitsmodelle wie Remote-Work. 


Arbeitszeiten auf Vertrauensbasis. Wir zählen darauf, dass Du da bist, wenn es nötig ist. Dafür sind wir flexibel, wenn Du mal nachmittags wegmusst. Generell gilt: Ergebnisse vor Stunden.


Deine Karriere unterstützen wir mit 4.000 € Fortbildungsbudget, Fortbildungstagen, Coaching und dem Programm Career@Ventum.


Viel, viel Gestaltungsspielraum für Deine eigenen Ideen und Visionen. Oder auch mal ein Sabbatical. Schließlich bist Du dann am kreativsten und produktivsten, wenn Du glücklich bist.


Natürlich bieten wir dir auch kostenlose Parkplätze. Du kommst mit dem Rad? Dann nutze unser Jobrad-Modell für Arbeit und Freizeit. Neben einem Zuschuss übernehmen wir die Versicherung und die Wartung.

 Ein zukunftsorientiertes Umfeld braucht ambitionierte Persönlichkeiten! Daher suchen wir zur Verstärkung unseres Teams Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die für die TravelTech Branche brennen und mit uns die Onlinebuchbarkeit von Ferienhäusern und Ferienwohnungen vorantreiben möchten.




Du suchst neben deinem Studium die Möglichkeit, in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld zu arbeiten? Dann bieten wir dir eine Möglichkeit, dein Wissen in die Tat umzusetzen und sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen.  Amelie Jansen bewerbung@ds-destinationsolutions.com 
        



Interesse geweckt?

 Unsere Kultur

 Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen

Gestalten Sie die Zukunft. Ihre und unsere.
 

   Sie möchten Ihre Talente entfalten, Ihre Stärken beweisen, Ihre Ideen einbringen? Als ein führender europäischer Anbieter von Finanz- und Vorsorgelösungen unterstützen wir mit Leidenschaft Menschen, finanziell für sich zu sorgen – ein Leben lang. Das Know-how und die Leidenschaft unserer Mitarbeitenden ist dabei die Grundlage unserer Erfolge. Deshalb fördern und unterstützen wir auch Sie individuell und bedarfsgerecht sowohl in Ihrer persönlichen als auch bei Ihrer beruflichen Entwicklung.
   Suchen Sie eine Karriere mit Zukunft? Dann herzlich willkommen bei Swiss Life!
 


   Wir sind ein mittelständischer Lebensversicherer, der im Vertrieb mit unabhängigen Vermittlern arbeitet. Dabei arbeiten Vermittler sowohl direkt mit unserer Software als auch mit unabhängigen Vergleichsprogrammen. In unserem Bereich wollen wir maßgeblich dazu beitragen, unsere Projekte und Prozesse auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Geschäftspartner auszurichten. Dazu begleiten wir verschiedene Vorhaben, Systeme und Prozesse und bringen dort unser vertriebliches Knowhow ein.
 


   Folgende Aufgaben übernehmen Sie:
 

 Als Business Analyst (m/w/d) setzen Sie sich intensiv mit den Bedürfnissen und Anforderungen unserer Geschäftspartner und des Vertriebs auseinander. Denn Sie vertreten deren Bedürfnisse im Kontext von Digitalisierungs- und Regulationsvorhaben
 Mit Ihrem Know-how, Ihrer Kundenorientierung und Ihrer Kompetenz tragen Sie zu unseren agilen Entwicklungsprozessen bei
 Sie verantworten und organisieren Vorhaben („Epics“ bzw. „Projekte“), die Einfluss auf die Geschäftsprozesse im Vertrieb haben, eigenständig
 Dabei koordinieren sie diverse Stakeholder aus dem Vertrieb und aus anderen Fachbereichen, um die Anforderungen zu verstehen, zu strukturieren und zu priorisieren
 Sie arbeiten diese Anforderungen zusammen mit Stakeholdern und Umsetzungsteams aus. Über den Lebenszyklus eines Vorhabens werden sie dabei immer spezifischer, bis sie die Anforderungen zur konkreten Umsetzung an IT-Teams übergeben
 Sie geben dem Team während des Entwicklungsprozesses beständig Feedback, führen Fachtests durch und unterstützen bei der Abnahme



   Folgende Qualifikationen und Kompetenzen bringen Sie mit:
 

 Sie haben ein Studium im Bereich Wirtschaft abgeschlossen oder verfügen über eine gute Ausbildung in der Versicherungswirtschaft
 Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in der Versicherungsbranche können Sie vorweisen
 Sie haben ein Gespür für den Auf- und Ausbau von Netzwerken und verfügen über eine analytische Denkweise für ganzheitliche Prozesse und für die Bedürfnisse von Kunden
 Idealerweise haben Sie bereits Erfahrungen in agilen Unternehmensstrukturen gemacht und können Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Atlassian Jira, Confluence und MS Office nachweisen, alternativ sind Erfahrungen und Kenntnisse in der Projektleitung hilfreich
 Zudem begeistern Sie uns durch eine hohe Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Verantwortungsbewusstsein, eine selbstständige, eigenverantwortliche und präzise Arbeitsweise sowie eine ausgeprägte Methoden- und Präsentationskompetenz



   Das bieten wir Ihnen:
 

 Auf Grund unserer flachen Hierarchien können Sie einen direkten Beitrag zum Unternehmenserfolg leisten
 Unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten sichern Ihnen eine Work-Life-Balance
 Daneben können Sie aus vielfältigen Varianten der betrieblichen Altersvorsorge wählen
 Sie werden individuell in Ihren Stärken gefördert – mit auf Sie angepasste Weiterbildungs- und Karrieremöglichkeiten

Financing the future.



 We are more than Financial Services as we are turning ideas into reality. Be it the global transition to cleaner energy sources, the digitalization of manufacturing, the rapid development of smart infrastructure, mobility solutions and healthcare systems - financing is more crucial than ever. We make real what matters by combining our financial expertise with deep technical know-how to provide unique financial solutions. Do you want to play an essential role in helping build a better future? Are you also keen on turning established thinking on its head in the search for game-changing solutions that maximize value creation? Then join our team and let’s develop together what will be important tomorrow!s.
  

What part will you play?



 As Credit Analyst (f/m/d) in the Risk Rating department EMEA/Asia Australia you prepare credit analysis and assign risk ratings for project finance transactions and corporate obligors of SFS’ project and structured business in Europe, Middle East, Asia and Australia and engage in the development of rating methods, credit data banks and the digitalization of rating processes.
  

 You independently evaluate the creditworthiness of projects and corporate obligors in a variety of industries with a focus in the energy and infrastructure sectors
 You analyze borrower’s financial models, financial statements, and cash flow projections and prepare and sensitize internally prepared cash flow models
 You efficiently collaborate as member of a deal team incorporating Rating, Risk Management and Origination
 You assign an obligor rating within the given Rating Authority
 Additionally, you continually monitor the creditworthiness of portfolio counterparties and initiate rating actions as deemed necessary
 The analysis is presented to the next higher rating authority holder, the Rating Committee and the Siemens Bank Credit Committee
 You ensure constant knowledge exchange with Risk Rating Americas as well as Risk Management in the Business Units
 You support in the training and coaching of less experienced rating analysts and/or colleagues in other SFS Functions or Business Units
 You participate in refining existing rating methodologies and in developing new rating methodologies if required from the business
 You support in the further development of SFS’ general rating data base
 Furthermore, you explore and proactively drive opportunities within Risk Rating to digitalize parts of the analytical process and to use artificial intelligence solutions


 What you need to make real what matters.


 You have successfully obtained a university degree in economics/business administration or a comparable field of studies
 You have collected at least 3-4 years of professional experience in financial analysis at a bank or another financial institution, ideally in the global project financing sector
 Alternatively, you have completed an apprenticeship in combination with long-term work experience
 You have professional knowledge in corporate finance and macro economics
 We´re looking for a new team member with strong affinity for digitalization and artificial intelligence topics and a spirit to promote related projects; proven experience in these areas is welcome
 You have sound experience in working with financial models as well as professional analytical capabilities (financial statement analysis)
 You know how to convey analytical conclusions in a well-structured manner in a rating report and possess a confident appearance presenting rating analysis to Authority Holders
 You are a strong team player and can work under time pressure while maintaining a positive focus
 You always demonstrate a constructive, outcome-oriented behavior
 You are fluent in German and English, knowledge of other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, Italian) is a plus 



      What we offer.
    


 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a future global standard
 Attractive remuneration package
 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
 Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
 Appealing Siemens pension benefits
 Find more benefits here
