 Organization: Siemens Financial Services
 Company: Siemens Bank GmbH
 Experience Level: Mid-level Professional
 Full / Part time: Full-time

Company: Max Planck Computing and Data Facility (MPCDF)
Description:
The Max Planck Computing and Data Facility (MPCDF), based at the research campus Garching near Munich, Germany, is a competence center of the Max Planck Society (MPG). The MPCDF operates supercomputers and data repositories for the MPG with more than 350 Petabytes of data being stored on disk and on tape backends. The MPCDF is also engaged in the development and optimization of algorithms and applications for high performance computing (HPC), artificial intelligence, and machine learning, as well as in the design and implementation of solutions for data-intensive projects in close collaboration with the Max Planck Institutes.  The MPCDF is looking for 
System Specialists (m/f/div) (two Positions) for the Development and Operation of Complex Scientific Storage Infrastructures
ID 08/2022
As part of the storage team, the applicants will be responsible for the operation of the generic block, file, and object storage systems at MPCDF. Within our team, you will ensure that these systems operate in a secure, stable, and performant manner. Using in-depth information gathered from proactive monitoring tools, combined with feedback from our users, you will contribute to further extensions of our systems - both in terms of hardware expansion / replacements and software evolution. Additionally, you will be involved in the planning and deployment of new systems such as Ceph object storage with data access, from different high-level applications and HPC systems. 
 Your responsibilities will also include the operation of a well established web-based sync&share service, including the evaluation and potential implementation of more scalable alternatives integrated with the generic Ceph based storage. 
 Your qualification: 

University degree (BSc or higher) in computer science or comparable qualification
Proficient in spoken and written English
Communicative team player, with the ability to work independently and responsibly
Several years of professional experience in Linux systems administration, automation and DevOps

Preferred qualifications in some of the following areas:

Software-defined storage (Ceph, S3)
Distributed and parallel file systems (CephFS, NFS, Samba, Spectrum Scale, Lustre, BeeGFS)
Configuration management (Ansible, Puppet, Git)
HA technologies (Pacemaker, STONITH, Keepalived)
Operation of distributed web applications (HAProxy, NGINX, Redis, MariaDB)
Cloud and container technologies (Docker, Podman, Kubernetes, OpenStack)
Programming and scripting languages (Python, Go, PHP, Bash)

 The two positions start as soon as possible and are initially limited to a maximum period of two years with the possibility of a longer-term extension. Salary will be based on experience up to salary group E 13 TVöD. 
Benefits include:

Helpful, highly motivated, and multidisciplinary team
Open, inspiring, dynamic, and international atmosphere
Options for training and professional development
Flexible working hours with options for mobile working
Various offers to reconcile work and family life, e.g. child care on campus
Close by subway station (U6); MVV job ticket with extra grants
Free parking on premise

Job_Title: Senior Data Scientist  Online Marketing & E-Commerce / Remote Möglich
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung
  Fashion und Lifestyle, 6.500 Mitarbeiter:innen, 13 Department Stores, Online-Shops in Deutschland, Polen, Österreich, Belgien, Luxemburg, Spanien, den Niederlanden und der Schweiz, über 2000 Marken, 25 Restaurants & Confiserien, 15 erstklassige Services, drei Friseur-Salons und stets ein besonderes Einkaufserlebnis – das ist Breuninger. Ein Traditionsunternehmen, das internationale Wege geht, seine Ziele klar definiert und innovative Möglichkeiten schafft.
 Unser Hauptsitz befindet sich in Stuttgart, die Tätigkeit ist aber auch remote ausführbar.



 Stellenbeschreibung
 

 Innerhalb des Teams Marketing Analytics verantwortest Du die Entwicklung statistischer Modelle und datenbasierter, smarter Algorithmen, um unser Online Marketing unter Berücksichtigung datenschutzrechtlicher Aspekte immer personalisierter zu gestalten und im richtigen Moment an unsere Zielgruppen auszuspielen
 Insbesondere entwickelst Du unsere Data-driven Attributionsmodelle kontinuierlich weiter und bist Impulsgeber wie auch Sparringspartner für Marketing Analysten und Online Marketing Manager
 Du lernst Online Marketing dabei als spannenden Bereich mit komplexen Herausforderungen für Machine Learning kennen, setzt ein breites Spektrum an Werkzeugen zur Lösung Business-bezogener Fragestellungen ein und verbesserst unser Online Marketing mit Artificial Intelligence und Predictive Analytics
 In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Marketing Analysten, Online Marketing Managern, AdTechStack Product Ownern und anderen Data Scientists bringst Du Deine Modelle live und optimierst diese kontinuierlich




 Qualifikationen
 

 Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschafts-/ Medieninformatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang
 Du bringst mehrere Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science mit und verfügst idealerweise über Kenntnisse im Bereich E-Commerce oder Online Marketing
 Du kannst auf eine hohe Expertise in Python, SQL sowie R zurückgreifen und hast einen fundierten Background in Machine Learning und Predictive Analytics
 Dein kommunikatives Fingerspitzengefühl hilft Dir dabei, dem Team Deine Ergebnisse schnell und verständlich zu vermitteln
 Du bist ein Teamplayer und aktiver Treiber von Veränderungen. Deine ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie Dein hohes analytisches Denkvermögen runden Dein Profil ab

 Zusätzliche Informationen
  Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem modernen, agilen sowie wertschätzenden Umfeld zu arbeiten. Fühlst Du Dich angesprochen? Dann findest Du bei Breuninger ein Team, in dem Du Dich wohlfühlen und nachhaltig wirken kannst.
 Eine spannende Herausforderung in einem innovativen und gleichzeitig traditionsreichen Unternehmen
 Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit freiwilligen Sozialleistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld sowie 30 Tage Urlaub
 Eine große Verantwortung und Raum für eigenen Ideen
 20% Mitarbeiterrabatt auf das gesamte Sortiment gemäß den aktuellen betrieblichen Bestimmungen
 Hochmotivierte Kollegen in einem tollen Team
 Persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

 Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?
 Dann sollten wir uns schnell kennenlernen!
 Bei Fragen steht Dir Lena Domeyer gerne jederzeit zur Verfügung.
 Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online Bewerbung mit Angabe Deiner Verfügbarkeit sowie Gehaltsvorstellung.

 Impressum

Responsibilities 
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

 Why Join Us 
At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. 

 Our Accounts Receivable team sits under our global revenue management team. Our team closely partners with our global business development, and supports multiple corporate-facing and customer-facing business lines of the company. 


Position Summary:
 We are looking for a dedicated Accounts Receivable Analyst to help us supporting our EU business. The Accounts Receivable Analyst will be the point of contact for customer's and internal stakeholder's inquiries about contracts approval, billing queries, consumption and many other Finance questions. The daily routine involves contract approval, invoicing, debt collection and other AR related tasks. As part of a team in our rapidly growing business, this individual will play a key role in understanding the needs of our clients and will help shape efficient and trusted relationships with our business partners. 


Responsibilities:


Review EU business revenue contracts, especially financial terms.
Review the process of refunds, top-ups, etc. to ensure financial compliance.
Debt collection management and business data report management.
Propose corresponding system optimization requirements in response to the changes in business development.
Perform Collection, Cash allocation, Invoicing and other tasks related to AR.
Build/optimize processes, specifications, related templates, etc.
Support the headquarters finance team as requested.
Provide relevant support to the business department as necessary.
Other ad hoc work assigned by the leader.
 Qualifications 


Strong logical thinking ability, sense of responsibility, good work habits, sound judgment and excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong logical thinking ability, sense of responsibility, good work habits, sound judgment and excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiar with the local commercial market environment and customer habits in Europe; have experience in AR and debt collection.
European/internationally renowned university bachelor degree or above in finance or accounting, preferably with local certificate/qualification.
3 years or so of European work experience, preferably with International Internet advertising revenue experience.
Proficient in English, preferably with other European languages competence
 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job_Title: Data Analyst Mit Leidenschaft Für Den Öpnv
Description:
Für unseren Bereich Verkehrsforschung suchen wir vom Berufseinsteiger bis zum berufserfahrenen Experten (w/m/d) zum nächstmöglichen Termin eine/n Data Analyst mit Leidenschaft für den ÖPNV (w/m/d)




Die MVV-Verkehrsforschung 


ist u. a. für Verkehrserhebungen, Einnahmenaufteilung und Verbundstatistik zuständig und liefert die Datengrundlage für Nahverkehrsplanung, Tarifkalkulation, Marketing und Einnahmenaufteilung. Dazu werden Mobilitätsdaten im MVV fortlaufend erfasst, aufbereitet und fortgeschrieben, eine einheitliche Datenbasis sichergestellt sowie die Einnahmen und Erstattungsleistungen ermittelt und aufgeteilt.




Hier kannst Du viel bewegen 


Gehe mit uns neue Wege in der Verkehrsforschung und Einnahmenaufteilung und gestalte spannende Aufgaben mit, wie z. B. die Verbundraumerweiterung, den Pilotversuch zum eTarif oder die Einführung Automatischer Fahrgastzählsysteme (AFZS). Komme in unser Team, denn Verkehrsforschung ist Teamarbeit. Nur zusammen mit Dir können wir die vielfältigen Aufgaben erfolgreich erfüllen. Du bist u. a. zuständig für:

Konzeption von Verkehrserhebungen: bedarfsorientierte Konzeption von Verkehrserhebungen durch Festlegung der Grenzwerte der statistischen Parameter sowie Vorgabe der Erhebungsverfahren einschließlich Umfang, Zeitraum und Stichprobe,
Datenmanagement: Ermittlung von Qualitätskennzahlen sowie Erstellung und Aufbereitung von Qualitätsberichten
Weiterentwicklung der Methoden: praxisorientierte Weiterentwicklung der Erhebungsmethoden und -verfahren auch mit Blick auf alternative Möglichkeiten zur Datengewinnung und -verarbeitung,
Betreuung des Softwaresystems FAN: anwenderseitige Weiterentwicklung des Softwaresystems FAN (=Fahrgastanalyse im Nahverkehr) entsprechend den Anforderungen sowie laufende Weiterbildung der Anwender/innen.





Das bringst Du mit 



Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem verkehrsnahen oder datentechnischen Studiengang bzw. abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung und einschlägige Berufserfahrung,
Eine Affinität zu mathematisch-statistischen Fragestellungen und eine Leidenschaft für große Datenmengen,
Erfahrung im Arbeiten mit Office365 (v.a. Excel, PowerPoint, Power Apps) und mit IT-Lösungen für komplexe und große Datenmengen sind von Vorteil,
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) runden Dein Profil ab.
Lösungsorientiertes und visuelles Denken sowie eine strukturierte und analytische Herangehensweise liegen Dir im Blut,
die Verwendung von statistischen Methoden ist Dir nicht fremd,
eine zuverlässige und sorgfältige Arbeitsweise, stetige Lernbereitschaft und die Fähigkeit, eigenverantwortlich im Team zu arbeiten – so würdest Du Dich beschreiben.





Das bieten wir Dir 



Abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Aufgaben
Atmosphäre der offenen Türen und flache Hierarchien
Sicherheit der Leistungen des öffentlichen Dienstes
30 Tage Urlaub plus zusätzliche freie Tage durch Tarifvertrag
Tarifgehalt plus Münchenzulage und Jahressonderzahlung
Arbeitgeberfinanzierte Altersvorsorge
Arbeitgeberfinanziertes Job-Ticket
Homeofficemöglichkeit (2 Tage/Woche) und flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (Gleitzeit bei 39 Wochenstunden)
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement
Corporate Benefits

Freue Dich auf Deine Arbeit in einem engagierten und kollegialen Team an einem Arbeitsplatz im Herzen Münchens am S-Bahnhof Isartor, um zusammen mit unseren 110 Kolleginnen und Kollegen die Mobilität von morgen im Großraum München maßgeblich mitzugestalten.




Interessiert? 


Dann fehlt nur noch eines: Deine Bewerbung!
 Bitte sende uns Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen per Mail an bewerbung@mvv-muenchen.de mit Angabe eines möglichen Eintrittstermins und Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung unter dem Stichwort „Verkehrsforschung“.
 Solltest Du Fragen haben, stehen wir Dir gerne auch telefonisch unter 089 / 210 33 - 181 zur Verfügung.
 Münchner Verkehrs- und Tarifverbund GmbH (MVV) Thierschstraße 2, 80538 München








PDF-Download der Stellenanzeige

You are currently working towards a 2+ years university degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics or a similar discipline.
You are proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g. pivot tables, complex formulas).
You will be able demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
You will be results driven with analytical capability and the ability to innovate and simplify current process and practices.
You are a team player and enjoy working in an international environment.
You have the right to work in the country you are applying for and are available to work full-time for 4 to 6 months.
 Job summary 

Location: Munich, Germany 

Start Date: from January 2023 onwards 

Duration: between 4 to 6 months 

 Amazon is seeking an analytical, motivated and forward-thinking Finance Intern. If you are interested to learn what makes a great Finance team member and enjoy building and working on projects that support our delivery for customers across diverse teams in multiple countries, Amazon is a great place to be. It’s a place where motivated employees thrive, and ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. 

 An Amazon Finance Internship will provide you with an unforgettable experience in a dynamic and international environment and will serve as a superb introduction to finance and data analysis within the operational business. 

 Finance Internships are varied, and you could have the opportunity to join one of the following teams: Finance, Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Finance & Controlling, Operations Finance, Transportation Finance or Infrastructure Finance. 

 This internship is an educational opportunity, where you will apply your analytical skills and bias for action, to complete an impactful project that will support your own learning in the Finance Analyst function, as well as the team’s success (and ultimately our customers). You will assist with gathering data and finding out the exact trend that can be acted upon to reduce cost and/or improve efficiency. You will be involved in reporting, forecasting and building KPI dashboards that will support an entire business unit in their decision-making process. You will gain invaluable first-hand experience in improving accuracy alongside automating tools and processes. You can also expect to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. 

 If this sounds interesting, the application and recruitment process is as follows: 

 The first stage, is a video interview and technical assessment. This assessment can take around 30 minutes to complete. If successful you will move through to the final stage, which is a panel interview consisting of 2 interviews. If necessary you may also have to complete a language test. 



Data visualization skills, such as proficiency in Tableau, QlikView, PowerPivot, or MicroStrategy
Oracle, VBA and MySQL/SQL knowledge
Ability to pay attention to detail, to do in-depth data mining, and to follow a methodical approach to work while also seeking to understand the big picture
Experience in financial planning, financial reporting and/or root cause analysis
Previous work experience such as a summer job, internship; even better if it was in a related field or business
 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. 

 m/w/d

Job_Title: Junior Customer Data Analyst  In Neckarsulm
Description:
Eine gute Idee war der Ursprung, ein erfolgreiches Konzept ist das Ergebnis. Qualität zum guten Preis möglichst vielen Menschen anbieten zu können treibt uns an - mittlerweile weltweit, denn wir sind Lidl. Hier ist das berufliche Zuhause vielfältiger Talente. Ob im Einkauf, in der Logistik, im Warengeschäft oder in der IT; ob als Impulsgeber, Gestalter oder Dienstleister der Länder. Wir suchen Anpacker, Durchstarter, Möglichmacher und bieten spannende Aufgaben und Projekte in einem dynamischen und internationalen Umfeld. Bei Lidl findet jeder seine persönliche Herausforderung. Denn Lidl lohnt sich.

Deine Aufgaben 


Steigerung des Loyalitätslevel unserer Bestandskunden durch das Einbringen innovativer Customer Relationship Maßnahmen
 Erarbeitung von Lösungen für aufkommende Fragestellungen zu den Themen Kundendaten und Kundenverhalten, von der Zielsetzung bis hin zu einer Empfehlung
 Selbstständige Analyse von unternehmenseigene sowie externe Daten bspw. im Hinblick auf Wirtschaftlichkeit oder den Effekt auf die Kundenansprache
 Ansprechpartner für internationale Schnittstellen im Bereich Kundendatenanalysen
 Einbringung deiner Ideen zum weiteren Aufbau des Fachbereichs Customer Analytics und zur Verbesserung der Prozesse und Methoden


Dein Profil 


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Mathematik / Statistik oder (Wirtschafts-) Informatik
 Erste Erfahrung durch Praktika oder Nebenjobs in der Unternehmensberatung, Marktforschung oder im CRM Bereich
 Gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie in mindestens einem der Programme R oder Python
 Erste Erfahrung mit Regressions- oder Zeitreihenanalysen bzw. Wirksamkeitstests (A-/B-, Hypothesentests)
 Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse


Deine Vorteile 

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer überdurchschnittlichen Vergütung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Großunternehmens. Wir erkennen die vielfältigen Bedürfnisse unserer Kolleginnen und Kollegen an und entwickeln Lösungen zur Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Privatleben. Ein persönlicher Pate macht dich vom ersten Tag an mit deinem Job vertraut und ist dein Ansprechpartner für alle Fragen, rund um das Unternehmen. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht – und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für dich entdecken.
 Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Job_Title: Junior Analyst Capital Markets - Etp Trading
Description:
Company Description
  Scalable Capital is a leading digital investment platform in Europe. Since our foundation in 2014, we pursue the mission to empower everyone to become an investor. With the Scalable Broker, our digital wealth management service and our solutions for B2B partners we offer easy and cost efficient investing for everyone. Today, Scalable Capital is a FinTech unicorn - we have more than 500,000 customers and more than 6 billion euros on our platform.  Visit our finance blog or tune in to our podcast (both in German) to find out what our Expert Teams have to say.  Our Company Values guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. To learn more about them, you can find our values here (English).



 Job Description
 

 Conduct with your fellow traders the daily on-exchange order execution of our wealth business, in which you will ensure highest execution quality. Gradually, you will take on more responsibilities and develop ownership of the daily execution and operations. This includes internal pre- and post-trade assessments as well as market monitoring (e.g. FX, yields, spreads, etc.), in order to allow for a quick and informed judgement in the trading process
 Work closely with our Financial Engineering, Quantitative Investment Strategy and Operations teams on development and ad-hoc tasks
 Support the Capital Markets team with ongoing research on flows and trading metrics, as well contribute to enhancing our in-house trading systems with our product and engineering teams
 Gain and strengthen knowledge in the full spectrum of on-exchange ETP trading and building tools to ensure execution quality
 Prepare meetings with ETP issuers and provide supportive research for our internal Investment Management Committee
 The position is initially limited to one year




 Qualifications
 

 Excellent academic background preferably in Finance, Business and Economics with a focus on Capital Markets
 Demonstrable passion for trading and financial markets in general
 Understanding of Exchange Traded Products, in particular ETFs
 Relevant work experience from prior internships or full time positions (e.g. Banking, Asset Management, Trading or Market Making)
 Ability to deliver under pressure, with excellent analytical skills, attention to detail and an autonomous work attitude
 Basic knowledge of Bloomberg and Python or a similar programming language is considered a plus
 Collaborative and supportive team player with effective communication skills
 Excellent command of English, both written and spoken; German is considered a plus

 Additional Information
 

 Be part of one of the fastest-growing and most visible Fintech startups in Europe, creating innovative services that have a substantial impact on the lives of our customers
 Work with an international, diverse, inclusive, and ever-growing team that loves creating the best products for our clients
 Enjoy an office in a great location in the middle of Munich or Prenzlauer Berg, one of the hippest neighbourhoods of Berlin or choose to work remotely (if eligible for the job)
 Be productive with the latest hardware and tools
 Learn and grow by joining our in-house knowledge sharing sessions and spending your individual Education Budget
 Learn and experience German culture first hand by joining our free German language classes
 (International) relocation support
 Enjoy your free time with 30 paid vacation days and take the opportunity to work from abroad
 Benefit from an attractive compensation package and from the company pension scheme
 Say goodbye to order commissions and say hello to your complimentary subscription of Scalable Capital's PRIME Broker

Job Description 

Site Name: Munich - Office
  
Posted Date: Oct 7 2022
   Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
 Aufgaben:
 Responsible for medical strategy of several areas such as pain, respiratory, with development of partnership with key opinion leaders , generation of data, medical representative for internal customers.
 Anforderungen:
 Scientific background (physician pharmacist, dentist or other scientific background).

 At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
 We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
 We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.

 If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

 GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

 Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

 GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

 Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

Job_Title: Business Intelligence Developer / Project Lead (Anteilig Home Office)
Description:
GEMEINSAM DIE DATA WAREHOUSING WELT VERBESSERN ALS
Business Intelligence Developer / Project Lead (anteilig Home Office) (w/m/d) 




Überblick
 Die Europ Assistance Gruppe wurde 1963 gegründet und ist Erfinder des Assistance-Konzepts. Sie bietet in den Bereichen Travel, Mobility, Home & Connected Living, Health und Senior Care innovative Versicherungs- und Serviceprodukte an, um Privat- und Firmenkunden maßgeschneiderte Lösungen in Notfällen und im Alltag zu liefern. Europ Assistance ist ein 100-prozentiges Tochterunternehmen der Generali Group und deckt über 200 Länder mit ihren Services ab.
yes, we care!


Das ist der Job

 Für den weiteren Ausbau des Geschäftsfeldes Business Intelligence sucht die Europ Assistance Deutschland ab sofort einen qualifizierten Mitarbeiter als
 Business Intelligence Developer / Project Lead (m/w/d)
 Wir im Team „Business Intelligence“ sind für die digitale Transformation im Bereich Reporting & Data Analytics bei der Europ Assistance Deutschland (EA) verantwortlich. Unsere Mission ist den Fachbereichen ein hochwertiges Reporting aus allen relevanten Unternehmensdaten zur Verfügung zu stellen. Die wertvollen Insights dienen vorrangig der Unternehmenssteuerung auf allen Ebenen sowie der optimalen Entscheidungsfindung für das oberste Management. BI ist ein wichtiger Garant für unser erfolgreiches Geschäftsmodell. Um das BI Team auszubauen, suchen wir Sie als Team-Player mit großer Leidenschaft für Data Warehousing, Reporting und Visualisierungen. Helfen Sie uns dabei, die EA noch mehr für Business Intelligence zu begeistern und unsere BI Lösungen auf das nächste Level zu heben.
 Ihre Hauptaufgaben sind:

 Entwicklung und Gestaltung von State-of-the-Art Reportings auf Basis von Microsoft Power BI
 Design von optimalen BI Lösungen für den jeweiligen Business Prozess
 Konzeption und Modellierung von Data Warehousing Architekturen sowie stetige Optimierung unserer bestehenden Datenmodelle

BayWa r.e.
 Arabellastraße 4, 81925, Munich, Germany
 Work experience


 Other
 Fulltime







    At BayWa r.e. we r.e.think energy - how it is produced, stored and can be best used to enable the global renewable energy transition that is essential to the future of our planet. Based in 30 countries, BayWa r.e. is a leading global renewable energy developer, service provider, distributor and energy solutions provider. Operating throughout Europe, the Americas and Asia-Pacific, we are strategically investing in emerging markets around the world, actively shaping the future of energy and taking a stand against climate change. Embracing equity and diversity, we are committed to creating inclusive environments where everyone can reach their full potential. Every day, we are working hard to find new solutions, push technological boundaries and redefine service standards to make renewable energy even better.
   
 The Corporate Organisation & Change team is on a journey to provide data-based decision making preliminary work for strategic and tactical decisions for senior management. Through business process and value stream analysis we want to continuously transform and develop business excellence within the organization of BayWa r.e. To strengthen our Corporate Organisation & Change team in 
   Munich, we are currently looking for a 
   Business Process Intelligence Data Manager (f/m/d).
   



What You Will Do


You will analyze complex business processes, value streams and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers
You will identify and interpret trends and patterns in relevant datasets to understand organizational challenges
You will construct forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical to-be processes based on business data and organizational benchmarks
You will combine large and disparate data sources for ad hoc analysis
You will define, develop, enhance and track metrics and dashboard requirements to deliver results and provide insight and recommendation on value streams and processes
You will use advanced data analysis and tools to ensure analytics are valid, meaningful and provide actionable and comprehensive insights
You will support digitizations of core processes and help the team to answer strategic questions, make insightful data-driven decisions and properly design new initiatives
You will provide technical advice, consultation and knowledge to others within the relevant Organisation & Change Team, as well as internal customers
You will create relevant reports and present on process data across various platforms (e.g. Automation and Process Engines like Power Platform and Signavio) and present trends and patterns




What You Bring


Relevant Bachelor's degree and relevant certifications
3 - 5 Years Data Analysis Experience
Experience in programming languages such as SQL, Python/R
Data Integration experience via Azure Data Factory or SSIS
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong Excel skills and Power Platform (e.g. BI)
Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and build sound working relationships
Detail-oriented Ability to work independently
Understandig of current data protection and privacy laws
Development & Configurations of reporting layers using REST API functionalities
Dashboard Creation & Analysis (e.g. Power BI, Signavio Process Intelligence or equivalent)
Very good English skills are required, German is a plus




What We Are Ready To Offer You


Mobile working
Flexible working hours
Modern office atmosphere
Company restaurant / Barista bar
Discounted Conditions Fitness
Discounted Online Shopping
Smartphone, also for private use
JobRad




Is This Role The Right Fit For You?


Do you like to talk about data intelligence, sustainable business management and innovation with the same understanding and emotions you bring up talking about your favorite dish or hobby?
Do you like to gain insight into all areas of the BayWa r.e. and therefore, the renewable energy industry as a generalist on maximum flight level, however, also do the deep dive whenever needed?
Do you, as a bare minimum requirement, only accept working in a people first environment, with a strong new work culture and true team spirit?

Job_Title: Dashboard Developer With Focus On Data Science Solutions
Description:
Job description 

 At Machine Learning Reply Germany we work with our clients on leading-edge data science projects for which we are seeking Dashboard Developer with focus on Data Science solutions with a strong IT background to bring our data to life! 

 Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 10.000 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Data Science area that cover the entire project lifecycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing, modeling and visualizations that embed our use case results into interactive dashboards. 

 You are experienced or have a strong motivation to learn solving problems through data usage & data visualization. You never lose focus, are numbers driven and like to visualize data? Then we want to hear from you! 


Responsibilities:


Building and maintaining dashboard solutions using state-of-the art-Art BI-Tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, ThoughtSpot or open source equivalents) as a member of our Data Science implementation teams
Independent requirements analysis on suitable KPIs and their prioritization according to client needs and tooling options
Extracting data from various data sources of our clients (cloud and on premise) and connecting, importing, and transforming data to optimize their usage
Support business decision making by providing data to business cases, qualitative assessments and workshops together with our data scientists and engineers
Advise our client on how data usage is shaping strategic decisions or how artificial intelligence adoption can increase through the right interactive visualization by business

What we offer you:


Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc . )
Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training between the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture and data science
Benefit from industry leading cooperations in the cloud, BI and AutoML field
Very active social program - including trainings, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices and hackathons
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network
Award winning office space in downtown Munich with access to “Stammstrecke”
You choose your state-of-the-art work equipment
Public transport ticket within Munich
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office and remote work
 (r) 

 Requirements 


Job Requirements / Qualifications:


Previous experience and/or interest in the area of Business/ Artificial Intelligence projects and the creation of interactive dashboards
Previous project experience, either through internships or similar corporate experience, in designing a dashboarding solution
Successfully completed university studies with a strong quantitative background, for example in Business Informatics, Data Science, Informatics, Computer Science or similar
Ability to convincingly communicate and present analytical results to management
Fluent in English and German

Desired:


Strong business understanding to design relevant KPIs
Initial experience and interest in cloud technologies
Experience with Tableau, PowerBI, AutoML Tools
Understanding of underlying data base infrastructure (data models, ETL processes)
Experience in Python and SQL
Interest in (agile) project management
 What are you waiting for? 

 Join our team at Machine Learning Reply as a Dashboard Developer with focus on Data Science solutions in Munich!

Job_Title: (Senior) Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer  Kredite
Description:
Join us to advance our market-leading FinTech product Consumer Loans with a significant impact on the German financial economy further. State-of-the-art machine learning technologies and software engineering frameworks are thereby essential for the features of the product, which fascinate our customers and partners time and again.  You will improve our product autonomously in an agile working environment and play a proactive role in its further development. In close collaboration with our software engineers and product managers and applying newest data science solutions, you will lift our product to the next level and can let your creativity unfold. Does solving concrete ML problems, creating exciting new features and building up digital business models fascinate you? Then become a part of our multicultural and dedicated team!  Give your career a boost as a (Senior) Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) at CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Finanzen GmbH and shape the future of financial services with us.
 Your Responsibilities

You will be an essential part of further developing an established innovative financial product and will automate related business processes with the help of data science methods and models
You will experiment with state-of-the-art algorithms like Gradient Boosting or Random Forests, manage your training experiments with modern ML frameworks like MLFlow and thereby help lifting our product to the next level
You will analyze and preprocess related data pools, make decisions on the correct modelling and validate your models, create new prototypes and integrate them autonomously into the existing product and service platform
You will work in a multifaceted and interdisciplinary team and directly collaborate with IT developers and product managers

Your Qualifications

Enthusiasm for the application of mathematics and machine learning technology in order to make our financial products faster, better and even more convenient to use
Master’s degree or PhD in physics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, business informatics or related fields
Professional experience as a Data Scientist (m/f/d) or Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) of at least 3 years is mandatory
Solid Experience in Python and handling of machine learning and deep learning packages (e.g. scikit-learn, lightgbm, PyTorch, …)
High motivation to work in agile and interdisciplinary teams and to share knowledge inside the CHECK24 data science community
Fluent spoken and written English skills

Your Benefits

Modern working conditions: flexible working time model with a fair rule for remote work (3 days office + 2 days home) and the possibility to work up to one week from abroad
Experience and stability: for more than 15 years we have been collecting successes and also failures and share them with our more than 1,000 CHECKitos
High customer orientation: every department of CHECK24 acts autonomously and works unconditionally customer-oriented. That results in a working culture with small teams and without unnecessary and time-taking coordination – start-up instead of large corporation atmosphere!
We bring you forward: your leaders take care of your personal development in the daily work together with you
We appreciate your commitment: permanent contracts and an attractive salary with a yearly bonus for special achievements. Vouchers for numerous CHECK24 products, a company pension scheme with subsidy as well as special conditions for gyms and public transport in Munich
Foods & Drinks: we offer you one free meal per day (breakfast or lunch), fresh and regional fruits and free drinks – just help yourself!
Checkito-Spirit: we are convinced that only excellent teams are able to develop excellent products. Team events, networking and celebrations like the legendary summer and Christmas parties are therefore an important part of our work





Kontakt 
Leopold Obermaier
 leopold.obermaier@check24.de

Join our R&D Team in Munich

 We offer an exciting and impactful role in a highly professional, cooperative and appreciative international working environment, where you can actively help shaping the success of the company. We offer a flat organization, a competitive salary, flexible working hours including mobile working, a company pension scheme and last but by no means least a highly transparent company culture. As a growing company, we strive to hire, develop and keep our employees long-term.



 Main responsibilities


 Hold the position of a project leader within formulation development projects in collaboration with our international clients in biopharmaceutical technology
 Plan pharmaceutical protein formulation development projects and stability studies and execute them with the lab team, analyze data, execute data integrity checks and write reports
 Prepare and elaborate scientific concepts, coordinate and assign tasks within the scientific development projects as well as continuously develop innovative technologies
 Implement new lab-equipment and processes in close collaboration with the lab team




 Your qualifications


 Professional experience in the fields of protein formulation development and/or related analytics in the industrial environment
 Degree in Life Science M. Sc. or PhD
 Ability to think creatively and to work as a team player with strong communication skills and being passionate about working in biotech industry
 Familiar with working in quality management systems
 Fluent in both English and German




 About us

 Leukocare AG is a fast growing, international biotech company located in Martinsried near Munich and Milford, MA, USA. Based on our technology platform, we develop superior and innovative drug product formulations combining state-of-the-art analytical technologies with innovative bioinformatics approaches. Together with our partners within Pharma, Biotech and the Medical Devices sector we apply our formulation technologies and expertise to stabilize complex pharmaceutical molecules, proteins, vaccines & viral vectors as well as medical devices in a broad range of indications and settings.

Du möchtest die Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten und begeisterst dich für die Mobilität von Morgen? Dann komm in unser Data Analytics Team für die Produktion der Antriebssysteme der Zukunft. Gemeinsam beantworten wir komplexe Fragestellungen aus der täglichen Produktionspraxis von beispielsweise E-Motoren und Hochvolt-Batteriespeichern professionell mittels Daten!
Was erwartet dich?

Du erstellst mit deinen Kolleginnen im agilen Use Case Team datengetriebene Dashboards, Ad Hoc Reports und explorative Analysen


Du arbeitest eng zusammen mit den Betreiberinnen der Antriebsproduktion mit dem Ziel deren Herausforderungen in der Produktion beispielsweise von Batteriespeichern oder E- Motoren zu verstehen mit dem Ziel passende Lösungen zu entwerfen und umzusetzen


Du vertiefst dein Wissen über verschiedene Data Analytics und Business Intelligence Technologien sowie Kl-Algorithmen und lernst, diese gewinnbringend einzusetzen
Du arbeitest mit unserem loT- und Plattform Team zusammen, um Daten anzubinden und unsere Analytics Produkte weiterzuentwickeln

Was bringst du mit?

Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Elektrotechnik, Mathematik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation/ Erfahrung


Analytisches Denken und organisiertes, eigenständiges Arbeiten


Programmierkenntnisse erforderlich


Kenntnisse in Python, Spark, SQL, Business Intelligence Tools (z.B. Power Bl) und Statistik von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse erwünscht, gute Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil


Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: 50,000.00€ - 80,000.00€ per year
Work Location: One location

Wir, als SUSHI Family sind dankbar für unsere bisherige Entwicklung und stolz auf das, was wir erreicht haben. Das ist allerdings kein Grund zukünftig mit weniger Kraft in die Pedale zu treten - ganz im Gegenteil: Diese positive Entwicklung soll kontinuierlich fortgeführt werden und genau hierfür brauchen wir Dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in unserem Business Intelligence Team! In unserer aktuellen Phase gilt es nun, das Unternehmen noch schlauer zu machen und Situationen besser zu verstehen. 

 Aufgaben 



Du entwickelst ETL-Lösungen von der Datenquelle bis zum Data Mart
Du planst Transformationsprozesse auf dem Weg zu unserer Zielarchitektur
Du übernimmst die Entwicklung und Implementierung von neuen Analytics-Lösungen
Du findest durch Anforderungsanalysen sofort Optimierungspotenziale zur Steigerung von Effizienz, Transparenz und Kommunikation im Unternehmen
Du hast ein kreatives Händchen für Visualisierungen, sodass aus Daten neue Insights entstehen
Du verantwortest unsere aktuellen Reportings und kümmerst dich um die Automatisierung bestehender Berichte
 Qualifikation 

 Wenn sich all das spannend für Dich anhört, dann schick uns einfach Deinen Lebenslauf und ein kurzes Anschreiben durch. Erzähl uns auch gerne, warum Du in unser Team passt und wieso wir auf gar keinen Fall auf Dich verzichten sollten. 



Unternehmerisches Denken ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du hast praktische Erfahrung mit SQL und verfügst über Datenbankkenntnisse
Du kennst bereits einige Lösungen für Data Analytics (z.B. Tableau oder Data Studio)
Der SVERWEIS ist deiner Meinung nach etwas für Amateure. Du beherrscht Excel/Google Sheets im Detail.
Dir macht es Spaß, Datenbanksysteme und Dashboards von Grund auf neu zu entwickeln
Du hast Freude daran, das Team mit Kennzahlen zu versorgen und diese auch vorzutragen
Du hast Deutschkenntnisse mindestens in C1 Niveau
 Benefits 



Super steile Lernkurve durch ein starkes Netzwerk an Mentor: innen und Mitarbeiter: innen
Das was Du tust, hat einen Impact in Verbindung mit unserem „Why“

Weitere Benefits
 Wir bei SUSHI BIKES wissen, dass wir nur im Team erfolgreich, kreativ und innovativ sein können. Für unser Team suchen wir also Teamplayer und Personen die Lust haben die Mobilitätsbranche zu revolutionieren. Dabei ist uns wichtig, dass sich alle Personen angesprochen und wertgeschätzt fühlen. Wir glauben an die Entfaltung der Persönlichkeit in jedem Hinblick, daher möchten wir alle dazu ermutigen sich bei uns Willkommen zu fühlen und zu bewerben, unabhängig von der Herkunft, dem Geschlecht, der Identität, der sexuellen Orientierung oder körperlicher Fähigkeiten. 

 Wir freuen uns riesig, wenn du Teil der SUSHI Family werden möchtest : )

Job_Title: Master'S Thesis In The Area Of Predictive Business Process Management
Description:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
 SHARE YOUR PASSION.
 More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly novel solutions. And that’s why our experts will treat you as part of the team from day one, encourage you to bring your own ideas to the table – and give you the opportunity to really show what you can do.


We, the BMW Grou, offer you an interesting and varied master's thesis in the area of predictive business process management.

 Knowing the outcome of a business process in advance and taking corrective actions based upon that is considered a key ability in future digital business management. Recent research shows that the possibilities of Artificial Intelligence could be one of the main enablers for doing so.

 What awaits you?

 Defining and constructing data sets for a machine learning usage in the domain of ECM.
 Feature engineering in preparation of ML application.
 Defining the optimal ML algorithm for different predictions.
 Development of a running prototype in Python.


 Please note that your thesis must be supervised by a university on your part.

 What should you bring along?

 Enrolled in a university degree program in engineering, informatics, production science or a comparable field.
 Good skills in programming languages such as Python and Machine Learning applications, especially LSTM.
 Excellent English, or a good proficiency in German.
 You are a skillful user of Data Analytics Software.
 Practical experience in the field of engineering change management would be beneficial.
 Self-driven and analytical.


 Are you enthused by new technologies and an innovative environment? Apply now!

 Earliest starting date: 11/21/2022
 Duration: 6 months Working hours: full-time

 Contact: BMW Group Recruiting Team
 +49 89 382-17001

Job_Title: It Senior Staff Specialist For Web Content Management Systems (F/M/Div)*
Description:
Do you like to translate customer requirements into IT solutions? Are you passionate about delivering the best experience to Infineon customers? At Infineon, we are looking for an IT Staff Specialist, who strengthens our team and to take our Web Content Management environment to the next level: if you have an eye for the big picture, like to bring in new ideas and want to develop them in a global environment, we are looking forward to your application! 


 In your new role, you will: 
 

Consult and guide our Sales & Marketing and Communication departments regarding the requirements and the design of solutions in the area of Content Management Systems 
Manage projects for proof of concepts and development/configurations of prototypes together with internal and external experts 
Support configuration and design of solutions for Content Management Systems around the entire customer journeys in the area of digital demand generation 
Ensure operations of Infineon’s Content Management Solution and Web Ecosystem in close cooperation with internal and external suppliers 
Present and discuss results on different management levels within IT and with our internal customers , e.g. Sales & Marketing, Communications or Human Resources




 As a true team player, you cooperate across boundaries, appreciate the contributions of other team members and respect their different attitudes and points of views. At the same time, you have a clear notion of how innovative IT solutions contribute to the commercial success of the company. In order to reach best results, you establish lasting relationships with your customers and listen actively to their thoughts and ideas. Furthermore, you know how to balance those requirements with technical or legal possibilities – and you are able to show them the added value of our available solutions. 
 
 You are best equipped for those tasks if you have:
 



A degree in Informatics , Computer Science or Data Science , experience in Sales & Marketing environment would be a plus 
At least 3 years of experience related to Enterprise Level Web Content Management Solutions, especially Adobe Experience Cloud and Adobe Experience Manager Sites including Content Delivery Networks (CDN) and Website Infrastructure Architectures 
Technical experience with HTML/CSS, REST API and Web Protocols (e.g. DNS, Network Security), Enterprise Level Network Topologies (e.g. Web Application Firewalls, Load Balancing, Web Application Server) and Network Infrastructures 
Know-How in Online Marketing, Web Analytics and preferred in the area of B2B lead generation , additional experience in B2C would be a plus 
Preferable experience with Analytics and Data Integration Solutions like Google Analytics , Adobe Analytics , and business intelligence solutions as well as with Microsoft Dynamics , Hotjar 
Excellent communication and analytical skills as well as strong interpersonal skills to interact with cross-functional global teams 
Fluent English language skills, basic German language skills would be a plus




In our headquarters in Neubiberg near Munich, more than 6000 employees are working in research & development, several central functions, IT and many more.



Part of your life. Part of tomorrow. 

 Infineon is a world leader in semiconductor solutions that make life easier, safer, and greener. Our solutions for efficient energy management, smart mobility, and secure, seamless communications link the real and the digital world. 
 
 The 
 Information Technology department has become an important business advisor for Infineon, converting business requirements into great IT solutions. It is responsible for provisioning hardware and software solutions at benchmark costs for all areas within Infineon reaching from office users to research & development, to frontend and backend production around the globe. More than 1.200 IT-colleagues work closely together with other business areas and external partners. They increase the efficiency of business processes offering more than just modern equipment, secure infrastructure and newest communication solutions. 
 

* 
The term gender in the sense of the General Equal Treatment Act (GETA) or other national legislation refers to the biological assignment to a gender group. At Infineon we are proud to embrace (gender) diversity, including female, male and diverse.

Profil

Sie verfügen über hohe analytische Fähigkeiten 



Sie arbeiten organisiert, eigeninitiativ und ergebnisorientiert 



Sie gehen sicher mit MS Office - insbesondere Excel - um 



Sie sind ein Teamplayer und haben Spaß am gemeinsamen Erfolg 



 Interesse?
 Passion for Retail! Wir bieten ein hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung sowie ein tolles Arbeitsumfeld mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und individuellen Aufstiegschancen. The Attribute Sciences group within the Pre-Pivotal Process Development organization supports advancement of Amgen’s pipeline of drug candidates by identifying, characterizing, monitoring, and controlling quality attributes that may affect efficacy and/or safety of biological therapeutics. This position will work in a dynamic team environment to progress early-stage biopharmaceuticals from discovery through clinical trials, primarily focusing on Mass Spectrometry techniques - both hands-on in the laboratory and serving as subject matter expert in internal and external collaborations. Moreover, there is the opportunity to support analytical project management activities in the role as Attribute Sciences Team Leader. Cross-functional interaction with US sites (west and east coast) are required on a regular basis to align and coordinate projects.
 
Tasks and responsibilities:
 

Mass spectrometry-based characterization of drug candidate molecules to support the determination of protein primary structure for drug substance and drug product, as well as characterizing candidates with respect to attributes and their susceptibility to modification during process and product development activities.
Supporting clone selection through sequence variant analysis to identify and quantify amino acid mutations and misincorporations. 
Developing and optimizing sample preparation protocols and MS-based technologies to reduce time and material requirements during all phases of candidate selection with emphasis on primary structure and post-translational modifications.
Serving as a subject matter expert in mass spectrometry and act a key contact person for functional counterparts.
Generating clear and concise technical documents and technical presentations. 
Authoring and review of program related documentation including Product Quality Attribute Assessment (PQAA), Quality Target Product Profile (QTPP), DS/DP specifications, Justification of Specification, Certificate of Analysis (CoA), and DS/DP stability reports. 
Development, qualification and transfer of product specific release, stability, and characterization assays. 
Strong team player both with the local Munich group and when interacting with colleagues at the US Headquarter in Thousand Oaks


 Requirements:
 

Doctorate degree, Master’s degree and 4 years of scientific experience, or Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of scientific experience in the field of Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or equivalent 
3+ years of scientific experience within the biotech industry, experience to include statistical data analyses, method transfers and comparability studies 
Expertise in mass spectrometry is essential and strong analytical background is required 
Hands-on experience with diverse LC-MS systems and corresponding data acquisition software 
Demonstrated ability to work independently when determining and developing scientific analysis and solutions.
Experience in analytical project management is desired. 
Professional and technical competence, awareness of quality and ability to deliver to established timelines is essential 
You are a highly motivated strong team worker with excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Strong written and verbal communication skills in German and English is a requirement.

 Join Us
 If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.
 Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.
 As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

 More than 4,000 highly motivated employees in more than 50 countries turn the Hoffmann Group through their performance into what it is today: Europe's leading partner for quality tools, factory equipment and personal protective equipment and "Germany's Best Employer 2021" with a very high attractiveness (awarded by DIE WELT). Our healthy growth is reflected in our global annual sales of more than 1.3 billion euros in 2021. As a family-owned company, we offer a working environment characterized by mutual trust, where performance and commitment are rewarded. We encourage personal initiative, creativity and independent, results-oriented action.  To strengthen our team at Hoffmann SE in Munich, we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) to start as soon as possible (m/w/d).



 Ihre Verantwortung


Designing and further ML-Ops architecture in Azure platform

Die Grundlage unseres agilen (Zusammen-)Arbeitsmodell bildet das Agile Working Model (AWM), welches u.a. auf einem modifizierten Less-Framework-Ansatz basiert. Hierbei entwickeln unsere Feature Teams in der IT – zusammen mit unseren Partnern im Fachbereich – iterativ maßgeschneiderte Softwarelösungen, die in definierten Zyklen über alle Produkte hinweg in der Organisation synchronisiert werden (Stichwort „Skalierung“).
Jedes Produkt Team verantwortet dabei im Sinne DevOps eine bis mehrere Applikationen – und dies über den gesamten Lebenszyklus. Die DevOps-Tätigkeiten sind dabei sowohl an externe Partner vergeben wie auch an eigenen Hubs in Portugal und/oder Südafrika (englischsprachig).
Unsere Toollandschaft zur Unterstützung einer agilen und iterativen Arbeitsweise basiert auf der Toolsuite von Atlassian und fokussiert hier insbesondere auf Confluence und Jira/Xray.
Die Rolle Agile Master „trainiert“ in der Regel zwei bis x Feature Teams und stellt hierbei u.a. ein effizientes Zusammenarbeitsmodell – inkl. Einhaltung der IT-Prozesse und Compliancevorgaben - sicher und entwickelt dieses kontinuierlich und zielorientiert weiter.
Die Anforderungen an einen Agile Master sind: 

SCRUM Zertifizierung und/oder weitere agile Frameworks und Skalierungsmodelle (Less / SaFE)


(mehrjährige) Erfahrung in der Rolle Scrum Master


Eigene Hands-On Erfahrung in SW-Entwicklungsprojekten. Z.B. als Business Analyst, Testmanagement oder SW-Entwickler.
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung (ca. 6)


Studiumabschluß in einem technischen Beruf oder mit starker Nähe dazu.
Idealerweise Erfahrungen in einer technischen Branche (idealerweise Automotive)


Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Atlassian Toolsuite (insbesondere Confluence / Jira / Xray)


Hohe Lernbereitschaft bzgl. dem unternehmensinternen agilen Zusammenarbeitsmodell und sich daraus ergebende abgeleitete Anforderungen in Richtung Compliance / Vertrag mit externen Providern


Verhandlungssichere DE-Sprachkenntnisse


Englisch B2 oder mehr für die Kommunikation mit unseren Hubs

  We’re combining the power of genetic and genomic insights into what causes disease, with the speed and scale of artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) to make better predictions about who a treatment might work for, and why. Die Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft betreibt in Deutschland derzeit 76 Institute und Forschungseinrichtungen und ist die weltweit führende Organisation für anwendungsorientierte Forschung. Rund 30 000 Mitarbeitende erarbeiten das jährliche Forschungsvolumen von 2,9 Milliarden Euro.







Safe Intelligence – das ist der Markenkern des Fraunhofer-Instituts für Kognitive Systeme IKS. Vernetzte Kognitive Systeme sind der Innovationstreiber in vielen Anwendungsbereichen, etwa beim autonomen Fahren, bei Medizingeräten oder der intelligenten Automatisierung in der Industrie. Sie sollen dabei stets das Potenzial der Künstlichen Intelligenz voll ausschöpfen und müssen gleichzeitig nachweislich sicher und zuverlässig sein. Daher forscht das Fraunhofer IKS an Künstlicher Intelligenz und Software Engineering. Wir denken Resilienz und Intelligenz zusammen.


Was Sie bei uns tun

Für die Erschließung neuer Kundenkreise, z.B. in den Anwendungsdomänen Mobility, Industrie 4.0 und Medizintechnik, sucht das Fraunhofer IKS Menschen mit Praxiserfahrung in den Bereichen Geschäftsfeldentwicklung. Innovationsmanagement und Technologietransfer. Wenn Sie Spaß am Dialog mit Kunden, der Identifikation spezifischer Bedarfe und der Konzeption passgenauer Lösungsansätze dafür haben und eine Affinität für neue Technologien mitbringen, sind Sie bei uns genau richtig.


Als (Junior) Manager*in Business Development

generieren Sie Leads und verfolgen Geschäftschancen von der Themenfindung, über die Angebotserstellung bis zur konkreten Projektetablierung in Kooperation mit den wissenschaftlichen Mitarbeitenden
identifizieren Sie gemeinsam mit Industriepartner*innen deren spezifischen Herausforderungen, diskutieren sie mögliche Lösungsansätze und überführen diese gemeinsam mit unseren Fachexpert*innen in Forschungsprojekte
entwickeln Sie niedrigschwellige Angebote, um Innovationspotentiale für den Einstieg in KI-Technologien für weitere Kundenkreise, auch im KMU-Umfeld, zu erschließen und zu unterstützen
gestalten Sie aktiv Forschungsprojekte, gemeinsam mit unseren Fachexpert*innen
tragen Sie zur Entwicklung neuer Geschäfts- und Kooperationsmodelle bei
identifizieren Sie Trends und Themenkomplexe der Industrie und spiegeln diese zurück in die wissenschaftliche Forschung sowie die Kommunikations- und Marketingabteilung
zeichnen Sie sich durch eine ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung aus und pflegen die Kontakte auf professionelle Art und Weise
repräsentieren Sie das Institut bei Messen und Veranstaltungen.



 
Was Sie mitbringen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich der MINT-Fächer oder auch in Wirtschafts- oder Sozialwissenschaften und verfügen über Erfahrungen im Technologietransfer.
Sie bringen das technische Grundverständnis mit, um auf Entscheidungs-, aber auch auf Fachebene der Kund*innen gemeinsame Themen zu identifizieren und diese mit den wissenschaftlichen Abteilungen des Fraunhofer IKS abzustimmen.
Sie besitzen idealerweise Branchenkenntnisse im Bereich Healthcare / Medizintechnik oder Industrie 4.0 und sind vertraut mit der Zielgruppen- / Stakeholderanalyse in diesen Bereichen
Sie haben Freude an der kollaborativen Erarbeitung neuer Lösungswege und sind in der Lage strategisch zu denken, ohne dabei umsetzungsrelevante Details aus dem Auge zu verlieren.
Sie vernetzen sich innerhalb und außerhalb der Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft. Mit Ihrer Kommunikationsstärke und Ihrem aufgeschlossenen Auftreten überzeugen Sie Kund*innen und Partner*innen. Sie arbeiten sich schnell in neue technische Zusammenhänge ein und sind in der Lage, komplexe Sachverhalte adressatengerecht aufzubereiten und zu vertreten.



 
Was Sie erwarten können


Die Möglichkeit in spannenden Projekten im Bereich „Künstliche Intelligenz“, Safety Engineering und Quantencomputing mitzuarbeiten
Gestaltungsraum für die Konzeption und Umsetzung von (neuen) Geschäftsmodell- und Transferformaten
Mitarbeit in einem abwechslungsreichen, internationalen und interdisziplinären Arbeitsumfeld mit agiler Arbeitsweise
Darüber hinaus bestehen vielfältige Unterstützungsangebote zur Vereinbarkeit von privatem und beruflichem Leben (Tariflicher Urlaubsanspruch von 30 Tagen, Gleitzeit, Arbeitszeitausgleich, Heimarbeit, Anbindung zur Krippe, Ferienbetreuung für Kinder, etc.).



 
Wir wertschätzen und fördern die Vielfalt der Kompetenzen unserer Mitarbeitenden und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.
Die wöchentliche Arbeitszeit beträgt 39 Stunden. Die Stelle kann auch in Teilzeit besetzt werden. Die Stelle ist zunächst auf zwei Jahre befristet. Anstellung, Vergütung und Sozialleistungen richten sich nach dem Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst (TVöD).
Mit ihrer Fokussierung auf zukunftsrelevante Schlüsseltechnologien sowie auf die Verwertung der Ergebnisse in Wirtschaft und Industrie spielt die Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft eine zentrale Rolle im Innovationsprozess. Als Wegweiser und Impulsgeber für innovative Entwicklungen und wissenschaftliche Exzellenz wirkt sie mit an der Gestaltung unserer Gesellschaft und unserer Zukunft.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt online mit Ihren aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen!

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet
Who we are
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.
We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.
Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.
The Role
Institutional Partnerships works with research institutions, libraries, consortia and funders to improve the ways researchers are supported when publishing open access.
We are recruiting a Reporting Analyst within our Institutional Partnerships team to report into the Head of Institutional Partnerships. You will play a crucial role in expanding Frontiers’ Institutional Partnerships Program by driving critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports.
Key Responsibilities:

Manage the delivery and maintenance of all relevant reports on internal data


Provide or support provision of necessary internal bespoke data needed for strategic AA-AAA customer proposals as well as drafting bespoke yearly consortium reports based on internal data including financials
Provide guidance to our Institutional Partnerships teams on what internal data reports can be found where and training on relevant systems to download and deal with them (such as Tableau)
Ensure validity of all internal data reports and internal data
Work with our Institutional Partnerships Development unit and PubDev to develop method for assessing impact of PubDev campaigns targeting researchers leveraging institutional partnerships (with the goal of maximising the impact of our Institutional Partnerships program on the overall business) and create reports on the campaign impact


Work with our Institutional Partnerships Development on developing methods for tracking impact of partnerships on number of articles (submissions, acceptances, publications, rejections) and financial aspects such as Fee Support, discounts and average APC

Key Requirements:

Solid experience in developing, managing and running data gathering and analytical projects and analyses


Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
Data management, data visualisation and report writing skills, extensive experience working with Microsoft Excel to create pivot tables, graphs and charts required.
Experience of Tableau and Salesforce are a plus


(Min.) Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required

Benefits 
With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.
Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.
This includes:
100% remote working
Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).
Learning and development
All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.
Wellbeing
We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.
Volunteering opportunities
Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.
Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.
Job Type: Full-time

Job_Title: Master Thesis: Software Testing For Ai In Autonomous Driving
Description:
The Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft (www.fraunhofer.com) currently operates 76 institutes and research institutions throughout Germany and is the world’s leading applied research organization. Around 30 000 employees work with an annual research budget of 2.9 billion euros.







Safe Intelligence — this forms the core brand of the Fraunhofer Institute for Cognitive Systems IKS. Connected cognitive systems drive innovation in many sectors, for example in autonomous vehicles, medical devices or intelligent automation within industry. They should always take full advantage of the potential offered by artificial intelligence, while remaining demonstrably safe and reliable at the same time. This is why Fraunhofer IKS researches both artificial intelligence and software engineering — we consider resilience and intelligence as part of the same process.


What you will do

In this Master Thesis, the student is expected to develop optimization-based testing techniques for autonomous driving vehicles, and validate his/her designed technique using open source autonomous driving SW stack (e.g. Baidu Apollo or Autoware.auto) and simulator (e.g. LGSVL or Carla).


What you bring to the table


Highly willing to learn new things
Basic knowledge in one of the following subfields: software testing, optimization, formal methods
Analytical thinking and comfortable with mathematics
Programming skills (mainly in Python)
Prior experience in autonomous driving SW stack and simulator is considered as a plus


 Especially suitable for students with the field of study in computer science.


What you can expect


Participation in a dynamic team with innovative task areas
Practical approach to your studies
The duration of employment and working time is set by arrangement



 
We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, sexual orientation and identity. Remuneration according to the general works agreement for employing assistant staff.
