  Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.

 Tasks:

 Establish processes that enable DACH organization to use data to create incremental value
 Oversee data collection, review, cleansing, quality check, and integration into enterprise data ecosystem while improving and automating current processes
 Improve data integration and accessibility through deploying data architecture best practices and technologies, reflecting also Global and Regional needs
 Develop governance principles and framework for DACH commercial data, including but not limited to 3rd party data from syndicated data vendors (e.g., Nielsen, IQVIA)
 Engage with internal and external data owners and experts on data requirements to deliver analytics solutions tailored to DACH business unit needs
 Technical support for Demand forecasting along the Core Commercial Cycle
 Streamline reports and BI dashboards generated in the DACH business unit
 Integrate forecast, analytics, primary research, and other non-structured data into a local information database
 Maintenance of data infrastructure and data-related processes • Hands-on data management support across the organization


 Requirements:

 Bachelors' degree in Computer Sciences, Mathematics, or Social Sciences with quantitative focus preferred
 Applicable experience in data management, business intelligence, and data visualization, ideally within a major FMCG player
 Experience with migrating from legacy processes and apps to solutions utilizing modern data processing technologies
 Experience with leading and implementing large scale initiatives in enterprise analytics
 Knowledge of programming language (VBA, Python) and visualization software (Power BI, Tableau etc.)
 Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into first class data solutions • Track record of working with IT partners and vendors at operational and strategic level


 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.  We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. Job_Title: Pharmaceutical Scientist - Project Manager Gmp, Bioanalytics
Description:
About us
Coriolis Pharma
, is a globally operating service provider and one of the world leaders in formulation research and development of (bio)pharmaceutical drugs and vaccines.

We revolutionize the development process of biopharmaceutical drugs by integrating innovative digital formulation approaches from drug development to commercial products.

As a people and team-oriented company with an interdisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and an expert scientific advisory board, we provide cutting-edge services and tailor-made solutions for our clients.

Our company culture is based on diversity, teamwork and open and appreciative communication. That's why wonderful people from over 25 nations around the world work together successfully at Coriolis.

 

What motivates us? 
Our motivation is to enable the development of innovative drugs by performing outstanding biopharmaceutical research to improve the quality of life for humankind.

Project Manager (f/m/d) - GMP (bio)analytics
Permanent employee, Full-time · Martinsried (BY) 
 YOUR RESPONSIBILITY

Take over the responsibility to lead and manage analytical projects with focus on a GMP-compliant characterization of biopharmaceuticals and vaccines for clients
Coordinate qualification and validation projects (analytical method or laboratory equipment) including the compilation of validation plans, protocols and reports
Execute analytical as well as general laboratory work as part of a project team lead by himself or in a accordance to provisions by other Project Leaders
Take over the lead in the communication with the client (first point of contact) and internally with other project team members and involved Units at Coriolis
Ensure that relevant resources are embedded into the project and that project-related decisions are based on state-of-the-art scientific principles
Perform project planning, coordination, execution (supported by project team members for laboratory work) and resource management
Ensure timely delivery of projects within budget, scope and desired quality
Ensure that project deliverables, i.e. experimental plans, experimental data, data presentations and reports are prepared timely and according to the required quality standards
Take over the responsibility for interpretation of data and the drawing of final conclusions; compile data presentations and reports
Act in the role as a GMP analytical expert (individually with a different focus based on your experience) and provide support to Scientists and Junior Scientists

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED 

University degree in pharmacy, (bio)chemistry, biology, or related field, PhD beneficial
A mininum of 4-5 years of relevant working experience
Proven experience in GMP field
Subject matter expert in protein analytical methods (HPLC, MFI, LO, UV, DLS)
Proven ability in leading drug product development programs
Team player with strong motivation and inter-personal skills
Open for new ideas and tasks, can-do attitude, and hands on mentality
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and German

WHY TO JOIN CORIOLIS?
 As a Project Manager (f/m/d), you will join a highly motivated, interdisciplinary team performing contract research and development for clients from the (bio)pharmaceutical industry worldwide. We offer you diversified and challenging areas of responsibilities in our innovative company. We actively support your personal development (project management, technical, scientific and personal skills) tailored to your individual development plan. Beyond that Coriolis offers a variety of benefits and team activities to its employees.  Coriolis Pharma is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, citizenship or gender identity, color, disability, religion/belief, romantic orientation, marital status, age or individual preferences. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar.  Due to the current events concerning the COVID-19 pandemic, Coriolis Pharma has implemented different measures to ensure the physical and mental health and safety of our employees (for example: air filter in offices, free masks and disinfectants, in-house antigen testing, flexible use of mobile working).  Thank you for your interest! We look forward to receiving your application documents. Please use our career portal exclusively for this purpose. We would like to support you from the very beginning to shape your development possibilities here at Coriolis.  Please, visit our website www.coriolis-pharma.com or contact us directly for further information.  We are looking forward to your application! 
People Organization and Culture Unit 
Dominik Schwemmer Talent Acquisition Manager People, Organization & Culture Unit  Coriolis Pharma Research GmbH Phone: +49 (0) 89 - 417760 - 0 Fraunhoferstraße 18 b, 82152 Martinsried www.coriolis-pharma.com

IT Consultant - LIMS (m/f/d)
Permanent employee, Full-time · Martinsried (BY) 
PURPOSE OF YOUR JOB
Our IT Unit is looking for a new colleague, who wants to be part of our team in Martinsried close to Munich. The modern IT Department of Coriolis is working closely with all business and science departments - new responsiblites are coming up constantly in our growing organization. Right now we are looking for someone who can help in the interdsiziplinary work with our Operations & Lab Unit to drive the development of a digital LIMS system (Laboratory Information and Management System) while staying compliant with GxP regulations. 
Are you passionate about IT and Laboratory Systems? 
Come be part of our growing & highly motivated team - apply now! 
 YOUR RESPONSIBILITY
 As IT Consultant LIMS you are playing an important role throughout our company, especially in the implementation and further development of laboratory information and management systems. Part of your tasks will be: 

Collaborate with internal customers to develop and translate their business processes into requirements and specifications
Facilitate the collaboration in LIMS implementation and further development projects
Performing various activities within application life cycle management
Planning and execution of validation activities
Preparation of training courses including the creation of corresponding documentation
Troubleshooting, deviation management and implementation of change actions in the GxP environment
Consult Business Partners regarding technological advancements, technical feasibility and business impact in the field of R&D Applications, especially Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS)
Collect, analyse and document LIMS related business requirements and user stories
Translate requirements into functional capabilities and processes in line with the company’s overall enterprise architecture and system landscape
Support Program / Project / Test / Release Managers to ensure that the developed solution and configuration fulfil the identified requirements
Manage the backlog through identification and collection of new requirements and recommending improvement options for processes and capabilities

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED 

Completed studies in computer science or comparable
Sound knowledge and proven experience in IT consulting and project management
Good understanding of e.g. operating systems, software architecture, databases, software development and system infrastructure
Ideally knowledge in the field of Data Science (LIMS) / Scientific Advice and Artificial Intelligence
Strong analytical skills
Excellent and appreciative communication skills
Very good German and English skills
Ability to work in a team
Strong ability to prioritize and reorganize the workload in a highly complex and agile project environment
Know-how in quality processes and laboratory automation would also be advantageous.

INVEST IN YOURSELF

Ownership: All team members are empowered to bring ideas, make decisions and have impact. Participate in our equity program and share in our success.
Transparency: Everyone at Coriolis is regularly updated on strategic progress, KPI tracking, product updates and changes.
Growth: Not only will you grow in your role, you also have access to our people development budget.
Flexibility: Work on your terms, by leveraging our hybrid-office arrangement. No minimums or maximums.

WHY TO JOIN CORIOLIS?

Let’s formulate innovation together…

Our success & development is created by the people working together @Coriolis. We put People first! That’s why we have a growth mindset, and value personality, collaboration and community to create an empowering and inspiring working space with focus on quality and costumers.

 

We would like to grow together with you!

Let’s continue building and creating the future now and join our Team of currently around 150 employees. In a highly motivated and interdisciplinary team, we provide you with a great chance to increase your experience. We offer an attractive work space at the Martinsried site. Let’s make a difference together!

 

Coriolis Pharma is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, gender, citizenship or gender identity, color, disability, religion/belief, marital status, age or individual preferencies. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar.

 

Due to the current events concerning COVID-19, Coriolis Pharma has implemented different measures to ensure the phyical and mental health and safety of our employees (Air filter in offices, free masks and disinfectants, flexible use of moblie working).

Die Alphabet Fuhrparkmanagement GmbH ist ein Unternehmen der BMW Group und zählt als Anbieter von Business Mobility Lösungen zu Deutschlands Top 5 Anbietern von Full-Service-Leasing und Flottenmanagement für Fahrzeuge aller Automobilmarken. Innovation und Kundenorientierung machen uns erfolgreich.

 Übernehmen Sie mit uns die Verantwortung für die Mobilität von Morgen und werden Sie Teil der BMW Group.


Sie arbeiten in der Abteilung „Strategie, Entwicklung und Planung“ direkt mit einem internationalen Transformationsprojekt und den Fachbereichen der Alphabet Fuhrparkmanagement GmbH zusammen. Sie unterstützten aktiv bei der Steuerung und Umsetzung des agilen internationalen Projektes OASIS und der damit verbundenen Transformation der Alphabet im Bereich Finanzen und Risiko. Dabei ist die Einführung einer einheitlichen Strategie und einer internationalen IT-Lösung das Ziel.
 Die zeitlich befristete Projektstelle hat das Ziel innerhalb von 1,5 Jahren den OASIS Rollout insbesondere in den Bereichen Finanzen und Risiko aktiv zu unterstützen und sicherzustellen. Dies umfasst u.a. den Rollout der neuen SAP S4/HANA Software im Rechnungswesen sowie die Einführung einer neuen Pricing Logik und Prozessabläufe in weiteren Finanz- und Risiko-Abteilungen der Alphabet Deutschland.

 Was erwartet Sie?

 Gemeinsam mit dem Projektteam verantworten und koordinieren Sie in Ihrer Funktion als OASIS Success Manager (w/m/x) die Anforderungen des deutschen Marktes und betreuen die fachliche Lösungsfindung. 
Sie unterstützen die OASIS AL DE Projektleitung in der Planung und Definition von Teilprojektzielvorgaben, der Strukturierung von Teilprojektvorgehen und unterstützen im Monitoring zur Erreichung von Teilprojektzielvorgaben. Sie unterstützen in der Betreuung der Freigabeprozesse und übernehmen situativ auch die Vertretung in entsprechenden Gremien und Steuerungskreisen. 
Sie übernehmen für Teilprojekte im Rahmen des Rollouts die fachliche Projektleitung, konzipieren Lösungsalternativen, bereiten Entscheidungsvorlagen für die Geschäftsführung vor und begleiten die Entwicklung und Implementierung der im Projekt entwickelten Lösungen für den deutschen Markt end-to-end und stellen die Integration des Projekts in die Linienfunktionen sicher. 
Sie analysieren, benchmarken und optimieren komplexe Geschäftsprozesse, identifizieren Veränderungsbedarfe für die Organisation, stimmen diese mit national und international relevanten Stakeholdern ab und treiben so die Transformation im deutschen Markt proaktiv voran. 
Im Rahmen Ihrer Arbeit führen sie Analysen aus, arbeiten aussichtsreiche Ideen aus und schlagen Verbesserungen für die Alphabet und ihre Geschäftsbereiche vor.


 Was bringen Sie mit?

 Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Wirtschaftsmathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung zum Bankkaufmann (w/m/x) oder Industriekaufmann (w/m/x).

Company Description
  PSI is a leading Contract Research Organization with more than 25 years in the industry, offering a perfect balance between stability and innovation to both clients and employees. We focus on delivering quality and on-time services across a variety of therapeutic indications.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Associate Director Risk-Based and Centralized Monitoring, the Clinical Data Scientist is an integral part of our team here at PSI. You will work with clinical trials patient and operational data, develop new data solutions and set up Risk-based Monitoring systems in Process Improvement department.
 Project/ program assignments

 Participate in selection of the Risk-Based Monitoring (RBM) system and provide relevant training to the project team and/or Sponsor
 Set up and maintain RBM systems in collaboration with Central Monitoring Manager
 Establish data extract, load and transformation process for a study. Manage large complex datasets (including unstructured data) coming from multiple data sources. Map, mine and classify raw data and pull processed data into PSI data platform
 Program and produce data listings, tables and figures for Clinical Data Reviewers and Central Monitoring Managers
 Calculate Key Risk Indicators and Quality Tolerance Limits. Apply advanced analytical technics to identify data trends and patterns for Centralized Monitoring
 Collaborate with Central Monitoring Manger and cross-functionally to identify study challenges, develop an action plan and data solutions to address those using advanced analytics technics. Provide outputs actionable for project team
 Communicate and explain data findings and solutions to cross-functional stakeholders

 Corporate/ departmental assignments

 Participate in development and programming of databases and software products for Centralized Monitoring
 Participate in development of processes, Quality System Documents (QSDs) and internal instructions for Centralized Monitoring




 Qualifications
 

 A degree in a Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent or Data Science related work experience and professional qualifications
 At least 3-year experience or equivalent in Data Management, Biostatistics, and Centralized Monitoring
 At least 2-year experience with one or more of the following: R, Shiny, Python, Jupyter, SAS, SQL, Spark and associated packages and libraries (advanced knowledge of R-packages, RStudio, SAS and Excel is an advantage)
 At least 2-year experience in data management area including one or more of the following: relationship databases, data warehousing, data schemas, data stores, data modeling, testing, validation and analysis
 Knowledge of ELT/ETL process is a plus
 Experience with databases engineering and development is a plus
 Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques for analyzing data is a plus
 Experience with using Machine Learning technics is a plus
 Experience with Shiny development is a plus
 Experience with products testing and validation is a plus
 Strong analytical and logical thinking, focus on results
 Communication and collaboration skills
 Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team
 English skills (Advanced)

 Additional Information
  If you feel it is time to make your skills and knowledge visible within a growing company with true focus on its people, then PSI is the right choice for you. We have a generous benefits package here at PSI as we understand the importance of giving back to our employees. Our benefits are focused on providing you with the support to excel both at work, and in your personal life!

Job_Title: Project Manager - Business Development For Industrial Chp Plants - Uk Market
Description:
E.ON Energy Projects GmbH | Permanent | Part or Full time

 E.ON is one of the strongest operators of European energy networks and energy-related infrastructure, as well as a provider of advanced customer solutions for more than 50 million customers. With a total of over 75,000 employees we are represented in 15 countries. By focusing on two sustainable growth areas and with the acquisition of innogy, we are ideally positioned to drive the energy transition in Germany and Europe.

 E.ON Energy Projects GmbH (EEP) develops, finances, operates and optimizes decentralized power plants for industrial customers. Since beginning of 2000, E.ON Energy Projects GmbH installed more than 1 gigawatt (electrical) of projects implemented across Europe.  At E.ON diversity matters. We welcome all people and are convinced that differences make us stronger. Become part of our inclusive and diverse company culture! To create equal opportunities for everyone we offer our positions in full or part-time.

 Seize the chance to be part of E.ON Energy Projects GmbH in Munich and not only create prospects for E.ON's future but also for your own.

 We can't wait to meet you, because none of us is as strong as all of us.

 Your Responsibilities:

 First of all: strive & master de-carbonization of energy intensive industry!
 Identify opportunities and approach new, or existing, industrial customers (w. or w/o the support of regional sales teams)
 Preparing first conceptual offers for medium/large scale energy solution; especially “hands on” preparation of technical, regulatory and commercial analysis 
Prepare and held offer presentations to Customers (and internal E.ON stakeholders)
 Project lead for multi-disciplinary international teams; being accountable for all project management related tasks from the initial phases of the project development until signature of all projects related contracts (closing)
 Cooperate with internal and external stakeholders, competence centers and teams within different business units/entities of E.ON Group
 Coordination of internal and external efforts to present the project to E.ON investment committees (investments gates)
 Budget responsibility for the entire project development
 Support the development and implementation of appropriate market entry strategy in close coordination with E.ON corporate functions

 
Your Profile: 

Degree in engineering, energy economics, economics with a strong technical background; MBA is beneficial
 At least 5 years of experience in project development within energy generation; focus on industrial energy generation is a plus
 Having consolidated experience/network within the UK market (energy intensive industry, suppliers, regulatory bodies etc).
 Understanding energy system conceptual design, including regulatory and energy economic aspects; knowledge of thermodynamic modelling knowledge of thermodynamic modelling or energy optimizer software is desirable
 Having an outstanding overview of the main regulatory and energy economics trends in Europe
 Excellent project management capabilities combined with strong communication and interpersonal skills to establish effective relationship with customers and stakeholders as well as emotional intelligence
 Entrepreneurial mindset: ability to work independently, willingness to take initiative and high level of commitment 
Enjoy working in an international environment
 Experience on PV, WIND based PPAs is preferred 
Written and spoken English fluency is essential; knowledge of other languages is an asset (especially German, Spanish or Italian)
 Flexibility and mobility: being available for short business trips in Europe to meet customers and other stakeholders


 Our Offer:
 Apart of our inspiring and dynamic inernational working atmosphere we have the following attractive employee benefits to keep you motivated and healthy: 

flexible working hours on the basis of a 38 hours week 
regular trainings 
private car and bike leasing 
job ticket available 
family service support 
subsidized canteen 
corporate benefits 
health offers (e.g. subsidized fitness offers, flu protection, skin cancer screening) 
E.ON Aktiv (subsidized vacation and health offers) 
E.ON Pension Plan


 Additionally we offer… 

the opportunity to shape the new energy world 
the chance to shape E.ON’s future 
exciting business challenges to be solved 
a space to develop ideas and create personal impact 
an agile and hands-on environment


 Do you have questions?  For further information please contact Kyra Temma, kyra.temma@eon.com.
 What you need to know: Contract type: Permanent: Working time: Part or Full time Company: E.ON Energy Projects GmbH Location: München Function area: Engineering; Project/Program Management

Job_Title: Senior Data Engineer - Business Intelligence / Sql / Python / Remote
Description:
Was erwartet dich?


Du befasst dich mit dem Sammeln, Aufbereiten und Übertragen von großen Datenmengen aus externen Datenquellen in unser Data Warehouse und transformierst sie über SQL
Du entwickelst mit unseren Business Intelligence Developern unsere ETL-Prozesse (Airflow) weiter und programmierst in Python
Du unterstützt du bei der Modellierung von Datenmodellen in Looker, welche die User als Grundlage für Ihre Entscheidungen im BI Team anfragen
Du bringst neue Ideen ein, die unsere Prozesse im Bereich ETL/ELT & Data Warehousing stetig verbessern
Du führst Analysen basierend auf den Daten im Data Warehouse durch


Was solltest du mitbringen?


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium, bestenfalls im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du hast mehrjährige praktische Programmiererfahrungen als Data Engineer und in der Arbeit mit Python & SQL
Du kennst dich mit Data Warehousing, ETL/ELT, und Modellierung in BI Tools (Looker, PowerBI or Tableau) aus
Du hast Lust auf Neues, liebst persönliches Wachstum und Teamwork für dich gelebte Realität
Du begeisterst mit deiner hohen Auffassungsgabe und deinem analytischen Denken
Du besitzt Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B1-Niveau sowie sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


Was bieten wir dir?


Schlankes, agiles und hochdynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeiten und viel Raum für Kreativität
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, Vertrauensarbeitszeit, mobile Arbeitsformen sowie die Möglichkeit von Sabbaticals
Sei du selbst und bring dich ein in unsere Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien, Offenheit und viel Herzlichkeit
Wir unterstützen dich mit einem persönlichen Entwicklungsplan, Workshops, Trainings und viel regelmäßigem Feedback
Arbeite in modernen, verspielten und gut vernetzten Büros, ergonomisch ausgestattet und mit täglich frischem Obst, Gemüse & Joghurt sowie einer Tee- und Kaffee-Flatrate
Feiere mit uns legendäre Teamevents und Partys, wie z.B. unser jährliches Sommerfest oder unser Weihnachtsevent
Bring dein Kind und Hund mit ins Büro, wir unterstützen dich mit einem Kinderbetreuungszuschuss
Wir sind klimaneutral und engagieren uns dafür, dass unser Unternehmen noch nachhaltiger wird
Modernste technische Ausstattung - auch für dein Homeoffice
Exklusive Rabatte bei verschiedenen Anbietern


Unser Jobangebot Senior Data Engineer für die Datenaufbereitung Remote (m/w/d) klingt vielversprechend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine Bewerbung über Workwise. 
Bei unserem Partner Workwise kann man sich in nur wenigen Minuten ohne Anschreiben für diesen Job bewerben und den Status der Bewerbung live verfolgen.

Job_Title: It Business Analyst / Lead2Contract Business Analyst B2C Consumer Goods
Description:
IT Business Analyst / Lead2Contract Business Analyst B2C Consumer Goods
 


   Essity Global IT Services delivers Solutions for Retail Execution and Trade Promotion Management to Essity business unit Consumer Goods in Europe and North America. These solutions help our business to implement their Go-to-market and Sales Excellence strategies to streamline sales, marketing and customer service processes thereby gaining a competitive edge, winning business and providing excellent systems and services for the entire Essity Salesforce.
 


   In Essity drives a digital program which includes the implementation of C4 SAP Sales Cloud, MS Power Apps and BI Analytics as our core technologies round the world. The journey has just started with region Nordic.
 


   About the Role
 


   In this position as IT Business Analyst you will serve as the channel between the customer community and the solution development teams and will report to the IT Manager Lead2Contract B2C IT Services.
 


   You will work with an international and cross-functional team of experts, support the Delivery Lead in managing the Product Backlog and running the refinement process.
 


   We are looking for a person who presents our values and is an absolute team player supporting each other working with internal colleagues and vendors. You should think in solutions and out of the box, take on challenges and always strive to improve yourself.
 


   Essity’s offers a flexible working model in a modern working environment. We can offer several main locations as your place to work across Europe as Germany, Sweden, France, Italy, UK, Spain, Portugal etc. Our official business language is English.
 


   What You Will Do
 



     Oversee entire backlog and all included user stories, understand and manage dependencies between user stories
   


     Coordinate Business Analysts in the team and own the refinement process
   


     Facilitate workshops or key meetings to capture business requirements and perform as-is analysis, understanding customer and user requirements, their strategies and their goals
   


     Breakdown of business requirements to develop comprehensive requirement specifications that will determine the estimate of cost, time and resources
   


     Liaise with business to ensure that business needs and requirements are well understood
   


     Ensure a clear and complete handover of the requirements within user stories to Architects for their design work
   


     Support implementation of to-be processes, incl. training delivery
   


     Provide knowledge transfer to colleagues and other team members
   



   Who You Are
 



     Minimum 3 years of experience as Business Analyst or Project Manager for large scale business applications preferably in the Lead2Contract process domain (Retail Execution and Trade Management, B2C Area)
   


     Enterprise level experience in utilizing C4 SAP Sales Cloud, Power BI or Power Apps, or similar technologies
   


     Experience of analyzing and breaking down problems and information
   


     Ability to work in international environment across multiple business needs
   


     Experience in agile delivery methodologies and in managing work, code, tests and builds in an agile framework utilizing tools such as Team Foundation Server, Azure DevOps or Jira
   


     Strong communication and negotiation skills and the ability to communicate effectively with senior stakeholders, subject matter experts and technical teams across Global IT Services
   


     Passion for CRM and commitment to excellence
   


     Fluent English knowledge required
   


     Willingness to travel 10-20% in average
   



   What We Can Offer You
 


   At Essity, we believe everyone's learning and professional development is unique and want to empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.
 


   Our diversity makes us strong and creates an inclusive, inviting and harmonious workplace where individuality is appreciated by everyone. For this reason, incoming applications are selected based on professional qualifications and working values regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual identity, nationality, disability or age.
 


   Collaborative and Inclusive Culture | Empowering & Engaged Leaders | Working with Powerful Purpose & Sustainable Impact | Learning and Growing in your Career | Supporting Well-being & Sustainable Working Life | Life-changing Innovations | Competitive Total rewards
 

   Together, we are improving lives, every day.
 


   Together, we are improving lives, every day.
 

   Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.
 


   Application End Date:

 We act as trusted advisors to Digital Economy leaders throughout their entire corporate lifecycle, from raising private capital for fast-growing disrupters and founder-led businesses to orchestrating complex cross-border M&A deals for private equity investors and global large-cap companies.
 At Arma, we combine the collegial culture and hands-on exposure of a boutique advisory firm with the global reach and deal execution excellence of a bulge bracket bank.
 Responsibilities range across all aspects of M&A advisory from sector coverage to transaction execution including:

Undertake valuation analysis of companies, include comparable companies analysis, comparable transaction analysis, discounted cash flow analysis and leveraged buyout analysis

The Werner Siemens Chair for Synthetic Biotechnology at the Department of Chemistry at the Technical University of Munich in Garching seeks an Applied Scientists or Technician (Bioprocess Engineer, Chemical Engineer, Biotechnology, Biology, Biochemistry, Chemistry or related discipline) at Master level (Dipl. Ing. FH or Master FH) or an appropriate industrial qualification (CTA, BTA-IHK or equivalent). The position payment grade is grouped at TVL-E10 (100%). The position is available with initially a 3 years limited term contract. 

  The Technical University of Munich (TUM), is a gobally recongnized German excellence University focusing on natural sciences, engineering and medical sciences with 11 schools, departments and interdiciplinary research centers. TUM is home to 16 nobel laureates and 23 Leibniz Prize holders. The Chemistry Department is ranked top class in Germany and internationally. 
  
 The Werner Siemens Chair for Synthetic Biotechnology, lead by Prof. Dr. Thomas Brück is world leading in sustinable bioprocess and biocatalyst development with a focus on converting greenhouses gases and residueal biomass into value adding products for the chemical, food, and pharmaceutical industry. Prof. Brück is a member of the German national bioeconomy council and his research has been cited in the world climate report.
  

 Projekt description: Valorisarion of fungal biomass to establish concepts for a circular bioeconomy 
  
 Biomass is predominantly used for feed and food products (~55% of global biomass available) followed by bioenergy. However, only 8% is currently used for bio-based materials despite offering an alternative to fossil-derived chemicals. To promote the development and commercialisation of bio-based materials, an abundance of feedstocks (i.e., sugar, starch, vegetable oil and ethanol) are required. However, this may lead to biodiversity and land use change as potentially more land would be needed to enable the replacement of fossil raw materials, estimated at an additional 2.8 billion tonnes (Bt) Dry Matter (DM) biomass per year, which competes with food and feed production. To achieve a sizeable and economically feasible bioeconomy, new technologies are therefore needed in order to diversify and deliver processes that can use available, underutilised and more sustainable biomass feedstocks to leave more land available for biodiversity protection and food production, whilst facilitating the substitution of fossil-based resources with bio-based ones.The Horizon Europe project VALUABLE will focus on the demonstration of a new biotechnology based platform that utilizes non-plant residual biomass as a raw material for the production of microbial oils and functionalized oligosaccharides for applications in the as chemical, cosmetics and materials sector. The international project encompasses 8 industrial and academic project partners from 5 EU countries. The primary language of communication is English, while a good knowledge of German is benefical for daily working interactions in the group.
  

 Responsibility and Tasks: 
  
 The main task is to conduct research and support the scientific staff of the project with technical and instrumental expertise and work to timely generate high fidelity data. Tasks involve data generation, analysis, and reporting in cooperation with the scientific manager and scientist. The main focus is the development and conduction of various yeast fermentations using parallel and automated fermentation bioreactors. A molecular biology background as well es high experience with standard analysis techniques (GC-FID, GC-MS, HPLC) are desired.
  


 Your qualifications: 
  


Expert technical knowledge in Fermentation science (parallel, automated stirred tank bioreactors) at laboratory (0.5-10L) and preferably demonstration scale (100-1000L) is mandatory 
Deep knowledge in molecular biology and biochemical assay development using cellular and enzyme assays with a particular focus on hydrolase enzyme systems 
Assisting the scientific manager and scientist in preparing reports for EU-authorities as well as preparing scientific manuscripts is a key skill demanded by the project 
Advanced knowledge in bioinformatics for systems biology would be advantageous 
Experiences in laboratory automation is desired



 Our offer: 
  
 The position will be paid in accordance with the Collective Agreement for the Civil Service of Bavaria (TVL-E10 see also : TV-L Entgelttabelle, Analysen und Berechnungen 2022-2023 (oeffentlichen-dienst.de), 100%, 3 years limited). Applications from disabled persons with essentially the same qualifications will be given preference. TUM strives to raise the proportion of women in its workforce and explicitly encourages applications from qualified women.
  

 Your application: 
   Please send your application email together with a CV and supporting documentation to Dr. Marion Ringel, Werner Siemens-Lehrstuhl für Synthetische Biotechnologie (WSSB), Department Chemie, Technische Universität München (TUM) Lichtenbergstraße 4, 85748, Garching bei. München until 13/11/2022. 
   Contact: marion.ringel@tum.de
  



Hinweis zum Datenschutz: Im Rahmen Ihrer Bewerbung um eine Stelle an der Technischen Universität München (TUM) übermitteln Sie personenbezogene Daten. Beachten Sie bitte hierzu unsere Datenschutzhinweise gemäß Art. 13 Datenschutz-Grundverordnung (DSGVO) zur Erhebung und Verarbeitung von personenbezogenen Daten im Rahmen Ihrer Bewerbung. Durch die Übermittlung Ihrer Bewerbung bestätigen Sie, dass Sie die Datenschutzhinweise der TUM zur Kenntnis genommen haben. 

Kontakt: marion.ringel@tum.de

We are looking for a Senior Digital Marketing Analyst (m/f/d) to join our experienced, motivated, and upbeat Online Marketing team. Play a key role in the further development of our online marketing tasks and systems, shape effectively the overarching strategy and thereby make a significant contribution to the AutoScout24's success!
 At AutoScout24 we appreciate different lifestyles and cultural backgrounds. At AutoScout24 we welcome diversity as a strength. We know that mixed teams work more successfully. Our organisation is made up of more than 50+ different nationalities, all working together inclusively and respectfully.


 Your role:

Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and create or adopt reports accordingly

 You have:

4+ years of experience as a Marketing Analyst, BI, Data Analyst or similar, in addition to a working experience in an e-commerce or internet environment

Ability to communicate complex ideas, visualize & tell a story through data to both scientific and business audiences, as well as effectively manage stakeholders
Experience in communicating with C-Level

Outstanding attention to detail and strong analytical mindset & grasp of statistical concepts to deliver effective & pragmatic solutions
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with people at all levels in an organisation

Excellent verbal and written English skills
Experience with SQL, web/app marketing attribution and building models and/or budget planning is a big plus



 If this appeals to you but you are in doubt about how exactly your skills match our requirements - we value personality, ambition, and an open mind. Don't hesitate to get in touch and present your personal strengths to us.
 AutoScout24 offers benefits that allow our employees to work as freely and effectively as possible. We provide flexible office attendance and working hours, up to 30 days paid vacation (depending on the location) and state of the art, modern offices to name a few. Our goal is to support you in doing your best work. Learn more about our unique, and meaningful benefits here.

Recruiter: Andreea Chirilov 

 About Us 

 At KONUX, we want to make railways the mobility choice of tomorrow. To get there, we connect networks of smart sensors and algorithms to solve today’s capacity and reliability problems. 

 Apply now, and work on real-world challenges that matter. 

 Your Impact 



Develop insights into a wide range of data sources, including acceleration time series and railway domain databases
Design, simulate and test state-of-the-art algorithms for real time system state identification and prediction
Deploy models into a live system that can deliver real-world insights in real-time
Build tools and infrastructure that contribute to a sensor data analysis ecosystem
Drive innovation and contribute to intellectual property & patents
 Your Benefits Package 



A competitive salary with equity (all permanent KONUX employees have equity! Follow the link and find out more.)
A dedicated Learning & Development budget of 3.600€ p.a.
Flexible working conditions, home office equipment and free choice between a Windows or Apple laptop
Health benefits supporting your physical and mental well-being, e.g subsidization of on-site gym or mental health app licence
27 vacation days (+1 day on every work anniversary for 3 years)
Volunteering activities
 Things you bring to the table 



A degree in Mathematics / Statistics / Engineering or a related field, preferably a PhD
Experience in building and testing statistical or machine learning models (in a business environment would be a plus)
Proficiency in Python and at least one other programming language
Expert knowledge in at least one statistical modeling (e.g. statsmodels, pymc3) OR machine learning/deep learning modeling framework (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, ScikitLearn) OR in building physics-based simulations and models OR in transportation systems simulation, ideally combination of more.
Experience working with Spark/EMR would be a plus
Sharing the KONUX Culture, incl. a Growth Mindset, Resilience and Flexibility
 Sounds exciting? We are looking forward to hearing from you! 

 Transform Railway Operations for a Sustainable Future 

 At KONUX, we are empowering the rail industry by building the best possible predictive analytics solutions for our customers. We strive to help industrial companies improve their maintenance and performance decision-making in a data-driven world. We have built the KONUX Predictive Maintenance System for rail switches, the first AI-based solution for the rail industry, and this is just the beginning. 
Seize the opportunity to play a decisive role in shaping a company during its pivotal growth stage alongside a diverse, multinational team! 

 Equal Opportunity 

 At KONUX, we believe that a diverse team achieves better results faster. So here’s the deal: You bring in your very own perspective. We promise to judge your qualifications and performance, not your age, sex, religion, skin color, gender identity, family status or disability.

From:

Your work environment

       MAN Truck & Bus is one of Europe's leading commercial vehicle manufacturers and transport solution providers. The company's product portfolio includes vans, trucks, buses/coaches and diesel and gas engines along with services related to passenger and cargo transport. MAN Truck & Bus is a company of TRATON GROUP and employs more than 36,000 people worldwide. 
       
 The Digital Solutions department is responsible for the digital strategy and the development of digital products and services in the Sales division for MAN. We work together in cross-functional teams to develop digital solutions that add value for the customer and realise the full potential of our processes. Together as a team, we make a great contribution to MAN's future digitalisation strategy. 
       
 Pull together with us. As part of our team, you will make visions of the future a reality together with us.
       




Job Purpose/Role


As part of an international team you create data products using advanced statistical methods and machine learning, solving business challenges and extracting valuable insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data  
You have a clear understanding of business goals and derive data products in collaboration with business, IT and data analyst and scientists  
You translate objectives into a roadmap and end-to-end delivery plan for your team covering e.g. data collection, data use and data provisioning  
You use agile methods, explore emerging technologies and establish an environment of constant learning, integrity, and mutual responsibility  
Establish yourself as a data science ambassador (d/f/m) across business units and functions




Your qualifications


Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in planning, managing, and implementing large-scale data science and machine learning projects  
Degree in a computer science field, mathematics, or similar; PhD is a plus  
Proven track record of delivering data science projects from prototype to value generating product  
Extensive hands-on experience with data products in cloud ecosystems  
Relevant experience with cloud solutions such as AWS, Azure or Google in relation to Data Science as well as basic understanding of Big Data architecture  
Extensive knowledge in the application of statistical methods and tools (e.g. Python, R, Scala, Julia) as well as in the handling of databases and BI/Visualization tools  
Fluent in English; German language skill is a plus  
Ability to collaborate closely with non-technical teams    Our offer:  
Flexible working hours and location  
Up to over 40 days holiday  
On average only 1 day/week presence in the office  
Possibility to work 20 days/year from abroad in the EU  
Attractive compensation with Holiday and Christmas bonuses  
Corporate retirement plan  
International working environment  
Global career opportunities within the TRATON Group with the brands Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, Navistar and RIO   




Job information



This position is located at the

MAN Truck & Bus SE



in

Munich



.




       Reference code:
      

 63532086






       Ms. Aslihan Keskin-Aydin, Phone: +49 (162) 3078004, is at your disposal for any questions.
      





Integrity and Compliance are essential elements of our corporate culture.



We firmly support diversity and equal opportunities and are therefore looking forward to receiving a diverse range of applications.

Job_Title: Data Analyst  - Onsite Or Remote / Home Office
Description:
Über uns
Mit unseren starken Marken GMX, WEB.DE und mail.com sind wir mit über 42 Mio. aktiven Nutzer*innen die führende E-Mail- und Kommunikationsplattform im DACH-Raum. Aus dieser starken Marktposition heraus entwickeln wir Services und Apps, die das digitale Leben vereinfachen - von Office-Tools und Cloud-Speicher bis hin zum persönlichen ID-Management.
Ihre Aufgaben
Deine Leidenschaft ist Data Science und Du möchtest durch Dein Analyse Know-How den Spam-Schutz von über 42 Millionen E-Mail Nutzer*innen verbessern? Du möchtest in einem digitalen Unternehmen mit agiler Arbeitsumgebung und flachen Hierarchien etwas bewegen? Bei uns bekommst Du mehr als nur einen Job: Du bekommst die Möglichkeit, Deine Fähigkeiten und Ideen beim erfolgreichsten deutschen E-Mail-Anbieter einzubringen und unsere Erfolgsgeschichte weiterzuschreiben. Du unterstützt unser Mail Security Team dabei die Posteingänge unserer Kund*innen frei von Spam, Viren und anderen unerwünschten E-Mail zu halten.

Durch explorative Datenanalyse im Big Data Umfeld generierst Du Erkenntnisse zu ein- und ausgehenden Spam E-Mails. 
Du verwendest die bei der Analyse gewonnenen Erkenntnisse um gemeinsam mit Deinem interdisziplinären Team aus Softwareentwickler*innen, Produktmanager*innen und Datenspezialist*innen neue Anti-Spam-Lösungen zu schaffen. 
Du verwendest Machine Learning-Ansätze mit dem Ziel den Spamschutz zu optimieren. 
Du arbeitest eng mit anderen Teams zusammen und verstehst es in einem multikulturellen Umfeld verschiedene Hintergründe, Perspektiven und Kenntnisse so zu nutzen, dass dabei die bestmögliche Lösung zum Schutz der Kundenpostfächer entsteht. 
Du beobachtest kontinuierlich den E-Mail Markt und unsere relevanten Mitbewerber*innen. Du verfolgst die Entwicklungen im E-Mail und E-Mail Security Umfeld aufmerksam mit dem Ziel, das Potential neuer Technologien für unsere Anti Spam Lösungen einzusetzen.

Das wünschen wir uns
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes (Wirtschaft-)Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung und bereits erste Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science? Du interessierst dich dafür Big Data und Machine Learning zum Schutz vor unerwünschten E-Mail einzusetzen? Du verstehst komplexe Sachverhalte und kannst mit Freude an technischen Diskussionen teilnehmen? Du bist ein echter Teamplayer, Du kannst deine Teammitglieder*innen begeistern und hast einen „Hands-on“ Arbeitsstil? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Du hast gute Kenntnisse in gängigen Data Science Methoden, Machine Learning und der Statistik. 
Du bist sicher in der Analyse sehr großer Datenmengen und hast bereits praktische Erfahrung mit Elasticsearch/Kibana oder ähnlichen Analyse-Tools. 
Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrung mit Python (oder vergleichbarer Programmiersprachen) zur Modellierung und Aufbereitung komplexer Analysen. 
Du bist ein Kommunikationstalent mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen und Du liebst es in einem agilen und internationalen Umfeld zu arbeiten. 
Deine Erfahrung im Umfeld von E-Mail Technologien, Anti-Spam oder Anti-Abuse runden Dein Profil ab.







   Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von z.B. Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität, körperlichen Merkmalen, Familienstand oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht.
  


Kontakt
1&1 Mail & Media Applications SE Recruiting & Candidate Management


     Brauerstraße 48
     D-76135 Karlsruhe
   


    jobs@mail-and-media.com

About BestSecret GroupWe are a leading European members-only online destination for premium and luxury off-price fashion. Partnering with over 3,000 international brands, our tech-focused mindset and strong commitment to sustainability drives a truly unique experience for our members. With almost 100 years of experience behind us, and a major tech transformation ahead, BestSecret is scaling at pace to become one of Europe’s most exciting ecommerce players. We are proud to have a diverse team of over 1,700 employees from over 80 countries and are committed to further building out our international team with the very best talent based at our various hubs across Europe.
SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST MARKETS (M/F/D)Location: Aschheim bei München, remote / Homeoffice
We are looking for you to join us as a senior business analyst, who will support the long-term success of Best Secret in the different regions by driving insights, planning, and forecasting our sales, building business cases for investment decisions, providing data driven recommendations and bring transparency on the business drivers. This is a high-impact, high-visibility role as an interface between the markets and the business units (Demand, Convenience, Supply, Finance) that will have a direct influence on the day-to-day Best Secret’s core consumer business and ensure its continuing success.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Tracking the business performance of the different markets and local market trends and monitoring of key KPIs to become the local customer advocate across the company.
Supporting in the financial business case planning in collaboration with other business units, such as Finance, Convenience, and Supply.
Driving the mid-term sales forecast as key input for weekly trading steering and weekly capacity planning as well as the monthly S&OP process to ensure the business alignment.
You will be supporting our market development director and country managers on short- and long-term strategic topics.
Monitoring the country P&Ls and derive recommendations for top and bottom-line impact to meet the financial targets.
Leading cross-functional projects with commercial relevance in the markets as well as creating of ongoing reports.

YOUR QUALIFICATION

You bring 5+ years’ of professional experience in a similar analytical position – previous experience in e-commerce is a strong plus.
You have successfully completed a degree in economics, engineering or comparable.
Excellent MS Excel skills and knowledge of SQL are part of your expertise.
Experience in setting up business cases and driving strategic business conclusions, strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrable leadership skills and experience in a business partnering role.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

BENEFITS

Become part of our success story and work in an innovative working environment
Individual training for your personal development
Find an environment where you feel comfortable and can develop fully
Great employee discounts for your perfect style
Stay fit and healthy with our corporate memberships at exclusive fitness and wellness clubs in Germany
Attractive salary package and 30 days of vacation
Highly motivated colleagues and a thorough induction phase
Hybrid working gives you a high degree of flexibility

Interested? Perfect! Then apply now.Apply now
Best Secret GmbHMirka TumovaMargaretha-Ley-Ring 2785609 Aschheim
www.bestsecret.com
Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung
Arbeitszeiten:

Montag bis Freitag

Leistungen:

Betriebliche Weiterbildung
Homeoffice
Mitarbeiter-Rabatt
Preisnachlässe auf Produkte/Dienstleistungen des Unternehmens
Zusätzliche Urlaubstage

Arbeitsort: Ein Arbeitsort

Job_Title: Partner Business Manager - Opportunity For Working Remotely Munich,
Description:
Job Description
  





 Partner Business Manager 
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
 We are looking for an experienced talent to join our partner management team in Germany. You will bring passion, take ownership of developing and executing a strategic partnership approach to serve the success of our partner business in market. In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
 recruit, enable and manage top tier partners, shape and execute acceleration of our emerging partners development lead Reseller team and the strategic partner development for emerging products like VCPP, Tanzu etc. build a different profile of partners to help major transformation
 In this role, no day is the same and you will never be bored! You will interact daily with your partner and will be able to make a real impact in their success as a business.
 Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
 Making an impact early at VMware relies on 3 core elements. Establishing relationships with colleagues and partners; building solid knowledge and understanding of our technologies; and navigating the internal & external processes and best practices within the teams.
 Your success will come from great communication skills, effective business planning and delivery, and a relentless curiosity for learning and developing.
 You will be managing opportunities from day one, in collaboration with your extended teams at the partners & distributors, and be expected to build and sustain a pipeline, leveraging expertise and key focus areas at our partners.
 By the end of your first 12 months at VMware you should have established a significant presence and impact within your strategic partners, and the colleagues with whom you work.

 The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

 Successful Partner Business Managers maximize their time with partners, engaging in their business and exploring ways in which VMware can accelerate their business.
 You will set a regular cadence for engagement with the range of stakeholders, including quarterly reviews and executive briefings. You will cover a breath of stakeholders for building actionable relationships with the partners’ leaders, including sales, pre-sales and services departments.
 Your individual partner business plans will establish a foundation of intelligence and insight for both short-term tactical opportunities as well as long-term strategic success including marketing plans and activities.
 You will be instrumental to support partners in developing best-in-class VMware sales, consulting, deployment, and managed services practices, to help their customers in their digital transformation journey and realize their own business goals.
 Internally, you will work with the broader VMware team, Partner Community, as well as collaborating with our Go to market team across each of our technology areas to accelerate key programs and initiatives.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and an overall positive and energetic approach will set you apart from competitors.

 What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
 You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

 Medical Coverageand Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
 Generous Time Off Programs
 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
 Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities
 Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)

 Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes




 Category : Sales Subcategory: Partner Programs Experience: Manager and Professional Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time Posted Date: 2022-10-11
 VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Job_Title: Praktikant Im Bereich Data Analyst Business Intelligence Technologie Montage
Description:
DIE ZUKUNFT DER MOBILITÄT? DIGITAL.
 TEILE DEINE LEIDENSCHAFT.
 Mehr als 90 % aller Innovationen im Automobil basieren auf Elektronik und Software. Gerade hier sind große Freiräume und vernetztes Denken gefordert, um die Mobilität neu zu erfinden und ein völlig neues Fahrerlebnis zu ermöglichen. Deshalb geben wir Studierenden bei uns nicht nur die Gelegenheit zum Zuhören, sondern auch zum Mitreden und Weiterdenken.


Wir, die BMW Group, bieten dir ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Praktikum im Bereich Planungssysteme und Digitalisierung in der Montageplanung.

 Was erwartet dich?

 Im Rahmen deiner Tätigkeit entwickelst du datengetriebene Lösungen zur Digitalisierung der Montage Prozessplanung.
 Dabei hilfst du bei der Analyse und Standardisierung von Montageprozessen und befähigst diese für die digitale Welt.
 Zusammen mit unseren Partnern im Planungsnetzwerk gestaltest du Data Analytics - und IoT Anwendungen zur Analyse und Vereinfachung von Prozessabläufen.


 Dabei hast du die Möglichkeit dich aktiv mit eigenen Ideen einzubringen und unterstützt die Technologie Montage bei der Umsetzung von Data Analytics Use Cases in der Prozessplanung.


 Was bringst du mit?

 Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Elektrotechnik, Mathematik oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang.
 Zweite Hälfte Diplom-/ Bachelorstudiengang oder Masterstudium.
 Praktische Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Datenbanken, Algorithmen, Künstliche Intelligenz und Datenbankstrukturen.
 Programmierkenntnisse (SQL, Python, Java, C#) und erste Erfahrungen mit dem Microsoft Azure Stack wünschenswert.
 Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office sowie verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.


 Du bringst Begeisterung für den Umgang mit Daten und ein innovatives Umfeld mit? Bewirb dich jetzt!

 Startdatum: ab 01.02.2023
 Dauer: 6 Monate
 Arbeitszeit: Vollzeit
 
Ansprechpartner: BMW Group Recruiting Team +49 89 382-17001

Gesucht für Standort: München 
Leidenschaft, Präzision und Zielstrebigkeit sind bei HOFFMANN EITLE keine leeren Worte. Jeder unserer rund 450 Mitarbeiter leistet einen wertvollen Beitrag für ein gemeinsames Ziel. Werden Sie Teil unseres internationalen Teams als Junior Business Analyst (m/w) auf Zeit und unterstützen Sie uns bei der umfassenden Betreuung von Kunden aus aller Welt. Es handelt sich um eine befristete Stelle für mindestens 3 Tage pro Woche für 6 Monate.








Ihre Aufgaben 

Als Junior Business Analyst unterstützen Sie uns bei der Erfassung und Analyse von Geschäftsanforderungen und Geschäftsprozessen für das Transformationsprojekt Fit-For-The-Future. Sie werden innerhalb des Projektteams arbeiten, um sicherzustellen, dass Ihre Aufgaben im Einklang mit dem vereinbarten Zeitplan abgeschlossen werden. Zu Ihren Hauptaufgaben gehören:

Hilfestellung und Unterstützung bei der Definition der Soll-Prozesse und -Verfahren, einschließlich der Durchführung von Workshops.
Unterstützung bei der Sicherstellung, dass die Geschäftsanforderungen vollständig entwickelt und dokumentiert werden, z. B. funktionale, nicht-funktionale, technische und Berichtsanforderungen
Unterstützung bei der Analyse der Geschäftsanforderungen, unter angemessener Einbeziehung der Fachabteilungen, einschließlich der Überprüfung der aktuellen Prozesse und Datenquellen
Analyse der vorgeschlagenen Lösungen im Hinblick auf die geschäftlichen Anforderungen
Zusammenarbeit mit Geschäftsanalysten und technischen Teams von Drittanbietern, sofern erforderlich
Aufforderung an das Unternehmen, alternative Arbeitsweisen vorzuschlagen, um Effizienz, Qualität und Durchsatz zu steigern




Ihre Qualifikationen 


Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind wünschenswert.
Sie studieren oder interessieren sich für ein einschlägiges Fachgebiet, z. B. Betriebswirtschaft, Prozessanalyse, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Computersysteme.
Erfahrungen in einer Anwaltskanzlei oder im juristischen Bereich sind von Vorteil.
Kenntnisse von Projekt- und Analysetechniken und unterstützenden Werkzeugen zur Anforderungsdefinition und -dokumentation.
Ausgezeichnete zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten und Präsentationsfähigkeiten.
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten (schriftlich und mündlich).
Fähigkeit, auf eigene Initiative und im Team zu arbeiten.




















Ihre Vorteile 

gründliche Einarbeitungszeit
eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten
attraktiver Arbeitsplatz in einem modernen Bürokomplex mit guter Anbindung
teamorientiertes Arbeiten in einem multikulturellen Umfeld
zusätzliche betriebliche Leistungen wie die Möglichkeit zur mobilen Arbeit nach Absprache, gemeinsame Feiern, Unterstützung bei der Kinderbetreuung etc.




Haben wir Ihre persönlichen Stärken und Ansprüche beschrieben? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt bei einer Kanzlei, die innere Werte zu schätzen weiß! 















Kontakt
Human Resources
T +49 89 92 40 90 E humanresources@hoffmanneitle.com  HOFFMANN EITLE Arabellastraße 30 81925 München 















Internationale Diversität
Bei HOFFMANN EITLE zählen persönlicher Antrieb und individuelle Stärken. Der hohe Stellenwert von inneren Werten hat bei HOFFMANN EITLE eine Diversität hervorgebracht, die ganz im Sinne unserer Mandanten und Mitarbeiter:innen wertvolle Synergien schafft. In unserer Kanzlei prägen Menschen aus über 20 Ländern von allen fünf Kontinenten und noch mehr Spezialgebieten eine Kultur der Weltoffenheit und des interdisziplinären Austauschs, in der alle ihre persönliche Wertschätzung und Weiterentwicklung erfahren.









Kulinarisches Highlight
Wir sorgen mit den kulinarischen Highlights des Restaurants leonardi und einer komfortablen Lounge dafür, dass auch die Pausen angenehm verbracht werden können.









Lebendiger Teamgeist
Auch über das rein Professionelle hinaus verstehen sich unsere Mitarbeiter:innen als bunte Einheit. Regelmäßig geht man gemeinsam zum Yoga, passionierte Hobbybäcker:innen verteilen im Büro ihre neuesten Kuchenkreationen, man trifft sich auf Afterworkpartys, Segeltörns, Tennismatches, lauscht der hauseigenen Swingband, läuft beim Kickerturnier auf und tritt gemeinsam beim Firmenlauf an.






"Wir verständigen uns einfach gerne auf gemeinsame Projekte."










Gefeiertes Miteinander
Auf gemeinsamen Sommerfesten, Weihnachtsfeiern und Ausflügen können sich unsere Kolleg:innen auch untereinander besser kennenlernen.

Gesucht für Standort: München

Sie studieren oder interessieren sich für ein einschlägiges Fachgebiet, z. B. Betriebswirtschaft, Prozessanalyse, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Computersysteme.
