Die Iveco Group N.V. (MI: IVG) ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen der Automobilbranche, das in den Bereichen Nutz- und Spezialfahrzeuge, Antriebstechnologien und den damit verbundene Finanzdienstleistungen tätig ist. Jede der acht zum Unternehmen gehörende Marke ist in ihrem spezifischen Industriesektor eine treibende Kraft: IVECO, eine wegweisende Nutzfahrzeugmarke, die schwere, mittelschwere und leichte Nutzfahrzeuge entwickelt, herstellt und verkauft; FPT Industrial, ein weltweit führender Hersteller von fortschrittlichen Antriebstechnologien für Kunden in der Landwirtschaft, im Baugewerbe, in der Schifffahrt, in der Energieerzeugung und bei Nutzfahrzeugen; IVECO BUS und HEULIEZ, die Premium-, Nahverkehrs- und Reisebusmarken; Iveco Defence Vehicles für hochspezialisierte Verteidigungs- und Katastrophenschutzausrüstungen; ASTRA, ein globaler Experte für schwere Steinbruch- und Baufahrzeuge; Magirus, eine branchenweit renommierte Marke für Feuerwehrfahrzeuge und Brandschutztechnik; und IVECO CAPITAL, der Finanzierungsarm der Iveco Group, der alle unterstützt. Die Iveco Group beschäftigt weltweit rund 34.000 Mitarbeiter und betreibt über 29 Produktionswerke sowie 31 Forschungs- und Entwicklungszentren. Job_Title: Intern In The Area Of Data & Analytics Human Resources
Description:
A GOOD INTERNSHIP IS NEVER HANDS OFF.
 SHARE YOUR PASSION.
 We believe in creating an environment where our interns really can learn by doing and where they are given their own areas of responsibility right from the start of their time with us. That’s why our experts will treat you as part of the team from day one, encourage you to bring your own ideas to the table – and give you the opportunity to really show what you can do.


We, the BMW Group, offer you an interesting and varied internship in the area of Data and Analytics in HR.

 The HR Analytics team is responsible for the entire development process of HR Analytics Use Cases in Germany, starting with the ideation phase, to the conceptual, data preparation and implementation of the final IT product.
 
What awaits you?

 You will support the HR Analytics team in the context of advanced analytics and proactively expand your professional as well as your technical knowledge.
 Data engineering / data management as well as data science / data usage.
 Data depersonalization (pseudo-anonymization / anonymization).
 Performing descriptive analytics and developing interactive web-based dashboards.
 Training/implementing/evaluating statistical/ML models for predictive analytics.
 Business Intelligence.


 What should you bring along?

 Basic understanding of data analytics and data pipelines.
 Programming experience with Python or R, JupyterNotebook and relevant Data Science libraries (numpy, pandas dataframe, plotly).
 Experience with BI programs and dashboard solutions (Qlik, Tableau, QuickSight).
 Familiarity with Ubuntu OS commands and Docker.
 Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS S3, Sagemaker, Glue) and data modeling for databases (SQL language MySQL).
 Business fluent English (German is a plus).


 Are you into developing data-driven solutions and working within an innovative environment? Apply now!

 Earliest starting date: 15.11.2022
 Duration: 6 months
 Working hours: Full-time

 Contact:
 BMW Group Recruiting Team
 +49 89 382-17001

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir in Vollzeit einen (Junior)-Data Analyst (m/w/x) für Mediaplus Insights.
 Mediaplus Insights (MPI) ist die Research-Einheit der Mediaplus Gruppe und liefert Insights zu Marken, Märkten, Menschen und Medien.
 Unsere Analytics Einheit ist Teil der Mediaplus Forschungseinheit und besteht aus Experten für Statistik und Data Science. Mit großer Neugier, fundierter Fachkenntnis und methodischem Vorgehen hilft Du uns, aus den Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren. Du trägst dazu bei, neue spannende Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und wirkungsvolle Modelle und Produkte auf den Weg zu bringen. Was Dich bei uns erwartet: 
 
Du tauchst tief in die Daten unserer Kunden ein, trennst relevante von irrelevanten Informationen und überführst diese in auswertbare Datenstrukturen
Du wickelst Projekte selbstständig ab, wobei Du in zuverlässigen Feedback-Schleifen den Stand Deiner Analysen berichtest
Konzeption und Durchführung von (multivariaten) statistischen Analysen in dem Themenbereich Werbewirkung
Du ermöglichst mithilfe statistischer und Machine Learning-basierter Modelle eine Bewertung der Werbeinvestitionen unserer Kunden
Darüber hinaus unterstützt Du bei der Standardisierung und Automatisierung unserer Analysemethoden sowie bei der Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse
Was wir von Dir erwarten: 
 
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik, BWL, VWL oder einem vergleichbaren Studienfach mit Statistikhintergrund
Erste Erfahrung in vergleichbarer Position
Erste Erfahrung in den Bereichen Marketing Mix Modelling und der Werbewirkungsforschung
Du hast bereits Statistik- und Modellbildungs-Kenntnisse und Begriffe wie Time Series Modelling, logistische Regression oder Decision Trees sind für Dich keine Fremdwörter
Gute Kenntnisse in R und/oder Python und dem Aufbau von Automatisierungsprozessen
Strukturiertes Vorgehen, Team-Geist und Wissenshunger und die Bereitschaft zur Weiterentwicklung
Begeisterung für Medien, Trends, Innovationen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Was wir Dir bieten: 
 
Onboarding: Durch persönliches Mentoring und digitale Onboarding-Sessions - wir sorgen für Deinen perfekten Einstieg
Weiterbildung: Deine Entwicklung ist uns wichtig. Ob durch unser internes Campus-Weiterbildungsprogramm zur Erweiterung Deiner Fach-, Methoden- oder Persönlichkeitskompetenzen, freiwillige Sprachkurse oder regelmäßige Coachings - wir halten Dich up to date
Flexibilität: Durch flexible Arbeitszeiten, Mobile Office und Jobsharing-Modelle kannst Du Deinen Beruf an Dein Leben anpassen – und nicht andersrum
Fun: Wer arbeitet, muss auch mal eine Pause machen – bei uns hast Du durch regelmäßige After Work und Team Events genug Möglichkeiten (auch virtuell, wenn’s sein muss)
Sport: Großes Sportprogramm sowie Mobilität durch Agenturfahrräder und E-Bikes/E-Bike Leasing
Erreichbarkeit: Unser modernes Office im Kreativviertel Münchens ist dank perfekter Lage gut für Dich erreichbar
Internationalität: Als international agierende Agenturgruppe bekommst Du bei uns die Möglichkeit, Dich mit Kolleg:innen aus den unterschiedlichsten Disziplinen aus der ganzen Welt zu vernetzen und auszutauschen

Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen, unter Angabe Deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Position Description:
CGI seht für die nächste Generation in der Digitalen Transformation. Wir ermöglichen es, unseren Kunden neue Technologien zu evaluieren und gewinnbringend einzusetzen.  Begriffe wie Customer Journey, User Journey, Design Thinking und Storytelling sind für Dich keine Fremdwörter, sondern Teil Deines Mindsets? Wir suchen Talente wie Dich, die unser Team verstärken und uns dabei unterstützen, innovative Ansätze zu finden. In unserem wachsenden Team triffst Du auf flache Hierarchien und kannst Dein Fachwissen in einem dynamischen und agilen Umfeld ständig erweitern.  Hierzu bauen wir unsere Standorte in Süddeutschland weiter aus. Aktuell steht hierbei der neue CGI Standort in Nürnberg im Fokus. Wenn Du Lust hast von Anfang an dabei zu sein und maßgeblich am erfolgreichen Aufbau eines weiteren CGI Standorts beteiligt zu sein, dann ist das für Dich die Gelegenheit! Werde Teil von CGI und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft unserer Kunden neu! 


Your future duties and responsibilities:

   Du bist der First point of contact des Projektleiters in technischen Fragen und berätst unseren Kunden im Hinblick auf den wirtschaftlichen Erfolg des Projekts. Du unterstützt beim Ausbau unsere Kundenbeziehungen und der Weiterentwicklung unserer Beratungsmethoden sowie bei den Angebotsprozessen für Ausschreibungen und Projekte.
   
 Die folgenden Themenbereiche gehören zu Deinem Aufgabenbereich:
   


Fachlich, technische Analyse und Design von Funktionen und Prozessabläufen
Durchführen von Anforderungsworkshops und Interviews
Erstellen von Geschäftsregeln (fachlich und technisch) als Grundlage für die IT-Programmierung inkl. Beauftragung der IT-Einheiten, auch in agilen Projekten in der Form von User Stories
Technisch und prozessuale Betrachtung der umzusetzenden Anforderungen (Erste Impact-Analyse), Bewertung der Machbarkeit
Erstellung erster Architektur-Blueprints und Prozessabläufen zu neuen Verfahren und / oder Prozessen
Einführung und Begleitung neuer Change Prozesse




Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Fach-/ Hochschulstudium aus den Bereichen Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, o.ä.. Alternativ eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit adäquater, langjähriger Berufserfahrung in der IT Branche 
3-4 Jahre Projekterfahrung in der Beratung
Sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und ein gutes Verständnis komplexer Zusammenhänge
Sehr gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten sowie Erfahrung in der Leitung oder Unterstützung von Workshops
Sicheres Auftreten im Umgang mit Kunden, ein hohes Maß an Einsatzbereitschaft und „Hands-on“ Mentalität 
Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Anforderungsanalysen, Umsetzungsvorgaben, Test und Abnahme von IT-Funktionen
Gute Kenntnisse von Methoden und Notationen der Business Analyse (BPMN 2.0, UML, Use Cases, Epics und User Stories)
Gute Kenntnisse von Werkzeugen der Business Analyse zur Prozessmodellierung (Aris, Visio oder ähnliches) oder Prozessoptimierung (z.B. Celonis)
Kommunikations- und Kooperationsstärke
Erfahrung und Freude an Pre-Sales-Aktivitäten
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

 Idealerweise hast Du eine Zertifizierung im Bereich (agile) Business Analyse (z.B. CABA, IIBA), Requirements Engineering (z.B. IREB, CARS) und / oder als Scrum Product Owner. 
   Außer dem fachlichen Know-how zeichnet Dich soziale Kompetenz aus. Du bist fähig, aktiv zuzuhören und Kundenanforderungen fundiert zu analysieren. Ein überzeugendes Auftreten, Spaß an teamorientiertem Arbeiten sowie geistige Flexibilität kennzeichnen Dich.
  


LI-SK10



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  Der Motor für die digitale Transformation unserer Kunden ist die Technologie – der Antrieb für den Erfolg unseres Unternehmens sind die Menschen.  Als Berater:in bei CGI genießt du das Vertrauen deiner Kolleg:innen und Kunden. In der Zusammenarbeit gewinnst du Erkenntnisse, die zu wertvollen und nachhaltigen Lösungen führen. Unsere Mitarbeitenden heißen „Member“, weil sie am Erfolg beteiligt werden und gemeinsam ein Unternehmen gestalten, auf das wir alle stolz sind. Diesen Traum haben wir seit 1976, und er hat uns dorthin geführt, wo wir heute stehen: Wir sind einer der weltgrößten unabhängigen Dienstleister für IT und Business Consulting.  Bei CGI erkennen wir den Mehrwert von Vielfalt. Wir wollen ein Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, dem sich alle zugehörig fühlen, und fördern zusammen mit unseren Kunden die Inklusion. Bei uns haben alle die gleichen Chancen, erfolgreich zu sein und sich weiterzuentwickeln. Solltest du im Recruiting-Prozess Unterstützung benötigen, sind wir für dich da.  Bist du bereit, Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte zu werden? Komm zu CGI – wo du mit deinen Ideen und deinem Engagement etwas bewirkst.

Company Description
  We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.



 Job Description
  Verisk is looking for an enthusiastic, passionate and ambitious Risk Analyst / Consultant to join our Consulting and Client Service Team.
 The mission of our team is to build client relationships based on the detailed knowledge of Verisk’s extreme event management products so we can meet the needs of our client’s modeling workflow and allow them to easily understand their risk. We strive to provide exemplary service and support that allows clients to obtain the maximum value from the products and services they license from Verisk.
 As part of our team, you will use your technical, analytical, and communication skills to ensure our clients understand how to manage their catastrophe risk profile. In this you will work closely with insurance/reinsurance underwriters, actuarial professionals, research scientists, and investment bankers, among others. We expect you to take ownership of your projects and tasks and bring in ideas how we can improve.
 If you are looking for an opportunity to expand your career and join a company who is committed to diversity, while informing and influencing the future direction of extreme event modeling, please apply now!
 Main responsibilities (but not limited to):

 Develop strong relationships with model users and consumers of model results within our clients; learn their workflows and objectives, and provide proactive service to help them avoid pitfalls and to leverage our solutions optimally
 Respond to client questions in a timely manner and help bring them to a speedy and accurate resolution by working collaboratively with our internal teams
 Perform a wide of range of risk analyses in support of consulting projects, client support, and internal initiatives


 Lead the on-boarding efforts for new clients in close coordination with our internal teams as needed. This includes training, workflow design, the usage and interpretation of model results, and addressing challenges related to adopting or transitioning to Verisk
 Support model and product change management efforts when model updates or new features are introduced in our software
 Provide input to our internal teams regarding the evolution of our products based on client feedback and your internal usage of our products. Remain engaged with the internal teams through feature design, development, and release
 Support our business development team in sales efforts in a technical and a pre-sales support capacity




 Qualifications
  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Client Service focused mentality
 Proactive problem-solving skills
 Talent to summarize, contextualize, and communicate complex issues


 Ability to manage multiple projects / tasks at the same time
 Detail and results orientated
 Ability to analyze data using tools like Excel, SQL, and scripting languages


 Requirements:

 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, actuarial science, engineering, physics, geo-sciences and business or computer science.
 Masters preferred
 Experience in consulting or insurance fields preferred
 Fluency in German and English

 #LI-CI1
 Additional Information
  Extreme event solutions at Verisk (formerly AIR Worldwide) provides risk modeling solutions that help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. In 1987, Verisk founded the catastrophe modeling industry and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, supply chain disruptions, terrorism, pandemics, casualty catastrophes, and cyber incidents. Insurance, reinsurance, financial, corporate, and government clients rely on Verisk’s advanced science, software, and consulting services for catastrophe risk management, insurance-linked securities, longevity modeling, site-specific engineering analyses, and agricultural risk management. Verisk’s extreme event solutions team is headquartered in Boston, with additional offices in North America, Europe, and Asia. For more information, please visit www.air-worldwide.com. For more information about Verisk, a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, energy and specialized markets, and financial services, please visit www.verisk.com.
 At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.
 Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.
 But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.
 It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.
 At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.
 At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.
 Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.
 All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.
 http://www.verisk.com/careers.html
 Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Let's win together 

 At Temedica, we break new ground in the digital health sector and challenge the traditional healthcare model. We believe that individualised treatment is a fundamental right of every patient and, at the same time, is key to a better overall quality of care. Putting the patient into the centre of healthcare, Temedica improves patient outcomes by offering personalised patient support and using artificial intelligence to translate patient behaviour and experiences into sensible interventions. 

 Are you looking to join an inspiring team and explore the most cutting-edge developments and opportunities within the digital health sector? Are healthcare and digital technology your passions? We are continually looking for new talents and experts in the field who want to share our vision of crafting the future of personal health! 

 As a Junior Product Data Analyst, y\_\_ou will be unlocking insights that will help everyone in Temedica make business decisions based on data and facts. You will be also part of a duo, like Batman and Robin. The superpower here is that whatever you do will be making a direct impact across all of Temedica as all eyes are going to the dashboards built by this team. 

 Your Role with us 



You will build and maintain reporting dashboards in Tableau that are used by everyone in the company.
You will maintain and review the data pipeline code that is used to extract and prepare the data for analysis.
You will occasionally be giving presentations and handling ad-hoc requests for quick insights
 What you bring to the table 



You are very comfortable with basic business statistics such as mean, median, standard deviation, hypothesis testing, clustering, linear, and logistic regression.
You have knowledge of different technology tools: Python, specially Psycopg2, numpy, and pandas, knowledge in R is a huge plus. Likewise, you also know how to use SQL at the basic level, and you are familiar with dashboarding tools (mainly Tableau, but if you have experience in QlikView, PowerBI, or Looker that is also good.
You have already acquired Git and GitHub knowledge
Curiosity mindset, you love exploring data for the sake of exploring data. You are not afraid of communicating your findings, even if it is not part of the request.
You bring willingness to learn. In the Product Analytics team, we strongly believe in developing oneself at the personal and technical level.
You are comfortable with public speaking and giving presentations.
 What we bring to the table 

 Aside from the people, the role, our culture and our mission, we have countless other aspects that make Temedica a great place to work at: 



We are an open-minded, international team that loves collaborating to reach our goals.
We live a professional feedback culture with objective performance reviews and room to grow.
We invest in your personal and professional growth and align to your career development plan.
We equip you with state-of-the-art technology (MacBook Pro, etc.)
We offer a workplace where you can feel comfortable right in the city center of Munich.
We enjoy spending quality time together such as Go Kart, and sports activities.
We are a market-proven, well-funded and fast-growing company.
We provide extensive language training programs in German.
We offer JobRad® and Corporate Benefits.
We offer relocation and visa support.
 Join us! 

 Are you looking for an exciting challenge within digital health? We are looking forward to your application!\_\_

Ihre Aufgabe
 Als Junior Business Consultant Automotive (m/w/d) berätst Du in erster Linie unsere Kunden bei der Neu- und Weiterentwicklung ihrer digitalisierten Prozesse. Dabei arbeitest in einem flexiblen, internationalen Team mit Schwerpunkten in Eigenverantwortung und Eigeninitiative. Das gilt auch für Deinen Arbeitsplatz - Du entscheidest wo Du arbeitest und in welchem Umfeld Du Deiner Kreativität am besten freien Lauf lassen kannst. Und keine Sorge - Dir wird zu Beginn ein persönlicher Coach zur Seite gestellt, der Dich bei der Einarbeitung in die technischen und fachlichen Themen unterstützt.


Im Laufe eines Projektes, erarbeitest Du Dir den Business-Prozess des Kunden und nutzt Deine IT-Kompetenz, um auf den Kunden zugeschnittene Lösungsideen zu entwickeln
In diesem Zusammenhang stellst Du die Anforderungen der Kunden und die Möglichkeiten unserer Entwicklungsteams gegenüber und findest die beste Lösung
Nichts desto Trotz, liegt uns Dein persönliches Wachstum sehr am Herzen und Du erhältst bei uns viele Möglichkeiten Dich fortzubilden und beruflich weiterzuentwickeln 

Ihr Profil
 Verfügst Du über ein Studium, eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Information Management oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation? Besitzt Du bereits erste Erfahrungen als Junior Business Consultant mit direktem Kundenkontakt und findest die dynamische Automobil Industrie spannend und interessant?

Möchtest Du die modernen Trends der Mobilität mitgestalten?
Hast Du Spaß an der Erstellung von User Stories und EPICS für Anwendungen?
Verfügst Du über gute analytische und methodische Fähigkeiten, insbesondere zur Anforderungsanalyse und zum Anforderungsmanagement?
Hast Du eventuell schon praktische Erfahrung aus Softwareentwicklungsprojekten und sogar Programmiererfahrung?
Besitzt Du eine grundlegende Affinität zur IT und möchtest den Wandel in Deinem beruflichen Umfeld mitgestalten?
Kannst Du souverän auf Deutsch und Englisch präsentieren und moderieren?

Wenn Du die Fragen mehrheitlich mit "ja" beantworten kannst, bist du bei uns genau richtig. Bewirb Dich noch heute!
 Über uns
 Die Portfolio Unit Digital Solutions mit weltweit rund 5.500 Mitarbeitern bietet datenzentrierte Business-Intelligence-Lösungen, u.a. auf Microsoft Azure basierend, an. Zum Einsatz kommen modernste Open Source Technologien sowie klassische Systeme wie Data Warehouse. Unsere Lösungen sind zugleich Gedächtnis und Gehirn der Digitalisierung. Immer mit dem Ziel, die Digitalisierungsstrategien unserer Kunden durch Analytics zum Erfolg zu bringen.
 Unser Geschäftsbereich "Automotive and Manufacturing Industries" ist ein wesentlicher Grund, warum T-Systems der führende IT-Anbieter in der deutschen Automobil-Branche ist. Wir erfinden, transformieren und betreuen geschäftskritische Systemlandschaften für unsere Kunden. Wir stellen uns den Herausforderungen von ständigen und tiefgreifenden Veränderungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Nachbareinheiten. Wir machen digitale Transformation mit einer agilen Denkweise, einem state-of-the-art Liefermodell und klarem Fokus auf Nachhaltigkeit.

Job_Title: Data Teamlead - Analytics / Data Engineering / Postgres / Python
Description:
About TL Digital Solutions GmbH: 
 We are on a mission to build the digital solution for delivery and transport coordination around the warehouse. We deliver technology for all cargo in transit to maximize operational efficiency by connecting buyers, suppliers and logistics service providers together in the cloud to keep track of information and delivery status – anytime, anywhere.
 
 We work remote-first with additional offices in Munich and Berlin. Join our passionate team to tackle the core problems of one of the largest industries in the world and work together with our experienced founders and passionate team all over the world, backed by Europe's leading VCs Point Nine, Fly Ventures and supply chain management experts.
  Your Responsibilities


You will be the leader of our Data & Analytics squad, working independently and interdisciplinary along with our teams. You are our first contact with any data related topics, and you will work alongside our CTO to build and grow a great Data & Analytics team
You together with your team design, integrate, maintain and own the data infrastructure, pipelines, Business Intelligence and Analytics to create insights across our teams
You help drive important tactical and strategic decisions based on evidence from our data
You hire and develop your team members, implement best practices, facilitate routines and communicate transparently how you progress


Your Profile


You have successfully completed a relevant degree and more than 5 years of experience in data engineering, analytics and BI - and you are enthusiastic about the challenges of the logistics industry
You can handle a modern data stack professionally. At TradeLink we work with: Airbyte, Airflow, Postgres, Redis, elasticsearch, Python and Jupyter, Metabase
You are an absolute communication talent, you have a high degree of empathy, you are committed, and you are interested in your interlocutors and their problems, you have a very good written and spoken command of English
You are characterised by a very high level of proactivity, an irrepressible hunger to learn and a constant desire to develop yourself further. Nothing throws you off track so quickly
You have a strong business as well as technical understanding, great leadership and organizational abilities, willingness to build professional relationships with staff and clients, as well as excellent communication, motivational and interpersonal skills
You love to be challenged and thrive in a fast-paced environment


Our Offer


Being part of an exceptionally fast-growing product-led venture that's up to something big. We are building a new type of company, a SaaS-enabled B2B network
A job and a team full of passion. Working alongside enthusiastic people motivates us and gives us gratitude
You will have lots of autonomy, flexible working hours, and a remote-first setup (optional offices in Munich and Berlin), which connects our team members across Europe
An extremely steep learning curve - we support your continuous development through individual learning opportunities, a diverse and international team of experts as well as experienced founders
With regular team events, we encourage our teams to connect within and outside of work for a great spirit
A phenomenal company culture, both remote and in our optional offices


Our job offer Data Lead for Global Trade Start-Up (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

Technik ist Ihre Welt? Dann machen Sie daraus doch einen Beruf!  In rund 140 Saturn Märkten deutschlandweit begeistern wir Kunden mit Unterhaltungselektronik und Haushaltsgeräten. Wir suchen Mitarbeiter/innen, die diese Begeisterung teilen und an unsere Kunden weitergeben.  Bei uns erwarten Sie viele abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und Möglichkeiten, die Sie beruflich weiterbringen. Und außerdem ein starkes Team, in dem Sie sich ganz schnell zu Hause fühlen werden. 
Aufgabe
Als Business Analyst (m/w/d) unterstützen Sie die Marktgeschäftsführung bei der Sicherstellung einer hohen Warenverfügbarkeit und der Optimierung der Lagerbestände – dabei stellen Sie die Verfügbarkeit für unsere Kunden sicher. Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören:  

Sie stellen eine hohe Warenverfügbarkeit, in Abstimmung mit der Marktgeschäftsführung, sicher. 
Sie optimieren laufend die Lagerbestände und gewährleisten, dass das Lager den vorgegebenen Anforderungen entspricht. 
Sie planen die Beschaffung für lokale Aktionen, die durch die Marktgeschäftsführung festgelegt werden, sowie für spezielle Kundenbestellungen.
 In Abstimmung mit der Marktgeschäftsführung gleichen Sie Wirtschaftlichkeitsziele permanent mit dem Ist-Zustand ab und leiten bei Abweichungen gegensteuernde Maßnahmen ein.
 Sie stellen einen kontinuierlichen Informationsfluss zur Warenbeschaffung/Sortimenten im Markt sicher.
 Sie arbeiten eng mit den verantwortlichen Bereichen der Hauptverwaltung zusammen, halten vorgegebene nationale Standardrichtlinien und -prozesse ein und setzen diese um.



Profil
Sie haben Freude am Umgang mit Menschen und Leidenschaft für innovative Technik. Dazu bringen Sie folgende Eigenschaften mit:  


Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt Handel, Controlling oder Category Management oder eine finanzwirtschaftliche Ausbildung (wie z. B Bankausbildung) 



Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Category Management & Finanzen und / oder Controlling wäre wünschenswert 



Sie bringen Verständnis für unser Geschäftsmodell sowie Kenntnisse und Trends der Consumer Electronics Branche mit 



Sie verfügen über hohe analytische Fähigkeiten 



Sie arbeiten organisiert, eigeninitiativ und ergebnisorientiert 



Sie gehen sicher mit MS Office - insbesondere Excel - um 



Sie sind ein Teamplayer und haben Spaß am gemeinsamen Erfolg 



 Wann?
 ab sofort

 Interesse?
 Passion for Retail! Wir bieten ein hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung sowie ein tolles Arbeitsumfeld mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und individuellen Aufstiegschancen.  Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen! www.saturn.de/karriere.

 Kontakt:
 Ansprechpartner: Herr Sechser  Saturn Electro Handels GmbH München-OEZ Bewerbung  Hanauer Str. 77 80993 München

#StandwithUkraine
 



Who are we?




  Are you keen on driving innovation? Do you thrive in a culture of diversity, collaboration and trust? Then let's care for tomorrow. At Allianz SE, you can count on having a voice, driving innovation and change and making an impact – for us, yourself and the world.
 

  For more about Allianz SE, Click Here.
 



Who will you be joining?




  Marketing Intelligence is part of Allianz Group Strategy, Marketing and Distribution.
   We transform data into insights about (potential) customers’ actions and motivations (what? why?), into strategic implications for Allianz (so what?), and into recommendations for actions (now what?) to increase profitability, growth and customer delight / loyalty.
   For example, we track how customers and potential customers see the Allianz brand around the world. We test and analyze whether marketing campaigns or partnerships, e.g. with the Olympics or FC Bayern, have the desired results. We help Allianz business to co-create and test products and journeys together with (potential) customers. We conduct research into future customer needs and behaviors. We turn these findings into useful analysis and recommendations to help Allianz to grow profitably.
   We are looking for an intern to support with data analysis and presentation as well as ad-hoc research tasks [….]. Based on current regulations, physical presence in the Munich office is required at least once a week.
 



How can you make an impact?




Collect data through primary and secondary research
Assemble, collate, analyze data, mainly in Excel
Make data & findings available to relevant stakeholders, through reports and PowerPoint presentations
Present insights to other departments and business units
Support other research requests the Marketing Intelligence Team might have



What are you made of?




Minimum Qualifications




Studying for a degree preferably in Market Research, Social Sciences, Statistics, Economics, Psychology, Marketing or a related field
Proficient in analysis tools, especially Excel; good PowerPoint skills; motivated to learn new skills as needed
Self-organized, highly motivated, attention to detail and able to meet deadlines
Open, willing to learn, hands-on, good team spirit





Need to know


Requirement for internship and working student positions is the enrollment in a university – or (for an internship) a gap year.
We can only consider your application if you provide the following documents:


  o Certificate of enrollment (exception gap year)
   o Valid work and residence permit (for non-EU citizens). Please kindly check before applying if you can work with your current VISA.
 



Do we have what you need?






    Flexible working arrangements (opportunity to work from home few days per week)
    


    Individual and Excellent career development opportunities/plans
    


    Family friendly working environment
    


    Health & well-being offerings
    


    Company pension & health insurance
    


    Multi-national, diverse and inclusive community
    


    Opportunity to make an impact on our sustainability initiatives
    



And there is much more! Find out more here: Allianz Careers
 

  For Application Tips & Tricks, find out more: Application Tip
 



  17209 | IT & Tech Engineering | Student | n.a. | Allianz SE | Full-Time | Temporary
 




Your application:




  Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
   We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
   We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
   Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

CHECK24 – Das Beste aus 2 Welten: Wir sind Deutschlands größtes Vergleichsportal und dynamisches Startup in einem. In kleinen agilen Teams arbeiten wir täglich in mehr als 50 Produkten daran, unseren über 15 Millionen Kunden das Leben zu erleichtern: Wir schaffen Transparenz, machen komplexe Produkte einfach verständlich und helfen Verbrauchern, Zeit und Geld zu sparen.  Wir suchen herausragende, analytisch versierte Talente, die sich einer außergewöhnlichen beruflichen Herausforderung mit vielfältigen Lernmöglichkeiten und schnellen Aufstiegschancen stellen möchten. Als Data Analyst (m/w/d) für die Suche arbeitest du dabei täglich eng mit der Geschäftsführung und allen Bereichen von CHECK24 zusammen, um in spannenden Projekten das Sucherlebnis für unsere Kunden zu optimieren.  Du hast Dein mathematisch-naturwissenschaftliches oder technisches Studium mit ausgezeichneten Ergebnissen abgeschlossen, möchtest die Online-Welt aus der Perspektive eines digitalen Vorreiters kennenlernen und strategische Weichenstellungen datengetrieben und analytisch vorbereiten? Dann möchten wir Dich kennenlernen und freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) für die Suche bei CHECK24 am Standort München!
 Zu Deinen Aufgaben zählen

Du übernimmst Verantwortung über die Definition und Weiterentwicklung eines kundenorientierten und Use Case-basierten KPI Reportings für die CHECK24 Suche
Außerdem bist Du verantwortlich für die Erhebung und Bereitstellung von Daten zur Entwicklung von Features in engem Austausch mit unserem Data Science Team.
Du schaffst eine ganzheitliche Datengrundlage und erstellst unterschiedliche KPI Dashboards für die Vorstandsebene und zahlreiche CHECK24 Unternehmen
Komplexe Daten analysierst und visualisierst Du für Dein Team und den Verantwortungsträger aus anderen Bereichen
Basierend auf Deinen Erkenntnissen leitest du Optimierungsprojekte für die CHECK24-Suche und Unternehmen ab und priorisierst diese Projekte mit der Geschäftsführung

Was Du mitbringst

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, Statistik, einem naturwissenschaftlichen oder technischen Studiengang
Du lebst und liebst Daten und bist in der Lage, wertvolle Insights aus großen Datenmengen zu generieren und prägnant zu visualisieren
Hands-On-Mentalität, Qualitätsanspruch sowie eine präzise, ergebnisfokussierte und eigenständige Arbeitsweise
Du bringst ein gutes Verständnis von Datenbankarchitekturen, Analysetools und Programmierung mit – Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse/ -visualisierung mit Tableau, PowerBI oder Ähnlichem ist von Vorteil
Hohe Web-Affinität, erste Berufserfahrung im E-Commerce/Online-Bereich von Vorteil
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in SQL-basierten ETL-Prozessen, insbesondere im Zusammenspiel mit Tools wie S3, Athena oder dbt
Verhandlungssicher Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Was wir Dir bieten

Wir bringen Dich voran: Wir bieten Dir ein Umfeld, in dem Du als High-Potential von den CHECK24 Gründern, erfahrenen Geschäftsführern und Product Ownern lernen kannst. Wir fördern Deine Entwicklung durch persönliches Coaching, sowie mit individuellen, fachlichen und persönlichen Trainingsangeboten.
Ownership für Deine Themen: Wir geben Dir viel Raum für Eigeninitiative. Bringe Deine Ideen aktiv ein und beeinflusse somit direkt den Erfolg von CHECK24 – als Data Analyst (m/w/d) der Suche mit Impact über eine Vielzahl an Produkten hinweg!
Wir sind auch neben der Arbeit ein super Team: Erfolge feiern wir gemeinsam auf zahlreichen Events wie unseren monatlichen Drinkouts sowie unseren Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeiern. Ob beim Kicker, Tischtennis oder beim After-Work-Get-Together: Teamspirit wird bei uns großgeschrieben!
Hier kannst Du Dich wohlfühlen: Durch unsere Duz-Kultur herrscht ein kollegiales und freundschaftliches Umfeld. Extras wie Getränke, Obst, Müsli oder Lunches sind bei uns selbstverständlich! Gutscheine für zahlreiche CHECK24 Produkte, eine bezuschusste betriebliche Altersversorgung und Sonderkonditionen in Fitness-Studios gibt es oben drauf.
Du findest leicht zu uns: Wir arbeiten an der Donnersbergerbrücke mit ausgezeichneter Verkehrsanbindung direkt an der Münchner Stammstrecke. Du kannst am Bike-Leasing-Programm teilnehmen oder mit einem von uns bezuschussten MVV-Ticket ins Büro kommen.





Kontakt 
Luisa Thiele
 luisa.thiele@check24.de
 

Bewerbungen bitte ausschließlich online über unser Bewerbungsformular senden.

Job_Title: Life Scientist - R&D Formulation, Small Molecules, Peptides
Description:
Work with us
R&D (Senior) Formulation Scientist, small molecules and peptides (f/m/d) Join our R&D team in Munich.
 
 Leukocare AG is a fast growing, international biotech company located in Martinsried near Munich and Milford, MA, USA. Based on our technology platform, we develop superior and innovative drug product formulations combining state-of-the-art analytical technologies with innovative bioinformatics approaches. Together with our partners within Pharma, Biotech and the Medical Devices sector we apply our formulation technologies and expertise to stabilize complex pharmaceutical molecules, proteins, vaccines and viral vectors as well as medical devices in a broad range of indications and settings.
 Primary Responsibilities

Hold the position of a project leader within formulation development projects in collaboration with our international clients in biopharmaceutical technology
Plan pharmaceutical formulation development projects and stability studies and execute them with the lab team, analyze data, execute data integrity checks and write reports
Prepare and elaborate scientific concepts, coordinate and assign tasks within the scientific development projects as well as continuously develop innovative technologies
Implement new lab-equipment and processes in close collaboration with the lab team

Requirement / Qualifications 

Professional experience in the fields of formulation development and/or product / process development and related analytics in the industrial environment
Degree in Life Science M.Sc. or PhD
Familiar with working in quality management systems
Ability to think creatively and to work as a team player with strong communication skills and being passionate about working in biotech industry
Fluent in both English and German

What we offer:
 We offer an exciting and impactful role in a highly professional, cooperative and appreciative international working environment, where you can actively help shaping the success of the company. We offer a flat organization, a competitive salary, flexible working hours including mobile working, a company pension scheme and last but by no means least a highly transparent company culture. As a growing company, we strive to hire, develop and keep our employees long-term.

Job_Title: Working Student - Data Analyst And Process Mining Architect
Description:
Processand is a global leader in process mining implementations and consulting services using Process Mining Technology and our own highly acclaimed Machine Learning Algorithms. Our forward-thinking and dynamic way of working makes us unique to our customers. 

 We are a young, upbeat and rapidly growing data analytics company based in Munich (Germany) with offices in Taiwan, the US and the Czech Republic. We can offer you an extremely exciting work environment and an opportunity to gain insights into some of the largest companies in the world with whom we work very closely. 

 We are expanding our Team in Munich and you could join our dynamic and international team of data analysts and process mining architects! If you analyzing data and are eager to work with some of the biggest enterprises on the market, you will fit right in at Processand. 

 Tasks 

 As a Working Student - Data Analyst and Process Mining Architect you will support our Data Analyst team in driving projects that focus on bringing transparency and added-value to our customers' digital business processes. You will help to find meaningful and innovative solutions to improve the most critical metrics that keep our customers ahead of the competition. 

 With your analytical skills you will help perform data transformation, develop analyses and derive business cases. Ideally you have already gained some experience in finance, sales, procurement, or other key business sectors and have a feeling of our customers' needs. 

 Besides improving your technical skills, you will learn how combining deep process and industry knowledge will help to develop new process mining use cases. Additionally, you will support Processand's international expansion and the development of our team by working on new strategic concepts. 

 Requirements 



You are a registered student in Computer Science / Information-oriented Business Administration, Data Analytics, Physics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program
Enjoy communication with teams and the solution of their problems motivates you
You distinguish yourself through your structured way of working with which you understand complex processes and can explain them in a simple way
You are king of presentation and communication and know exactly how to interact with our business partners
Have practical experience in a coding language like SQL and/or Python
IT affinity and a feel for sophisticated processes
Have very high standards towards your own work and communicate issues early on
Visionary approach with a sense of commitment to making a difference
Passion for working creatively and independently and solving complex issues
Fluent in German and have good communication skills in English
 Benefits 



An exciting position within a dynamic international setting
A passionate and upbeat work atmosphere with an innovative start-up spirit and high degree of personal responsibility
Flexible working hours and the ability to work from home
A weekly fresh fruit basket, free drinks, coffee, and tea
Work-life balance flexibility
An incredibly steep learning curve and very flat hierarchies
A motivated, passionate, and ambitious team
 Just send us your application including your cover letter, CV, certificates and include your earliest starting date! 

 You must be eligible to work in Germany on a unlimited basis. 

 We are looking forward to getting to know you.

Die consultY GmbH ist Ihr Partner für qualitativ hochwertige Personalberatung in den Bereichen IT/Neue Medien, Sales & Customer Service. Dank langjähriger Kompetenz und Erfahrung in der Auswahl und Entwicklung von Mitarbeitern, können wir Ihnen exzellente Branchenerfahrung und ein umfangreiches Netzwerk bieten – national als auch international. Mit der consultY GmbH haben Sie die geballte Erfahrung an Ihrer Seite sowie einen innovativen und vertrauenswürdigen Spezialisten. 

 Aufgaben 



Weiterentwicklung des Data Warehouse (Batch and Near-/Realtime), im Einzelnen:
Analyse, Umsetzung und Dokumentation im Data Ware House Umfeld.
Konzeption und Realisierung performanter Datenmodelle und -strukturen.
Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architekturstandards sowie die BI-Testkonzepte (Integration/Performance/Belastung)
Projektarbeit im interdisziplinären Team mit Auftraggeber, BI Analyst und IT-Betrieb

 Qualifikation 



Deutsche Sprachkenntnisse Min B1/B" oder besser
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik oder Ingenieurs/Naturwissenschaften.
mind. 3 Jahre Erfahrung und gute Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen (SQL/Python) und Datenbanksystemen (Oracle)
Erfahrung und gute Kenntnisse in BI Data Warehouse Architekturen und relevanten Tools: Wherescape,Kafka,Flink)
Fundierte Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenmodellierung (Data Vault 2) und den hierfür benötigten Werkzeugen.
Sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
Teamfähigkeit, ausgeprägte Kommunikationskompetenz, strategische Denkweise, Überzeugungskraft.
 Benefits 



Attraktives Gehaltspaket
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Arbeiten im Büro, von zu Hause oder wo immer du eine Internetverbindung hast
Vielfältiges Weiterbildungsangebot
Wasser und Kaffee kostenlos
(Inter-)nationale Karriereperspektiven
Zuschuss zu ÖPNV, Car- & Bike- Leasing

Job_Title: Für Freelancer: Data Scientist / Optimizing Ml Algorithms
Description:
Freelancer Projekt - 
Für einen meiner Kunden suche ich gerade einen Data Scientist, der sich um die ML-basierte Optimierung von Content kümmern kann. 


Folgende Aufgaben erwarten Sie:


Definition von algorithmischen oder stochastischen Optimierungsproblemen
Datenexploration und -aufbereitung mit Libraries wie Pandas und Numpy oder mit PostgreSQL
Lösen von Optimierungsproblemen mit verschiedenen Ansätzen wie linearer coding, constraint coding oder genetischen Algorithmen
Integration von Optimierungsfunktionen in eine Cloud-basierte Anwendung (AWS)

Mit diesen Qualifikationen sind Sie bestens vorbereitet:


Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Umfeld der Data Science
Starke Skills im Coding mit Python
Know-How in verschiedenen Wegen der Optimierung von Algorithmen
Expertise im Definieren und Lösen von Optimierungsproblemen mit Python
 Sollte das Projekt für Sie interessant sein, können Sie mir gerne eine Mail mitsamt Ihres aktuellen CVs zukommen lassen. Bei einem Telefonat können wir uns dann über Details unterhalten. 

 Ich freue mich von Ihnen zu hören! 
Freelancer

THIS IS WHERE YOU FIT IN.As a subsidiary of the largest Italian IT service provider Engineering SpA, headquartered in Rome, Engineering ITS GmbH is represented by 250 employees at 9 locations in Germany. We are a strategic partner for our customers in digitizing their existing business models and identifying new market opportunities.
We are expanding our business field in the area of software development and are looking for you as Applied Data Scientist (m/f/d) for our locations in Munich and Berlin.Applied Data Scientists are inherently interdisciplinary individuals with a strong understanding of data science methods and algorithms as well as a solid grasp of the platforms needed to implement them to provide actionable solutions to problems in complex business domains.Are you experienced with engineering and operationalizing reproducible, testable, and evolvable data science-powered software with a proven track record in the German healthcare market or German public space? Then we should get to know each other!
WHAT WILL YOU DO.

You´ll shape the data platform and its infrastructure using best of breed approaches to address broad business needs
You`ll become the subject matter expert and partner with business stakeholders and engineers to define and operationalize data-driven solutions
You`ll align with other experts within the Engineering Group
You`ll coach and support other team members across the company

WHAT WILL YOU BRING.

You have Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or computer engineering
You have domain knowledge in the German healthcare market and/ or German public space
You have experience with common public cloud provider stacks to deliver scalable actionable AI- and machine learning-based solutions using cloud native computing
Proven project track record and certifications for at least one of those stacks
You have a solid understanding of analytical and operational systems for modern business intelligence, multimodal data processing as well as artificial intelligence and machine learning to build data-powered products and enable data-driven decision making
You have the ability to steer projects with polyglot software engineering and data modeling methods, including low-code/no-code solutions
You are passionate about the business and problem domain, curious about data
You are a strategic and lateral thinker, able to tailor innovative solutions to complex requirements

Engaging and proactive collaborator

You are fluent in English and German, spoken and written

WHAT WE OFFER.We guide and support companies in their digital transformation towards a successful future - as innovative business consultants, software developers and IT specialists. With 360° competencies in all future-oriented state-of-the-art topics such as AI, augmented reality, blockchain, cloud, cybersecurity, data, digital platforms, Internet of Things and robotics.In return, our customers enjoy ENGINEERING's typical, complete plan-build-run support: from highly qualified business, process and IT consulting to on-site and near-shore software development and system integration to managed operations in all stages of expansion.

We are an internationally positioned and motivated team.
We work flexibly in the office, at customer sites or remotely, without bureaucratic hurdles.
We work in flat hierarchies and with personal responsibility
We offer you an attractive salary and additional benefits, such as a company pension plan and capital-forming benefits.
We pull together and celebrate successes
We are socially committed and also support the commitment of our employees.
We are family-friendly and promote a healthy work-life balance with our flexible working time models and attractive vacation arrangements.
We offer many different corporate benefits in areas such as culture, fashion, leisure, finance, technology and much more.
We offer you an attractive bike leasing with our partner JobRad

WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?You find yourself in this description and would like to become another driver of ENGINEERING's growth? Then send us your meaningful application with your desired salary to Jana Raisch. We will contact you within the next 3 - 5 working days.
Questions about the application? Jana will be happy to answer them!
We are looking forward to you and your application!
Job Type: Full-time

Job_Title: Claims Expert – Portfolio Analyst & Product Owner
Description:
Claims Expert – Portfolio Analyst & Product Owner (m/f/d) * 

Location  Munich , Germany 

Would you like to be part of our diverse Global Claims community with a passion for delivering excellent service to our clients and shaping the future of Claims within Munich Re?
 Our Claims team manages and monitors primary insurance claims portfolios as well as providing claims consulting services to Munich Re’s clients globally. As the team is growing, we are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated claims expert to focus on portfolio analysis and developing digital claims technologies for our international team.
 Among your varied activities, you will support our claims analyst in decision-making, identify claims leakage, generate claims reports for the business units, and drive a collaborative approach to delivering innovative solutions for Munich Re’s Claims operations and its clients. You will have the opportunity to help drive the digital transformation claims management and support new business initiatives to ensure that MR Claims achieve their Ambition 2025.

Your job 

Data collecting, mapping, analytics and maintaining consistency across all clients’ data as well as making data accessible to internal partners
Validating metrics and data quality to ensure calculations are accurate
Creating reports analysing claims portfolios in support of internal oversite activities
Managing end-to-end data flow as project manager for our clients
Acting as a product owner for innovative claims management tools
Creating roadmaps for the life cycle of data projects
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, detecting trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Assisting with the preparation of loss runs and claims selection for audits and due diligences
Participating in special projects and ad hoc reporting, as required

Your profile 

Associate degree/BA or equivalent relevant work experience
Excellent command and hands-on experience in Excel, PowerBI, Azure DevOps, VBA and DAX. Knowledge of SQL and R is an advantage
Good experience in developing visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI
Experience connecting to data sources, importing data and transforming data
Knowledge of primary insurance claims management
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience as a product owner and proven project track record in generating and implementing business solutions
Very good understanding of processes, workflows and data structures
Good experience in project management in combination with excellent analytical, conceptual and communication skills
Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment, results-driven and practical approach to work products
Excellent organisational, multi-tasking and time management skills
Proactive in identifying process improvements and adaptive to change
Business-fluent English; additional European languages are an advantage

About us 

As the world's leading reinsurance company with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into a manageable risk we enable fundamental change. Join us working on topics today that will concern society tomorrow, whether that be climate change, major construction projects, medical risk assessment or even space travel. Together we embrace a culture where multiskilled teams dare to think big. We create the new and the different for our clients and cultivate innovation. Sounds like you? Make it happen and be part of Munich Re.

You will work in an environment where we think big: Change and culture are continuously role-modeled. We create and articulate a compelling and ambitious shared purpose, vision and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning
You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders
We communicate in a clear & authentic way: We interact with a positive and humble spirit. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn
You will grow with your clients: Whatever our role, we support business, in an efficient and effective way, to create value for our clients. We embrace new ways of working leveraging digitalization to deliver solutions
Join us, and experience that we lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to be capable of joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged



Münchener Rückversicherungs-Gesellschaft Marika Schwertner Human Resources Königinstraße 107 80802 München GERMANY





     Apply now! 
    



     Apply for this Job! 
    





Munich Re not only stands for fairness with regard to its clients; it is also an equal opportunities employer. Severely disabled candidates will also be prioritised, if equally qualified.

About the role


Lead Data Scientist 
Germany – Munich Hybrid - Flexible home working
 €75,000 - €100,000
 Fluent German required
 The role:

Translate business needs into practical data science, you define and deliver the long-term and short-term vision of the Data Science team
You work closely with Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and other teammates to deliver the best data products and processes end-to-end
Identify business opportunities, and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive business growth
Answer complex analytic questions from data sets to help the business shape its products & services in a better way.

Requirements:

As a critical and strategic thinker, who understands complex problems quickly & utilizes available evidence to come up with solutions.
4-5 years minimum experience with Machine learning & Statistical methods within commercial projects.
5 years of experience in exploratory data analysis & time series analysis as well as a good understanding of machine learning methods.
Background in mathematics, physics, statistics, software engineering, or a related discipline

Job_Title: Data Analyst In Market Research  Azse #Standwithukraine
Description:
Department description / job purpose / role:



 Marketing Intelligence is part of Allianz Group Strategy, Marketing and Distribution.
   We transform data into insights about (potential) customers’ actions and motivations (what? why?), into strategic implications for Allianz (so what?), and into recommendations for actions (now what?) to increase profitability, growth and customer delight / loyalty.
 



  For example, we track how customers and non-customers see the Allianz brand around the world. We test and analyze whether marketing campaigns or partnerships, e.g. with the Olympics or FC Bayern, have the desired results. We build dashboards so that Allianz businesses around the world can make decisions based on the same data. We help Allianz business to co-create and test products and journeys together with (potential) customers. We conduct research into future customer needs and behaviors. We turn these findings into useful analysis and recommendations to help Allianz to grow profitably.
 



  Based on current regulations, physical presence in the Allianz Munich office is required as needed, and at a minimum once every week. The position can be shared if two qualified candidates can be found who each want to work part time.
 



Key responsibilities:




Collect data through primary and secondary research
Assemble, collate, analyze data
Make data & findings available to relevant stakeholders, e.g through dashboards or reports
Work closely with other data analysts across GSMD and the wider Allianz to make sure data is integrated, coherent and accessible
Present insights to other departments and OEs
Support other research requests the Marketing Intelligence Team might have




Qualification:




Degree preferably in Market Research, Social Sciences, Statistics, Economics, or a related field
Proficient in analysis tools, especially Excel; Power BI (DAX); Excel; R; solid PowerPoint skills; motivated to learn new skills as needed




Experience & Key skills:




Minimum of two years’ work experience in a relevant role
Self-organizing, highly motivated and able to meet deadlines
Keen learner, flexible and with much attention to detail
Hands-on; good team spirit





Additional Information:




  We offer: Career development programs, Workwell@AllianzSE, Flexible working arrangements
   Senior Recruiter: Ms. Daniela Lindig : +49 89 3800 2345 / +49 152 09261520
 



  Please submit your applications only via our online tool.
 

  We support Ukrainian and Russian job-seeking refugees looking for a new job - your applications are welcome
 



   17357 | IT & Tech Engineering | Professional | Allianz SE | Full Time or Part Time | Permanent
 



   Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
 



  We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
   We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
 



  Join us. 
  Let's care for tomorrow.



 Note: Diversity of minds is an integral part of Allianz’ company culture. One means to achieve diverse teams is a regular rotation of Allianz Executive employees across functions, Allianz entities and geographies. Therefore, the company expects from its employees a general openness and a high motivation to regularly change positions and collect experiences across Allianz Group.

Job_Title: Controller - Business Intelligence / Saas / Analyses / Budget Process
Description:
About tribe29 GmbH: 
 We are the creator of Checkmk, a leading open source monitoring software. We are a strong team of software developers, technicians, open source enthusiasts and nerds who are passionate about helping companies of all sizes to run their complex IT infrastructures reliably. We are growing quickly both in our German home market and internationally.
 
 As one of the leading providers of IT monitoring solutions, our software ‘Checkmk’ monitors millions of systems and software applications in your multi-clouds, data centers or even in smaller IoT devices. Over 2,600 paying customers use the Checkmk Enterprise Edition on a daily basis, and our Open Source version has tens of thousands of users worldwide. By working closely with this community, we ensure that our product really helps our customers.
  We are the company behind “Checkmk”, one of the leading IT monitoring solutions. It is our passion to support small, medium and large companies in monitoring their complex and distributed IT infrastructure – the backbone of the modern world. Our software creates transparency on the availability and performance of millions of devices and services in large data centers an cloud environments. Tens of thousands of users in the open source community and a rapidly growing base of over 3,000 enterprise customers globally already have their systems monitored with Checkmk.
 Your Responsibilities


You assume responsibility for continuous improvement and delivery of our SaaS-KPI reporting for management and investors
You work together with our data science team in building the data basis for enhanced KPI-analyses
You run the periodic cost and billings analyses for our company and its US subsidiary for internal and external audiences
You run ad-hoc analyses on our sales and financial data to support internal stakeholders (e.g., to determine priority customer segments, to fine-tune pricing and sales strategies, etc.)
You support the annual budget process and run continuous gap to target analyses
You work closely together with accounting and our financial auditors to deliver the annual audit in time and adapt internal processes according to lessons learned


Your Profile


You hold a degree in business administration, industrial engineering, finance, economics, or a related field with a strong financial and analytical background
You have 2+ years experience in a relevant role
You have a good understanding of financial KPIs, management accounting, and controlling
You are proficient in Excel or Google Sheets and like to work hands-on with data
You have a strong working knowledge of an enterprise BI software, such as Power BI, Tableau or similar, and ideally have been involved in setting up the main dashboards during implementation/in an early phase
You have a structured approach towards solving problems, critically assess the status quo and keep the balance between what is desirable and what is actually feasible
You are able to translate general questions from business functions into meaningful analyses based on available data
You do not take analyses at face value but question your results in order to provide meaningful context and identify root causes for unexpected results
You are business fluent in English, a fair command of German would be a plus
Former experience in a growth company, ideally in a SaaS environment paired with a good understanding of the relevant KPIs and metrics, would be a plus


We offer
 We are a dynamic, fast growing and easy-going company where positive collaboration is very important. We are more than just colleagues; we have a strong team and a great customer community. For us, high autonomy and flat hierarchies are not just words on paper, but everyday life. With us you don’t work as one of hundreds or on purely theoretical questions but have an immediate positive influence. With our product, we make the lives of thousands of administrators easier and help them in coping with the increasing complexity of IT. Our customers love our product and your work helps to keep it that way! 

The chance to make a decisive impact and shape the future of a dynamic, fast growing tech company while growing with your tasks and responsibilities
High flexibility between mobile work and an office in one of the most beautiful, central districts of Munich
An agile Team that embodies autonomy and fast decision-making within flat hierarchies
A unique corporate culture where we emphasize equity, diversity and inclusion
A personal budget for trainings and learnings
A product and company customers love
A wide range of education and training opportunities
Flexible and family-friendly working conditions
Regular events of all sorts in a familiar atmosphere


Our job offer Controller for IT Monitoring Solution (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

What you'll do


 Creation of the data strategy and goals. This includes data analytics, machine learning and predictive analytics.
 Design and implementation of all data science measures.
 Evaluate and decide on software and tools for use in data science.
 Design and optimization of relevant data, data warehouse systems, machine learning and business intelligence.
 Operational design of data collection and analysis .
 Creating performance dashboards, analytics requirements and product success reports.
 Conducting regular insights sessions for your Ory colleagues.
 Participate in strategy sessions with Ory management.


 Your profile


 Fluent in written and spoken English.
 A strong passion for the internet and data privacy, security and transparency.
 A strong understanding of customer needs and a drive to provide them with sustainable solutions.
 Two to three years of professional experience in data science or data analytics.
 An excellent understanding of conversion funnels and customer journeys.
 Hands-on experience with analytics software and machine learning.
 A strong affinity for data and strong analytical skills.
 A very good understanding of web technologies such as the web APIs.
 Experience with programming languages for data analysis with e.g. Python and SQL.


 Why Ory?
 Ory is an engineering company with a high degree of freedom and autonomy. You will be working with experienced, helpful, and talented peers who all share a deep passion for software. Ory is just starting and there are countless opportunities and constant work in progress. We support each other in our curiosity and creativity which we pursue through thoughtful discussion, transparency, and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues. We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. We are looking for people with passion, curiosity, and integrity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience does not precisely match the job description. Your skills and curiosity will stand out and set you apart. Interested? Drop us a short introductory email to jobs@ory.sh and please make sure to include a link to your GitHub profile.
 With more than 20,000 members, Ory is the leading open-source authentication identity management, account registration, login and authorization ecosystem and community in the world. Our commercial product Ory Network combines our open-source know-how and provides additional value add services on top. With this we establish a global zero trust, scalable and secure platform for managing identities and its distribution across various internet services, including IoT. Ory is a modern software start-up founded in 2019 that promotes an open, diverse, and collaborative working culture.
